company_info: VDL ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES GROUP (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. is a subsidiary of the VDL Group, an international industrial company with its headquarters in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. The company started its operations in 1970 as a manufacturer of machine parts used in factory automation and assemblies for its then-parent company. Over the years, we haveaccumulated valued competencies that has enabled us to grow as an equipment manufacturer. Today, we are a world-class capital equipment contract manufacturing company operating worldwide, employing committed people to provide our customers in the semiconductor and LED equipment industries with innovative and unique technological solutions and logistical services. With our rapid expansion and new facility, we seek dynamic and like-minded individuals to join us. Advance the world of engineering possibilities, realize your potential and succeed with us here at VDL Enabling Technologies Group.
description:

Lead and develop the department to meet our customers’ expectations (present and future) in product quality, performance, lead-time and cost – supporting the company’s goal in highest customer satisfaction and profitability.
Key areas of responsibilities:
Define the operational strategies of the department to support the long and short-term objectives of the company.
To define clear responsibilities and accountability of direct reports and ensure effective deployment of goals to the different levels of the department.
To continuously improve the operational performance of the department (quality, lead-time, delivery performance, costs and safety).
To identify and develop the core competencies of staff.

To define the technology roadmap and recommend the investment of new technology and machines to stay ahead of the competition.

Knowledge of Parts Manufacturing production management
Knowledge of risk management and safety regulations
Leadership skills
Strong project management skills

Knowledgeable of lean/six sigma methodology.

Benefits Summary:

Joo Koon
Responsibilities:
Responsible for leading, planning, coordinating, and developing the Out-Going Quality Assurance team on policies, procedures and implementations to ensure machine quality before shipment.

Out-Going testing/ inspection process for machine acceptance or reject before delivery to customer.
Machine defect/ non-compliance process for reject resolution.

Test / Inspection methodology
Tools and facilities for test / inspection

Establish, collect and maintain records to provide evidence of conformity to requirements.

title: Associate Product Manager
company_info: Airwallex facilitates the transformation of businesses from offline to online, from local to global. Airwallex was built with a single purpose in mind – to create a world where all businesses can operate without borders and restrictions, and by doing so, propel the growth of the global digital economy.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The product organisation is at the core of Airwallex, bringing together commercial strategy, engineering, design, and financial compliance to deliver Airwallex’s product suite to a customer audience around the world. We care about perfection in the details and creating first-class products at a global scale. Our Product members are creative and dynamic problem solvers who dive into new challenges daily and can communicate across all levels of the organisation.

This role will be part of the online payments product team, building out our online payments capabilities that enable businesses to collect credit card and other forms of payments on their website or app from consumers around the world. As part of this role, you will likely work on various different projects to improve the experience of businesses using online payments, such as:
Creating easy-to-understand user experiences for businesses to set up, monitor and operate their online stores with Airwallex online payments
Reducing integration efforts for businesses to get started with Airwallex through different integration methods and excellent product/ API documentation
Building solutions for platforms and marketplaces that want to enable online payments for merchants on their platform/ marketplace
For this, you will collaborate closely with other product managers, engineering teams and other stakeholders in the business. You will take projects from idea to successful launch and adoption and will be ultimately responsible for the customer's success.

Requirements:
Computer Science (or other STEM) Bachelor's degree or above with a competitive GPA
A minimum of one internship in a top-flight tech company or consultancy
Fluent in English & Mandarin; written and spoken
Solid technical understanding and ability to engage in architectural discussions with engineering teams
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey product strategy to both technical and non-technical audiences
High attention to detail, ability to structure complex problems and inform decisions with data and first-principle insights
Drive, grit and persistence necessary to take ownership and move ideas to reality in short periods of time
Ability to thrive in cross-cultural and cross-functional teams

title: Senior Product Manager, Digital
company_info: Scholastic is a global company with operations in 13 countries and exports to nearly every country in the world. Today, Scholastic is the undisputed world leader in bringing books and educational materials of the highest quality to children, and it does so in over 150 countries around the world. Scholastic Inc. is the world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books and a leader in educational technology and children's media. Scholastic creates quality educational and entertaining materials and products for use in school and at home, including children's books, magazines, technology-based products, teacher materials, television programming, ﬁlm, videos and toys. Recognizing that literacy is the cornerstone of a child's intellectual, personal and cultural growth, the company upholds a corporate mission to help children around the world to read and learn. Scholastic has recognized the importance of working with public, private, and non-profit organizations that share its mission and goals to improve the well-being of children. Scholastic's total commitment to social responsibility and educational outreach is demonstrated by its diverse partnerships, which address today's most critical issues facing communities, with an emphasis on reading and literacy.

title: Robotics Product Manager
company_info: Fabrica.ai invents and builds automatic tile grouting robots to boost construction productivity and currently pilots on construction sites in Singapore managed by Woh Hup, BHCC, Gin Chia, Soilbuild, and Dragages. This should correspond to about 30% of the Singaporean market. We have early leads in the US and Europe as well. Tile grouting is the process of filling up the gaps between tiles after the tiles have been laid. Grouting is part of virtually every construction project. It is a highly laborious process and one of the most physically damaging tasks in the trade as it hurts tilers’ knees and back. Thus, quality issues would also arise. Our robots are able to grout most given spaces without much issues, we should be ready for mass deployment soon. timelapse: https://drive.google.com/file/d/18N5IF3u6noZfoIzX3Ua7cUbc3O7cCmSx/view?usp=sharing Recently, we had a Presentation to Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7034394354731413504 We have also raised 850k USD from Hoxton Ventures to enable our development in not just our tile grouting robots but also other forms of construction automation. This is in addition to our pre-seed round from our Cambridge University Professor and the owner of BHCC. In addition to Singapore, members of Fabrica AI can be found in Czech Republic, UK (including Cambridge), US, and Switzerland. Tile grouting would serve as a stepping stone for us to expand into other forms of construction automation.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Fabrica AI is creating a future where ideating and developing a robot for any task takes days, not years. We believe that by training end to end controls in simulation with reinforcement learning and above that iterating hardware designs, we can automate the whole development process. At the current stage, the most important resource is a large fleet of robots to validate our approaches for our AI system and to collect data. This would help keep us grounded in reality.
To start building up the fleet, we invented an automatic tile grouting robot that boosts productivity by 5x and are piloting it on construction sites in Singapore managed by Woh Hup, BHCC, Gin Chia, Soilbuild, and Dragages. This should correspond to about 30% of the Singaporean market. We have early leads in the US and Europe as well. Tile grouting is the process of filling up the gaps between tiles after the tiles have been laid. Grouting is part of virtually every construction project and a highly laborious process, is considered one of the most physically damaging tasks resulting in tilers’ knees and back issues, and thus quality issues would also arise. We invented a patent pending robot that is able to automatically grout and clean tile gaps with only a press of a button. The operators would only need to reload grout and water.
We have also pitched at the Built Environment Demo Day 2022 organised by BCA as part of the International Built Environment Week (IBEW) and won the Rising Star Award. IBEW has drawn more than 10,000 individuals from over 100 countries.
Recently, we had a Presentation to Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7034394354731413504
We have also raised 850k USD from Hoxton Ventures to enable our development in not just our tile grouting robots but also other forms of construction automation.
Website: https://www.fabrica.ai/ Latest Demo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MoOgIkGSc28&ab_channel=FabricaAI
Your role would be to help integrate various stakeholders working on our Automatic Tile Grouting Robot as it moves towards industrial production. You may be remunerated with a combination of salary and share options. This role requires a significant amount of technical understanding/engineering interest.
Job Description:
Work across various technology team(s) (Mechanical, Electrical, Firmware, Software, Manufacturing)
Define, analyze and communicate platform product roadmap aligned with business objectives and supported by business cases, market research, customer data and competitive analysis
Product owner responsibilities within an agile team, specifically documenting user requirements by speaking to industry players, ground workers, understanding the various processes around or related to tile grouting to help us shape our solution, especially from an operational point of view
Make data/ROI-driven decisions
Collaborate with the Executive Team to further refine the product vision, strategy and metrics, and define business and technical product requirements.
Set up new systems within the company
Visiting industry trial sites to test our robot and giving appropriate feedback and ideas on what we could improve on
Connecting manufacturers and our R&D team to build and iterate on our prototype, creating new avenues for manufacturing at scale, manufacturing for reliability
Drive multiple projects forward at different development stages by:
Managing day to day internal and external meetings, tasks, and actions
Creating and maintaining project schedules
Tracking and actively managing risks and issues
Helping to generate requirements documentation, communicate them to the appropriate teams, and ensure timely cross-functional execution.
Iterating on requirements, tasks and documentation through results from sprints and new learnings - and updating our systems to further speed up iteration
Facilitating certification of robotics products
Managing DFM process and tooling kick-off with suppliers
Planning and executing on early prototype builds as well as larger-scale engineering and design verification builds
Managing smooth handovers between teams
A great candidate would possess the following:
Prior Industrial Engineering experience
Understanding of systems engineering
Familiar with Agile Methodologies
Experience working in a cross-functional team (Mechanical, Electrical, Firmware, Software)
Value the direct impact on the product and proximity to clients at a startup and the growth potential of a startup
Willing to work without a very well defined job scope and willing to adapt to changes week on week
Ability to think of metrics to measure progress and deciding based on back of the envelope calculations
Keenness to do more than is expected, impact driven
Growth mindset driven
Our development process is very iterative and agile. Thus, there would not be a concrete plan more than 2 weeks ahead and your role/tasks is/are likely to evolve over time. If you like this process, you’d be a good fit for us. You would thus play a significant part in deciding how your work would contribute to our overall goals. Please email your resume to careers@fabrica.ai if you are interested. Thank you.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Regional Product Manager, Robotics

Job Summary
As Product Manager manage Robotics BU in product marketing to effectively ensure achievement of business plan/set target objective in terms of sales, profitability, and sustainability.
Responsible for managing and implementing marketing activities through strategics plan, research, and action plan implementation.
Ensure adherence to set systems thereby ensuring a professional approach to entire robot business activity.
Key Accountabilities

1. Marketing:
Formulate efficient & intuitive Go-to-market strategy for sales with Robotics BU management.
Market research including competitors’ info and customer’s feedback on our products features/improvements etc. back to RHQ & HQ.
Marketing tools preparation (product presentations, success cases, videos, demo units, websites …)
Event management (Seminars, webinars, exhibitions, road shows etc.) with robot country teams and Brand & communication (B&C)
Marketing collateral based on industry strategy.
2. Digital Marketing:
Digital Campaigns, Integrated marking communications, Robotics website updates with B&C team etc. Write copy for diverse marketing distributions (brochures, press releases, linked-in articles, success stories, website material etc.)
3. Product Management:
New product launches, Product EOL communication, Demo Kits for market (Exhibition, partners, end customer)
4. Price management:
Setting prices at regional level and country level, Loading same into the systems, Special price requests to Japan, price approval with internal forms & systems.
5. Budget management:
Working with Managers for budget preparation & system entry, Sales gap analysis and forecast every quarter & monthly monitoring against plan. Confirm the budget plan data entry & report to managers periodically.
6. Conduct market research and analysis to evaluate trends, brand awareness and competition ventures. Preparation of monthly marketing, sales reports etc.

7. People management – 2-3 teams of admin and marketing members to be managed smoothly.

Key Job Requirements Job / Skills Competencies
Creative, Innovative & Challenge driven.
Industrial Robot knowledge and experience will be an added advantage.
Excellent communication, commercial skills, People skills & Team working culture.
Project Management; Able to relate & close working with various internal, external stakeholders.
Good understanding of market research techniques, data analysis and statistics methods
Knowledge of strategic planning and marketing best practices
Familiar with digital marketing, social media, and web analytics
Proficient in MS Office and marketing software (e.g., CRM, SAP)
Willing to travel 30-40% regionally.
Critical Work Experience
At least 3-5 years of product manager experience on the job preferably robotics/automation multinational company experience
Qualifications
Bachelor of Engineering in Mechanical/ Robotics & Automation/Electronics/Mechatronics. MBA (Marketing Management/Digital Marketing/Business Administration) will be an added advantage.

title: Lead AI Product Manager
company_info: The National University of Singapore aspires to be a vital community of academics, researchers, staff, students and alumni working together in a spirit of innovation and enterprise for a better world. Our singular focus on talent will be the cornerstone of a truly great university that is dedicated to quality education, influential research and visionary enterprise, in service of country and society.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description
AI Singapore (AISG) is a national AI programme launched by the National Research Foundation (NRF) to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence (AI).

The programme office is hosted by the National University of Singapore (NUS) and brings together all Singapore-based research institutions and the vibrant ecosystem of AI start-ups and companies developing AI products to perform use-inspired research, grow the knowledge, create the tools, and develop the talent to power Singapore's AI efforts.

As Lead AI Product Manager, you will have the opportunity to foster the use of AI in Singapore by working with our stakeholders and building AI products. You will design the specifications and data AI engineers need to deploy such products, and work with various stakeholders to ensure execution.

To succeed you must understand both our stakeholders and how AI might solve their problems. You will also be mentoring other product managers and AI engineers, as well as setting best practices.

Duties & Responsibilities
Lead overall product initiatives.
Develop AI Singapore’s framework for product design and management.
Work with companies to define the problems to solve with AI. Help prioritize and rank the solutions and develop business cases.
Work with and organize experts from business lines, data scientists, and engineers to create shared goals and specs for AI products.
Perform gap analysis on existing data. Identify new data sources.
Develop and manage training, validation, and test data sets.
Help stakeholders productionize results of AI products.
Develop AI product roadmaps and timelines.
Mentor and build the product team.
Qualifications
Recognized Degree with Basic statistics skills acquired through academic study (i.e. math, computer science, engineering, economics, physics) or comparable work experience.
At least 5 -10 years’ experience working on enterprise products as a lead developer, data scientist manager, or product manager.
Experience defining and developing a new product or service.
Demonstrated desire and experience mentoring and building high-performing and motivated teams.
Demonstrated commitment to learning about AI through your own initiatives through courses, books, or side projects.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Certis
We are a leading security services organisation. We put technology to work in making the world a safer place. Our mission is that as trusted partners, we protect lives and assets, and deliver integrated critical services. By empowering our people, our goal is to enable our communities to stay safe and thrive.
We offer a broad range of opportunities and career pathways for our people to grow and explore their potential. We believe that people, equipped with innovative thinking and technological capabilities will make our world safer, smarter and better.
Life at Certis
If you are a passionate individual looking for opportunities to expand your skills, and purposeful work instead of just a ‘job’, we would love to hear from you.
At Certis, no two days look alike. Our work calendars are filled with chances to collaborate with others, and bring new initiatives to life. Whether you’re looking to improve a process, or have an innovative idea awaiting a technology solution, we want you to bring your ideas to the table.
We are a close-knit team that looks out for each other, works hard to get the job done, and encourages each other to grow – the perfect place for you to grow your career!
Roles and Responsibilities
Take ownership of the manpower product portfolio, driving strategic product management decisions.
Ensure precision in costing and pricing strategies during tender processes and quotations to facilitate effective management choices.
Foster strong collaboration with various departments such as operations, finance, and sales to guarantee consistent and accurate costing.
Develop innovative pricing strategies, conducting comprehensive scenario and sensitivity analyses to optimize product pricing.
Perform in-depth market analysis to assess product competitiveness and identify opportunities for improvement.
Stay informed about market trends, customer needs, and industry best practices to guide product portfolio enhancements.
Demonstrate flexibility and adaptability by willingly taking on additional responsibilities as needed within the organization.
Skills & Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, or a related discipline.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to perform scenario and sensitivity analysis for pricing strategies.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills to work effectively across departments.
Detail-oriented and capable of maintaining accuracy under tight deadlines.
Independent and self-motivated, thriving in fast-paced environments and consistently meeting deadlines.
Recognition & Award
What you can expect from us:
Work on world-class security projects renowned for their safety, reliability and efficiency
Commitment to your ongoing development, including on-the-job opportunities, formal programs and assistance with further education
Community volunteering opportunities
A competitive remuneration package, featuring performance-based incentives and a medical insurance and dental allowance.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As our Senior Cybersecurity Product Manager, you will lead the charge in driving innovation and enhancing our suite of internal security products. These tools are the backbone of our defense against threats from various sources. By collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will shape our cybersecurity offerings, ensuring they align with our evolving business and regulatory landscape while continuously safeguarding our network from potential cyber threats.
Job Description
Spearhead the analysis, design, and iterative improvement of internal cybersecurity platforms and entire products life cycle.
Consolidate existing risk management tools and take the lead in designing and deploying our internal audit risk control platform.
Define a visionary cybersecurity product roadmap encompassing both short-term and long-term objectives.
Proactively engage with the compliance team to gain insights into compliance requirements across diverse businesses and integrate them into our product strategy.
Interface with relevant internal stakeholders to collect and analyze their security product needs, translating them into actionable plans.
Generate detailed Product Requirement Documents (PRD) and, in close collaboration with the engineering team, oversee product launches and feature enhancements.
Create comprehensive product guide documentation and organize product training sessions to enhance the understanding of product features and advantages among internal teams.
Drive market research for product innovation.
Requirements
At least a Bachelor degree in computer science, information technology, programming and system analysis.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in an Information Security Product Management role.
Familiarity with security products and deep insights into at least one of the following products: SOC, SIEM, DLP, UEBA, S-SDLC, IDS, NDR.
Exceptional project management and teamwork skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks in a multi-tasking environment.
Strong communication skills, capable of effective interactions with team members at all levels and external partners.
Proficiency in project management and product design tools such as Jira, Confluence, Figma, or Axure.
Preferred Experience
Previous work experience in top-tier internet companies.
Experience in designing platforms for staff behavior monitoring and risk control.

title: Product Manager, BytePlus Recommend - 2024 Start

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
BytePlus is a business unit in ByteDance and provides intelligent platform services powered by industry-leading research in emerging technologies. From data analytics tools to computer vision software, BytePlus solutions enable businesses to reach their potential. To help businesses access BytePlus technologies, the Platform team delivers a reliable and easy-to-use platform that businesses can use to discover, learn more about, purchase, and use BytePlus solutions. Our platform makes it radically safe and effortless for technology professionals to consume solutions like BytePlus Recommendation, BytePlus Effects, and BytePlus Data Intelligence to grow their businesses.

As a PM for BytePlus Recommend, you will support the Product Management team in building the leading recommendation product on a global scale. As a Product Manager, you will understand market trends, opportunities, and customer requirements and then work closely with other product managers, engineers, and cross-functional teams to drive the full product life-cycle, including but not limited to market analysis, product positioning, value proposition, and product realization.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us in 2024. As a graduate, you will get unparalleled opportunities for you to kickstart your career, pursue bold ideas and explore limitless growth opportunities. Co-create a future driven by your inspiration with ByteDance.

Responsibilities
- Engage with businesses to understand their needs and build a product roadmap
- Conduct research, analyze market trends to develop product vision
- Collaborate with Engineer and UX design team to launch new products and features, and quickly iterate
- Break down complex challenges and drive product improvement to meet customers expectations
- Define the product GTM strategies together with internal stakeholders
- Manage the entire product line life cycle, from strategic planning to tactical activities
- Support product positioning and customer demand, and guide product development from conception to launch
- Evaluate product functionalities and performance and propose enhancements to products based on market feedback
- Research and analyse potential partner relationships for the product and generate ideas to grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth
- Drive market research studies to explore new technology and oversee development of business proposals for new opportunities

Qualifications
- Final year or recent graduate with a background in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline
- Engineering or product management internship experience in Technology/Internet/Enterprise Software companies
- Hands-on experience in Recommendation/Search. Have good understanding of ML products and technologies
- Experience in driving product vision and designing go-to-market strategy
- Excellent communication skills and able to manage stakeholders across businesses and levels
- Passionate, open-minded, and comfortable to work with ambiguity and change in the fast paced industry

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://jobs.bytedance.com/en/legal/privacy.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at apac-earlycareers@bytedance.com

Why Join Us

We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

TikTok is seeking an experienced product marketing professional with background in media to lead go-to-market for our Small Buslobal offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. As part of the SMB Growth team, this role involves close collaboration with in-market sales leadership, global product marketing, product, acquisition, retention & lifecycle, business marketing and operations teams in a high growth environment. An ability to self-motivate, prioritize, problem solve and be the expert for our ads platform and ecosystem are key skills. Candidates must have experience working with media products in a product marketing capacity and be familiar with SMB marketing.

Responsibilities
- Define the SMB go-to-market strategy for TikTok'sever-evolving ads products
- Partner with a range of cross-functional teams across the world to ensure flawless execution against this strategy
- Partner closely with field teams and utilize data proficiently to deeply understand performance pain points, and formulate product and activation based solutions
- Adapt regional product initiatives for SMB clients, prioritizing scale, platform based and low touch solutions
- Manage growth at scale for a range of products in market; set goals, manage launches and implement activations in order to drive product adoption. Collaborate with technical and operations teams to monitor product performance
- Build robust processes, systems , tools/solutions, workflow optimization, and automation to increase operational efficiency and productivity
- Analyze and summarize product issues and pain points to recommend product enhancements

Qualifications:
- BA/BS degree or above

title: VP of Product
company_info: Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on the construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man, Machine, Material, Money) resources. Our solutions help digitise all your work processes, and connect all key project stakeholders - developers, consultants, fabricators, contractors, and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform. Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come. Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow
job_category: Building and Construction, General Management, Information Technology
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What you will be doing:

We are looking for a VP of Product who will play a part in developing solutions that will completely revolutionize the construction industry. You will get to work closely with the CEO and be in charge of projects as you play a crucial role in aligning stakeholders and executing our product roadmap. You are responsible for a business’s product planning and execution all through the lifecycle of the business.
Work with C-level management to develop customized and impactful software solutions for clients.
Define the organizational vision that Hubble needs to be successful in scaling our end to end product lines.
Foster and sponsor innovation in our suite of products and identify new opportunities that will accelerate our technical capabilities and reduce the time to market of our products.
Bridge communications between business and engineering in order to prioritise feature development to deliver best-in-class products with strong market fit.
Build a sustainable talent pipeline and grow healthy, creative, empowered and autonomous product teams.
Drive excellence and mentor younger product managers and designers on best practices in the field of Product Management and UIUX.
Interface with Product Engineering and IT Operations to ensure appropriate systems are in place to achieve goals.
What we need from you:
5+ years of leading product teams with a consistent record of developing talent.
8+ years preferred of product management experience overseeing the design, development and launch of successful services, with at least 3 years of multi-level management (manager of managers).
Experience working in both highly agile environments as well as large product development efforts.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to take the initiative to forward team goals.
Enjoy solving complex problems with technology.
Strong business acumen, team player, results-oriented.
Experience and exposure to the construction industry preferred.
Experience in B2B product development is a nice to have.
About Hubble:

Hubble is a leading construction management platform that seamlessly connects stakeholders across the entire value chain to build better, faster, safer, and more cost-effective projects. Our company was founded in 2016 with a mission to automate construction and build wealth for our clients.

Today, we are proud to have automated more than 300 construction sites worth over $50 billion worldwide. Our full suite of software solutions include document, workforce, safety, quality, material, payments, and building management, and are used daily by over 90,000 users from 3,700 companies.

Headquartered in Singapore, we operate from offices in Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines. Our team of passionate and diverse professionals is dedicated to transforming the built environment by building autonomous construction sites through innovative technology and collaborative partnerships.

What Hubble will give you:

Hubble is built by a team of talented, driven, and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. We do not let history and traditions dictate and limit our dreams to shape the world. We adopt the same mindset with our hiring. We are looking for the best and we want to bet on you. If your mindset is right, we promise you the ride of your life.

Who will you be working with:
Purpose driven
Hungry, ambitions, and self-motivated
Meritocratic, results/performance > age/bureaucracy
Resourceful, independent, chart our own destiny
Determined, perseverance, and hard working
Creative, innovative, out of the box
Yes, the above is everyone of us at Hubble.
Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Product Operations Executive is responsible for executing User Acceptance Testing (mobile apps and web) and assisting in the successful launch of the in house Customer Management System.
About Core Collective :
Since our launch in 2018, Core Collective has propelled the professional growth of hundreds of fitness and wellness practitioners and business owners, by providing a convenient and cost-effective plug-and-play solution at our four centres of excellence at Anson Road, Dempsey, Katong and Sentosa.

Core Collective aims to build global fitness, wellness and lifestyle hubs that are centres of excellence and home to a diverse community of top professionals, fostering collaboration for healthier and happier lives.

What You’ll Be Doing …
Conduct manual user acceptance testing based on end to end business test cases and detect, report and track defects.
Conduct functional testing on digital products to ensure that all features have been developed according to business request specifications.
Work closely with product managers and internal stakeholders to ensure that UAT is completed within a set timeframe.
Prepare weekly and daily bug fix reports for overall project timeline tracking purposes.
Participate in other Product launch and deployment activities. (not limited to manual documentation, data cleaning and migration)
Who You Are …
Currently undertaking a degree or diploma in computer engineering/computer science.
Currently undertaking a degree in business or economics or other related fields.
Able to multitask and have good time management.
Good organizational skills with an eye for detail.
A good problem solver with analytical skills
Able to communicate in both verbal and documentation effectively
Proactive and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Experience in automated testing and/or JIRA is preferred
Experienced in UAT testing
Our Vision
To transform Core Collective from a local fitness & wellness business into a leading global fitness, wellness and lifestyle hub that are centers of excellence and home to a diverse community of top professionals, fostering collaboration for healthier and happier lives.

We achieve our vision by:
Building fitness and wellness hubs that are centers of excellence in the industry to house the top fitness and wellness professionals
Providing flexible and convenient access to shared facilities and support services to help professionals grow
Fostering collaboration and professional development opportunities across various professions and disciplines
Offering the widest range of premium services and best customer experience for members
Our values
Care (from the Heart)
Show genuine care and compassion for our team, customers, community, company
Do things because we care and not because we have to
Proactiveness to help others (team-mates/stakeholders)
Excellence
Consistently producing work that wows / impresses / delights your teammates and customers
Going above and beyond everything that we do
Continuous Improvement
Exceptional professionalism
Ownership
Treat it like your own business
Owning up to your mistakes and actively solving the mistakes
Deliver on your promises to your teammates and stakeholders
Do what needs to get done
Integrity
Always doing the right thing
Keeping to our word
Having each other’s back
Open and effective 2-way communication (both good and bad)
Treat others fairly with mutual respect
Agility
Actively seek learning and able to adapt to new situations
Able to work with people from various backgrounds, cultures and seniority

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are expanding and we're looking for an enthusiastic leaders, for our Central Kitchen, preferably with operational background in Food and Services industry to join us as our Factory Operation Manager!

Requirements:
You are a seasoned department head with broad knowledge of the business and is able to set and manage expectations, directs, coordinates the internal structure of the organisation based on our company policies, goals and objectives to ensure an efficient working environment and that deadlines are met consistently. You will play a pivotal role to guarantee customer satisfaction, maximize our company’s operating capabilities and guarantee customer retention.

Job Scope:
- Able to motivate employees and have good interpersonal relationship skills
- Have related confectionery production manager experience
- Enforcing policies and procedures according to regulations and company requirement
- Contribute operational information and recommendations to strategic/action plans to be
implemented.
- Ensure proper cost control such as managing low production wastage and ensuring
competitive sourcing of raw and packaging materials.

- Analyze and improve production process and workflow and implement changes if
needed.
- Ensure products produced from the factory is of high quality.

- Manage relationships with key operations vendors and suppliers

quality, customer service, or accidents and mishaps on-site. In particular, this includes any
issues on-site

Location: This position is in Tuas

title: Department Manager (Retail) / 5 days work
company: PAN PACIFIC RETAIL MANAGEMENT (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: Don Quijote, a Japanese discount retail chain famously known as “Donki”, is expanding to Southeast Asia as Don Don Donki. Don Quijote Group's holding company for overseas operations, Pan Pacific International Holdings Pte. Ltd. (PPIH) based in Singapore, will develop the Don Don Donki stores for Southeast Asia. To date, PPIH has opened two Don Don Donki stores in Singapore and Thailand will be open by end of 2018. PPIH targets to open at least 10 more stores by 2020. The Don Quijote Group was established in 1980 and opened its first Don Quijote general discount store in 1989. It has since steadily expanded its business and its network of stores by developing a unique type of business based on its store concept of providing “convenience,” “discount” and “amusement,” and by pursuing mergers and acquisitions.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Department Manager in our retail supermarket, you play a vital role in ensuring the seamless execution of front-end and back-end activities within your designated product category. You will lead a team, maintain high merchandising standards, drive sales, and contribute to the overall success of the store. Your responsibility extends to achieving departmental goals, fostering a positive working environment, and continuously improving store operations.

Key Responsibilities:
Merchandising & Product Management:
Execute product merchandising and maintain store displays in accordance with the company's guidelines & standards.
Develop and maintain an innovative and appealing store layout that maximizes product visibility and enhances customer experience.
Stay updated with industry trends, product developments, and market dynamics to facilitate sales forecasting, inventory management, and strategy formulation.
Sales & Performance:
Work diligently to achieve company and departmental goals, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and revenue targets.
Actively support and participate in promotional activities, contributing to increased foot traffic and sales.
Collaborate with the team to create a productive and cooperative work environment that enhances overall store performance.
Team Leadership:
Lead and inspire your team, setting an example of excellence through your own work ethics and attitude.
Foster a culture of exceptional customer service and sales performance by coaching, motivating, and developing team members.
Undertake ad-hoc tasks as assigned by reporting managers.
Requirements:
- At least 1-2 yrs in a similar role with supervisory & management experience in a supermarket environment
- Strong communication & time management skills
- Able to commit to rotating shifts (opening & closing hrs)
Staff welfare and benefits, along with exciting career progression opportunities! Reach out to us today and seize your future!

title: Senior Business Analyst - Cash Management
company_info: SOFTENGER (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD. Softenger offers a variety of managed services in the field of Information Technology. We are committed to provide the right services to maintain and enhance your IT infrastructure, so that you can focus on achieving your business vision. Ideas are the foundation of evolution. Softenger provides your business with a board array of enterprises system management services based in Industry-Standard methodologies and practices. From system, database administration to security and continuity of business, we deliver services that will meet your business strategies and goals.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Main responsibilities
As a Business Analyst:
Understanding the BRD and conducting requirement gathering by various means like brainstorming, workshops, Questionnaire and working with different stakeholders of the cash management team like Product Managers (Global as well as In Country), Client Services, Implementation, Operations and Finance.
Mapping the identified functional requirements and define a solution
Identifying the scope of the requirements, validating the requirements.
Working with Lead Business Analyst & Technology partner i.e., Solution Architects to agree on the solution.
Working as a liaison between Business users, operations and Developers.
Preparing various documents like BRD, FSD and reviewing SIT Test scenarios and Test Cases. Experience in Agile world is a plus.
Working with different stakeholders for product collateral and training needs.
Working with Integration partners and other vendors within bank
Identify & resolve issues and manage project risks, supporting different teams, chairing & documenting meetings.
As a Functional Tester:
Handle the core banking system’s and payment system’s various test phases : regression tests, integration tests, functional tests, test automation
Good Knowledge and working experience of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC) and Defect Life Cycle.
Define functional test scenarios for core banking and payment systems
Overall responsible for ensuring User acceptance testing for all the streams.
Maintain up to date test libraries (test scenarios, test cases)
Working with SIT & UAT Testing Team, reviewing, testing scenarios, test cases and helping developers and testers in clearing their doubts about the requirements etc.
Recording defects utilizing defect tracking tool with priority and severity and alert the management
Manage planning, communicate with stakeholders
Prepare regular reports on test results
Supporting the business users for User Acceptance Testing
Supporting Operations team / Business Users team to complete the testing
Managing testing at times when required and found the issues / testing not closing or moving as expected
Qualifications and Profile
The position requires a minimum of 7 years relevant business analyst experience with Payment systems and Core Banking applications.

Singaporeans Only
Functional
Good knowledge in Payment area like interaction with Clearing, payment file format ISO20022, SEPA and SWIFT. Hands-on experience with such data mapping and testing.
Hands on experience on payment systems and exposure to Payments Hub, Clearing and Settlement, Automated clearing house programs and channels.
Extensive knowledge on various kinds of payment products such as TT, RTGS, LVP, Payroll, Cheque, DD, Cashier Order, Mass & Bulk payments.
Proficient in User Acceptance Testing (UAT), Functional & System Integration testing of banking and financial applications
Experience in following areas is a plus: Corporate Banking, Corporate commercial Payments, International & Domestic Payments, Payment Hub/Factory, Correspondent Banking, ACH, Real Time Payments, Cash & Liquidity Management, Compliance/AML, FX, & Messaging (Swift and ISO)
Technical
Hands on experience on Business Analysis & testing methodologies
Working knowledge of ALM/JIRA

title: Manager, Vertical Planning & Operations
company_info: Klook is the leading travel and leisure e-commerce platform for experiences and services anytime, anywhere. We curate the most joyful experiences so that users can satisfy their relentless curiosity for adventure and experiences at home and around the world. With our website and app, users can experience a world of joy, from attractions, tours to local transportation and stays. Founded in 2014, we are here to inspire and enable more moments of joy through over 490,000 activities in over 1,000 destinations.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Klook
Klook is the go-to travel and leisure e-commerce platform for experiences and services anytime, anywhere. Founded in Hong Kong in 2014 out of passion for discovery, our purpose today is to inspire and enable more moments of JOY. Even when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, we held on to our conviction and successfully unlocked the domestic travel business. To date, we are already offering over 490,000 activities in over 1,000 destinations. With cross-border travel resuming, we have made it our mission to reshape the world of travel. Isn’t this exciting?!

It certainly is for our international community of over 1,200 employees, based in over 20 locations globally! Joymakers at heart, Klookers are not only curating joyful experiences for others, but also co-creating our world of joy in the Klookiverse. We are on a journey to foster a strong company culture that supports a high-performing and successful business, and we are guided by our core beliefs - Push boundaries, Ask for and give feedback, Take ownership, and Help each other - in everything we do. We are excited about building and realizing endless possibilities in the new era of travel. Care to be a part of this revolution?

What You'll Do:
As the Manager of Vertical Planning & Operations at Klook, you will play a pivotal role in driving a high-performing team to drive commercial and service level excellence for our global travel product verticals, including attraction tickets and tours & activities. Your responsibilities will encompass:
Strategic Vision: Develop and shape the business model and strategic roadmaps for the vertical, overseeing the entire spectrum from supply to demand, business strategy, and technology innovation. Collaborate closely with regional teams to devise go-to-market strategies for new product verticals.
Program Leadership: Take charge of strategic initiatives, working collaboratively with cross-functional teams on a global scale to elevate the performance of our verticals. This includes optimizing customer satisfaction, enhancing traffic channels, expanding supply coverage, ensuring inventory availability, optimizing pricing strategies, maximizing profitability, streamlining costs, enriching content, and improving the booking experience.
Product & Technology Enhancement: Collaborate closely with our product and technology teams to enhance the visibility, usability, and conversion rates of booking processes across Klook's mobile app, website, and other distribution channels.
Data-Driven Insights: Establish comprehensive metrics and implement advanced mechanisms for monitoring and analyzing commercial and operational performance, allowing data-driven decision-making to thrive.

What You'll Need:
To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and attributes:
Experience: A minimum of 5 years of experience in OTA, e-commerce, tech startups, strategy consulting, business analytics, category or brand management, or product management.
Project Leadership: A proven track record of successfully driving cross-departmental projects and initiatives.
Language Skills: Proficiency in spoken and written English is essential, and fluency in Chinese is a valuable asset.
Adaptability: A strong willingness to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, along with a startup mentality that embraces collaboration and an entrepreneurial spirit.
Global Outlook: Comfortable working with individuals from diverse cultural backgrounds and across different time zones, demonstrating a global perspective.
Effective Communication: Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships at all levels and adapt to diverse situations.
Leadership: Strong leadership capabilities, including the ability to navigate a matrixed organizational structure in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment.
Analytical Acumen: Highly analytical with a strong inclination toward data-based decision-making, capable of extracting actionable insights from data from multiple sources.
Ownership and Results: A track record of sound business judgment, taking ownership of projects, and consistently delivering tangible results.

title: Business Development Manager, Asia Pacific
company_info: WHY EMERSON At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. ABOUT EMERSON Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! No calls or agencies please.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
If you are looking for an opportunity in Sales and Business Development, Emerson has an excellent role for you! The Business Development Assistant Manager / Manager will continue to be part and lead the Emerson Flame and Gas business through the Spectrex channel. This role will also lead the business expansion into new markets.
In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
· Lead and handle Spectrex distributors’ sales growth across Asia Pacific and expand into non-industrial and commercial markets in flame detection.
· Responsible for monthly sales internal reporting alongside with business forecast and market/application feedback.
· Evaluate and review distributor performance against important metrics and pivotal initiatives. At the same time, lead distributor agreements appropriately.
· Visit end customers with distributors to support applications and win orders.
· Partner with training team to provide appropriate sales and application training to distributors and customers.
· Collaborate with global teams to develop new products by providing market trend feedback such as price, volume, and competitive landscape
· Study competitive landscape and collaborate with Product Management team to develop individual country growth strategies.
· Review proposals and follow-up on deliveries to ensure high quality service to distributors and customers.
Who You Are:
You ask questions and listen closely to all issues presented by partners. You formulate a clear strategy and map the bold steps that will clearly accelerate the organization toward its strategic goals. You pick up on the need to change personal, interpersonal, and leadership behavior quickly. You facilitate an open dialogue with a wide variety of contributors and partners. You take a proactive approach to shape and influence stakeholder expectations.
For This Role, You Will Need:
· Degree in Engineering, Mechanical or any other related fields.
· At least 8 years of related sales/marketing management experience.
· Strong interpersonal, presentation and communication skills, with high EQ.
· Collaborative and a great teammate who has good situational fluency.
· Flexible to role changes in alignment with business strategies and direction.
Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
· Experience in commercial and non-industrial markets (e.g. public infrastructure, waste management, car manufacturing, food & beverage, semi-conductor) is a plus.
· Experience in the field of Fire Protection Systems is an added advantage.
· Able to work independently with minimum supervision.
· Willing to travel within Asia Pacific up to 50%.
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.
This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.
If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com.

title: Account Manager - SEA & India
company_info: Preqin is the leading source of data and intelligence for the alternative assets industry, and has numerous leading products and services covering private equity, hedge funds, private real estate and infrastructure. Preqin’s clients include fund managers, investment banks, legal firms, institutional investors, financial advisors, asset managers and placement agents. Preqin is also a prominent supplier of bespoke data and analysis to both industry and mainstream press, regularly appearing in publications such as the Financial Times and Wall Street Journal. Preqin maintains numerous online databases, produces high level financial publications and reports, and undertakes consultancy projects for clients. Preqin is a rapidly growing, privately owned firm headquartered in the City of London with additional offices in New York, San Francisco, Singapore, Hong Kong and Manila.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Preqin
You will be joining the world’s leading data and insights provider for the alternative assets market. We empower the global financial community with critical information and leading analytics solutions to help them make faster and smarter investment decisions, and to make them with confidence. A forward-thinking company, we lead our industry through innovation. We trust in the power of data, and we use it to increase transparency in alternatives. We believe that access to information leads to more investment in the ideas and infrastructure that build strong communities.

Job overview
ASA (ASEAN and South Asia) is Preqin’s second largest team in APAC. It is a dynamic territory with its longstanding prime markets in Singapore, Malaysia and India; emerging market potentials in Thailand, Indonesia and Vietnam.

The team has seen double-digit growth in annual recurring revenue (ARR) in the last seven years with a stable client base, consisting of established fund managers, institutional investors and service providers (law firms, consulting firms, banks etc.).

The existing team consists of highly motivated, energetic and achievement-oriented individuals; this regional territory has consistently been one of the top drivers for APAC’s performance. The team’s primary goal is to grow Preqin’s business, relationships and brand equity in ASA.

Role overview
The Account Manager will inherit a portfolio of accounts within the ASA territory; their primary goal is to strategically manage and grow net revenue from this book of business. It is dynamic sales role with fundamental activities rooted in renewals (Customer Retention - CRR) and usage growth, while simultaneously requiring a strong tactical focus on upselling and cross-selling products and into new departments/subsidiaries.

In this role you will:
Achieve or exceed monthly net sales targets by developing and growing existing accounts
Manage account renewals every month and adopt best-practices in executing and negotiating
Hunt for opportunities to upsell and cross-sell by having an in-depth understanding of customers’ business and Preqin’s suite of solutions
Be able to sell and negotiate medium to high-complexity contracts over email, phone, zoom and face-face
Employ a consultative approach to selling Preqin’s services – Actively engage with clients’ senior management team, deep understanding of clients’ business models and problems, workflow, and identifying the appropriate Preqin solutions
Work collaboratively within a team environment to prioritize the interests of our customers and the firm
Accurately report internal administration: CRM activity log, sales pipeline forecasting, monthly reports to management, renewal planning and proposal preparation
You are a good fit if:
You have least 3 years of sales and strategic account management experience in a similar discipline (preferred: financial data vendor, financial services, alternative investments, business to business SaaS sales, solution selling)
Consultative sales (e.g. SPIN selling) and negotiation skills and experience in a B2B ecosystem
Proven track record in achieving sales and retention targets
Excellent interpersonal skills in written and verbal business communications
Organized, detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize and respond quickly
Sales motivated, team-focused attitude, and willingness to collaborate with peers, product management, and internal key constituents at the firm
Working knowledge of the financial market data space, alternative assets, and financial services industries
Highly proficient in MS Office Suite, Salesforce and CRM systems
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business or related field required
Company benefits:
Medical and dental benefits
Flexi Benefits – Health and Wellness Incentives
21 days holiday
We also sponsor employees to undertake professional training or to gain qualifications relevant to their career
Training and development:
Preqin offers comprehensive Sales Training to all new members of the Sales and CS Teams. Our training is provided in the first few weeks of joining us and utilises powerful, up-to-date techniques along-side industry knowledge to create a truly bespoke training experience unique to Preqin. Individuals that complete our programmes are able to conduct more efficient prospecting, uncover more value within our prospects and clients, resist and overcome objections and achieve success in a shorter period. Once completed and an assessment passed, all Sales & CS reps will be fully certified in Preqin Sales Fundamentals and experience a reduced ramping period and earn more money, faster.

Our culture and values:
At Preqin, we’re aligned around common values – our shared beliefs that shape Preqin’s corporate culture:

Be customer-obsessed
We exist for our customers. We listen to them and understand their challenges. We design best-in-class data solutions for their success.

Act with integrity
We build trust through honesty and transparency. We’re committed to doing the right thing for our customers, our company, and each other.

Own your success
We’re a high-performance team. We challenge and champion each other in our pursuit of excellence. We never stop learning and strive to become experts in our fields.

Think forward
We lead the industry through innovation. We foster collaboration and creativity to solve our clients’ next challenge and give them a competitive advantage.

Make an impact
We drive positive change as individuals, and as a company. We’re passionate about creating a better tomorrow for our industry and our communities.

Equal opportunities:
Preqin is an equal opportunity employer, with diversity at the heart of our business. It is the policy of Preqin to ensure equal employment and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information, socioeconomic status, political affiliation, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Preqin is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, so everyone has the opportunity to be successful. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please let the Preqin recruiter know at the start of the application process. Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process.

title: Senior Product Manager
company_info: Doctor Anywhere is the leading telehealth provider in the region. With our strong network of established healthcare providers in Singapore, Doctor Anywhere is set to change the way you see a doctor. You can now consult a Doctor anytime, anywhere, and get medication delivered right to your doorstep island-wide. Shop for your daily health and wellness needs on our specially curated in-app Marketplace, and get access to items ranging from OTC medication, health-screenings and vaccinations, to nutritional supplements and lifestyle and fitness products – all in one place.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Doctor Anywhere:
Doctor Anywhere (DA) is a regional tech-enabled, omnichannel healthcare provider delivering care to 2.5 million users across 6 countries in Southeast Asia. Founded in 2017 with a mission to make healthcare simple, accessible, and efficient for all, DA leverages technology to enable individuals towards preventive, long-term health via holistic offerings including our telehealth app, physical clinics and pharmacies, mental wellness, specialist consults, and also an online health & wellness marketplace for supplements, healthy snacks, home-based health screening and vaccinations.
DA’s goal is to build a regional digital healthcare ecosystem, advanced by the 3,000 GPs and specialists within our regional network, over 1,000 corporate organisations, and 25 regional insurers we work with. Grounded in our motto “Keep Going, Keep Growing”, our team strives towards excellence, with innovation and collaboration at our core, and values diversity in perspectives brought by every member. Join us in our mission to transform Southeast Asia’s healthcare future!

About Product team:
With Doctor Anywhere driving to become a product-led organization, our Product team is responsible for shaping our product strategy, and striving to bring the best products and services to both our users and the future of Doctor Anywhere. Our team consists of passionate and talented and ambitious Product Managers and Designers who continuously evolve our products to maximize business value and improve user experience

We are seeking a Senior/Product Manager to join our Product team to enhance our overall product capabilities serving the needs of the healthcare industry.

As a Senior/Product Manager, you will:
· Define product vision and scale DA's suite of healthcare solutions
· Act as the voice of the users - Leverage data, user research, market analysis, and competitive landscape to drive product insights
· Create a product strategy to maximize business value and user satisfaction, align the strategy with the rest of the company, drive the implementation of the strategy, and measure success
· Collaborate with business stakeholders, Engineering, and Designers to build a feature or product that solves users’ pain points
· Break down complex business requirements into actionable solutions and develop user stories, roadmaps, and release plans

Minimum Requirements
· Bachelor’s degree in a related field
· 5+ years of experience in product management
· Experience in bringing at least one product from conception to launch
· Experience in managing consumer-facing applications across digital platforms such as native mobile apps, responsive web, interactive platforms
· Clear understanding of data, analytics, metrics and statistics
· Experience in working with engineering team and in Agile/Scrum development process
· Self-starter with relentless curiosity and creativity in pursuit of growth
Preferred Requirements
· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, or an equivalent technical field
· A/B testing experience
· Experience in working in an ambiguous environment

title: Senior Product Manager
company_info: At Dyson we are focused on solving the problems that others have ignored; solving them first using our technology and ingenuity. In order to achieve this we need to pioneer technologies that are different and authentic. This is the core of what we do and who we are. We must strive to create the future, every single day by developing new things, different things, things that go against the grain with a diverse and global team of ingenious minds. Dyson employs over 13,000 people and is present in more than 80 countries. And while we are growing fast we want Dyson to remain a start-up in spirit with the freedom of experimentation and learning, constantly reinventing our products as well as reinventing how we work, how we sell and how we support our owners. At the same time we are working through the James Dyson Foundation, James Dyson Award and Dyson Institute to inspire future engineers and pioneering a new approach to engineering education. Underlining everything we do in this diverse environment is the need to always show respect, supporting each other as one team to overcome whatever challenges we encounter. We drive empowerment, development and equality in an inclusive environment for our people around the world. The future doesn’t just happen, we look to make it happen, to achieve leaps through pioneering new ideas. This is an exciting time to join a growing company. If think your experience matches any of these roles, we should talk.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us

Dyson Connectivity is responsible for defining a world-class Connected strategy, product and owner experience in the MyDyson App, to help take this amazing technology to market, explaining how our machines are different and their benefits. Where we demonstrate our machines and their superiority we win. Where we solve owner problems at speed, first time we win. But we also want to prevent issues from happening by analysing the data from sensors in our machines and the owner profiles we hold. We are also responsible for the development and delivery of the Connected features within the MyDyson App and Cloud.

The next period of Dyson’s growth will see us taking our technology into more markets, doubling the business and quadrupling Direct. It will see our Owner base grow rapidly to 100m and a focus on both acquiring more Owners and retaining the Owners we have.

Our vision is to help Dyson owners get the very best out of their Dyson machines, through effortless ownership and personalised Care, by assisting them in simple, elegant, and unexpected ways, using technology and data intelligently.

Our mission is to form a high-performing team to define a world-class Connected strategy and a reimagined Connected way of working and governance, harnessing data to create superior product and owner experiences, building a platform of trust with our owners and a community of Dyson advocates who will return to purchase from us again.

Connectivity will rely heavily on harnessing the power of data to provide insights back to the various areas of the business – NPI, RDD, Customer Services, Owner experience and GTM teams, to help make data-based decisions. Connectivity will also help us provide a more agile, mission based operating model. One which will enable us to continue our journey but in a more structured and efficient ways.

We are on an exciting Connected journey where our emphasis is around providing a better owner experience for our Owners. To this end, we are investing heavily in bringing together machine, app and owner data to create bespoke recommendations – whether it be in help/support/guidance/repair/parts/machines – to our owners when they need it.

About The Role
Lead and deliver digital projects that partner and enhance our physical products, creating exceptional customer experiences
Take ownership of app vision, feature roadmap and backlog to deliver measurable user and business benefits
Represent business and owner needs as the expert for your category of products
Guide integrated scrum team on: Category and increment priorities, Project Deliverable, User Requirements and App Experience, Expected Project Responsibilities, Programme Timelines, Programme Risks and Dependencies
Collaborate with early-stage innovation teams to influence the vision of digital and connected products
Utilise data to inform to identify new opportunities and drive continuous improvement
Outline and deliver against Key Performance Indicators
Work closely with Product and User Experience teams to research and test user features, to drive positive change
Be passionate about the latest trends in digital and technology to help ensure Dyson becomes leading in our mobile application
Understand the end-to-end customer journey for Dyson owners
Establish strong relationships with key stakeholders across the organisation
About you
Digital Product/IoT design and leadership experience, working as a Product Manager
Customer-centric drive, a curious mindset, with a focus on the use of high-quality data & insight to fuel decision making
The energy and determination to work cross-functionally, at pace, across diverse global teams to cultivate productive, mutually beneficial working relationships
Knowledge of multiple product management methodologies. (Agile, Waterfall & Hybrid) backed up by experience of applying them successfully in practice
Day-to-day experience collaborating with feature/experience designers, data scientists, and developers
Outstanding interpersonal communication skills
Strong leadership abilities
Powerful change agent who inspires trust and change adoption
Strong collaborator with and influencer of different business functions, ability to deliver through others not in direct team

title: Senior Product Manager, Growth
company_info: Established since 1996, Recruit Express has emerged as the leading staffing solutions provider that has set a proven track record for matching the right people to the right organization within the shortest time. With our vast network of resources, extensive databases and defined recruitment processes, we have been successfully bridging talented job seekers of the highest calibre to employers who only want the best in their teams. In our relentless pursuit of excellent service, we have adopted best practices and dynamic growth strategies in expanding our operations across the Asia Pacific regions: We have offices in Singapore, Sydney, Hong Kong, Kuala Lumpur, Taipei, Shanghai, Beijing, Tokyo and Bangkok. With 400 permanent committed consultants from various professional backgrounds and disciplines, we make a difference by delivering top-notch services to our clients and candidates alike.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the opportunity:
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in agile methodologies, data-driven strategy, and data analysis, with experience in SQL, go-to-market planning, and the crypto industry preferred.

As a Growth Product Manager, you will be responsible for leading the development and execution of growth strategies for our products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including product management, engineering, marketing, and customer success, to identify and prioritize growth opportunities, conduct experiments, and measure results.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the development and execution of growth strategies for our products
Identify and prioritize growth opportunities through data analysis and customer insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and test hypotheses for growth experiments
Use agile methodologies to manage the development and deployment of growth initiatives
Analyze data and metrics to measure the effectiveness of growth efforts and inform decision making
Use SQL to extract and analyze data from various sources
Develop and execute go-to-market plans for new products or features

Qualifications:
Solid years of experience in product management or a related field
Strong background in agile methodologies, data-driven strategy, and data analysis
Proficiency in SQL and experience using data to inform decision making
Experience in go-to-market planning and the crypto industry preferred
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Experience leading cross-functional teams and driving results
Min Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. computer science, business, marketing) preferred
EA Personnel: Celine Tan Si Ling
CEI Reg No: R1104662
EA Licence No: 99C4599
