title: Product Manager CDN - Infrastructure Engineering
company_info: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About the Team
The infrastructure team supports the company's fast growth by building and operating hyper-scale datacenters, managing the life cycle of server fleet, providing cloud solutions, and developing various infrastructure services and making sure they are scalable and are reliable.

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our growing Global Bytedance Infrastructure Engineering team and manage the Bytedance CDN/DSA product lifecycle by gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product roadmap, and working closely with engineering to deliver the product. You will collaborate with different functional groups including Engineering, Strategy, Supply Chain, and Operations.

You will succeed by supporting the company’s overall strategy and goals of growing Bytedance Infrastructure and developing internal infrastructure products and services. Your role as a Product Manager-CDN makes that a reality by collaborating closely with the engineering teams to build a cloud-native CDN/DSA platform that can be deployed across multiple Bytedance-owned edge sites and public clouds.

Responsibilities
• Work well with internal teams including developers, SRE, and operations ensuring requirements are fully understood and that implementation plans match expectations.
• Help in producing meaningful technical solutions that add value for our customers by working across CDN/DSA products.
• Gathering needs, transforming them into requirements and new features.
• Take part in the CDN/DSA roadmap and the prioritization of features.
• Understand, research, and follow CDN technology trends in the industry.
• Follow competitors and conduct capability analysis regularly.
• Metering of metrics for Billing, Usage, Adoption.
• Collaborate with other product managers and internal engineering teams to understand the use cases, technical requirements, and customer requirements to deliver.
• Capable of breaking down complex problems to make quick and thoughtful decisions. You'll have to anticipate challenges, make tradeoffs, and build consensus.
• Manage the entire product line life cycle, from strategic planning to tactical activities.
• Support product positioning and customer demand, and guide product development from conception to launch.
• Evaluate product functionalities and performance and propose enhancements to products based on market feedback.
• Research and analyse potential partner relationships for the product and generate ideas to grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growth.
• Drive market research studies to explore new technology and oversee development of business proposals for new opportunities.

Qualifications
• At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies)
• 5+ years of core product management experience, with a track record of shipping software products.
• Familiarity with CDN, Multi-Cloud, Edge Computing market.
• 5+ years of CDN work experience.
• Experience managing teams developing and managing products in an agile development environment.
• Experience partnering with engineers and cross functional teams such as finance, supply chain, and operations.
• Have a good understanding of Cloud Native Technologies, DDOS, DNS, Firewalls, Cyber Security, Reverse Proxy, and Load Balancers.
• Strong verbal and written communications skills.

Preferred Qualifications
• MBA
• Experience working in kubernetes space
• Experience working in CDN space



ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

title: Senior Product Manager, Customer Lifecycle
company_info: Established since 1996, Recruit Express has emerged as the leading staffing solutions provider that has set a proven track record for matching the right people to the right organization within the shortest time. With our vast network of resources, extensive databases and defined recruitment processes, we have been successfully bridging talented job seekers of the highest calibre to employers who only want the best in their teams. In our relentless pursuit of excellent service, we have adopted best practices and dynamic growth strategies in expanding our operations across the Asia Pacific regions: We have offices in Singapore, Sydney, Hong Kong, Kuala Lumpur, Taipei, Shanghai, Beijing, Tokyo and Bangkok. With 400 permanent committed consultants from various professional backgrounds and disciplines, we make a difference by delivering top-notch services to our clients and candidates alike.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Own consumer experience and communication with users across all lifecycle stages
Drive focused experimentation and continuous improvement rooted in data with outsized results against customer onboarding, retention, product adoption, advocacy, and expansion goals
Develop and optimize product and customer journeys based on user personas and user behavior segmentation insight to drive user engagement and revenue.
Work with cross-functional team to define and deliver product roadmap
Collaborate with designers and engineers to develop detailed product specification
Drive global product launches and lead beta programs
Stay informed of the overall market landscape, including competitors and potential partners
Monitor key product metrics and continuously improve them through ongoing product iteration
Job Requirements:
Solid years of product management, TPM, or software engineering experience
Prior product experience on growth or gaming with a track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Excellent written and verbal communications skills; ability to translate strategy into clear and actionable plans for Product Development, Engineering, Design and Sales
Ability to understand and assess engineering, design and schedule tradeoffs
Have an eye for good design and user experience
Strong analytical, prioritization, and problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done
Comfortable analyzing data and proficient with data querying techniques (e.g. SQL)
BA/BS technical degree or equivalent;
Nice to have:
Familiar with third-party tools such as amplitude, hubspot, one-signal, braze
Passion for crypto and blockchain innovations

title: Product Manager (Consumer Products / VB) (Ref: RY)
company_info: RK Recruitment is a workforce solutions provider with the key aim of conducting value-based recruitment activities to our business partners in forms of regular and flexible staffing. We provide one stop recruitment solutions that include: Permanent Placement Contract & Temporary Placement Executive Search Work Pass & Payroll Services Recruitment Process Outsourcing (RPO) Business Processing Outsourcing (BPO), in logistics, customer services and IT related scope (By submitting any application or résumé to us, you will be deemed to have agreed and consented to us collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your personal information to prospective employers for their consideration.)
job_category: General Management, Marketing / Public Relations, Sales / Retail, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Benefits Summary:
Consumer products
Basic up to $10k + VB
Monday – Friday: 9am – 6.30pm
Location: Bendemeer Road
Key Products: Home Appliances (Fridges & Washer), Air Conditioning, Displays, Hardware

Responsibilities:
Develop and execute go-to-market strategy by taking into consideration of the global view. e.g.: opportunities and target customers, initial development of the positioning, value proposition, pricing framework as well as initial capacity plans).
Source, build and maintain relationships with our partners, working closely to design and manufacturer new product models.
You would be required to lead and drive product development, conducting consumer and market research, define product requirements, lead and drive product launches, developing and maintaining user manuals and manage product roadmaps and timelines.
Partner with software development on the product requirements and oversee smart home integration for the product category.
Identify and prioritize new product opportunities for the product category, based on market trends, customer needs and competitive analysis.
Work with marketing to monitor and drive product success.
Drive innovation within product area with industry trends and best practices.
Ensure senior management are up to date with reports and communication on the progress of the product category.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline e.g., Management, Marketing, Commerce, Engineering or Finance.
Minimum of 8 years’ relevant working experience in B2B product management experience with ability to independently lead the agenda.
No fear of the unknown. You have to be an analytical self-starter, comfortable with complete uncertainty as we look to venture into new product lines or models. You need to be able to dive in and test all angles without supervision.
Data driven. You need to be able to structure, quantify and qualify information on product research, and present this to stakeholders explaining the logic. Comfort with spreadsheet software and data modelling is essential.
Strong Business acumen – Understanding of the wider environment within which our business operates and implications of e.g., trends / shifts in sustainability and consumer perception, brand owners’ opportunity & challenges, and being able to drive actionable insights and articulate what products/services to offer to accelerate profitable growth.
Detailed oriented with strong project management skills on multi-market projects
Please submit your updated resume by using the APPLY NOW BUTTON

By submitting your personal data and/or resume to us in connection with your job application, you will be deemed to have agreed and consented to us in collecting, using, retaining, and disclosing your personal data and/or resume to prospective employers for the purpose of the evaluating, processing and administration by company relating to this job application.

*We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates would be notified*

We wish you all the best in your career search.

You are welcome to visit our website at http://www.rkgroup.sg/

RK Recruitment Pte Ltd | EA License No.: 20C0280
Leow Rui Yan | EA Personnel No.: R22110231

title: Product Management Director (Home Appliance)
company_info: LG Electronics Singapore Pte. Ltd. LG Electronics Singapore values and grooms talented professionals in its operations. We are constantly on the lookout for innovative, passionate and dedicated people to join our team to make LG the number 1 brand name in Singapore. We are part of the LG Corporation and we see an exciting future ahead as we transform our company to be the leader in our industry with core LG Way values that are timeless. The company is on an expansion path and wants to reach out to a wider pool of consumers in Singapore. We have a systematic talent recruitment and management process to ensure each individual performs to their best capability. In addition, we have in place an attractive remuneration and benefits package that rewards the best in the field. If you feel you possess that drive to succeed and excel in your career, we would like to invite you to send us your detailed resume and tell us how your experience and expertise can boost LG Electronics Singapore's premium brand positioning. We will contact you if your profile suits any opening that we may have in the company. Thank you for considering the job opportunities and choosing LG as your Employer of Choice.
job_category: Customer Service, General Management, Hospitality, Marketing / Public Relations, Professional Services
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Summary
As a Product Director, you will be responsible to lead the product planning and marketing initiatives, while growing the brand awareness for emerging products in Singapore. You should drive the business with excellence through qualitative 360 plan with other teams. You will also communicate with internal and external business partners to ensure that business objectives are met and aligned with Brand’s goals. This position reports directly to Managing Director.

Job Description & Requirements
Responsible for the execution of Home Appliance category (Washing machines, refrigerators, vacuum cleaners, etc.) marketing activities in Singapore local market.
Lead the execution of brand strategy and develop new initiatives to win market share and ranking
Ensure successful new product launches and review the pillars supported by effective 360 plans (PR, media, social media & digital, forecast, events and CRM, sell-out tracking and the product display in the points-of-sale)
Conduct market trend analysis, monitor competitors’ activities and plan proactive actions.
Ensure accuracy in forecasting of products and timely submission.
Ensure accurate and timely phasing of Sale Programs and A&P management.
Marketing support activities regarding whole Home appliance product
(APMS, Communication with Agency, Monthly marketing planning)
Lead Marketing Agency to ensure marketing assets and plans are well prepared.
Cultivate the product category passion both internally and externally.
Ensure all ATL & BTL collaterals, POSM, samples meant for the launch are well-prepared and delivered accordingly for maximum launch impact.
Implement events and promotions with qualitative executions to maximize commercial returns.
Regular and timely update and exchange with the sales and corporate marketing team to ensure the upcoming activities and marketing initiatives are successful.
Be physically present at all major promotions and events (closed door, pop-up events, workshops, etc.) to ensure smooth operations.
Ensure that all your media plans are in place in accordance to your launch plans.
Follow-up closely with PR and Corporate Marketing team to ensure marketing and PR coverage for the products and launches are in place.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Summary
As a Product Director, you will be responsible to lead the product planning and marketing initiatives, while growing the brand awareness for emerging products in Singapore. You should drive the business with excellence through qualitative 360 plan with other teams. You will also communicate with internal and external business partners to ensure that business objectives are met and aligned with Brand’s goals. This position reports directly to Managing Director.

Job Description & Requirements
Responsible for the execution of Home Entertainment category (TV, audio, etc.)marketing activities in Singapore local market.
Provide guidance to the team in PSI planning, product pricing, P&L management and accountable for market share growth.
Provide clear understanding of category & product positioning to ensure all the executions in the market are in line with HQ direction.
Build strong relationship with channel partners to grow the business and increase sales & market share.
Lead the execution of brand strategy and develop new initiatives to win market share and ranking
Ensure successful new product launches and review the pillars supported by effective 360 plans (PR, media, social media & digital, forecast, events and CRM, sell-out tracking and the product display in the points-of-sale)
Conduct market trend analysis, monitor competitors’ activities and plan proactive actions.
Ensure accuracy in forecasting of products and timely submission.
Ensure accurate and timely phasing of Sale Programs and A&P management.

(APMS, Communication with Agency, Monthly marketing planning)
Lead Marketing Agency to ensure marketing assets and plans are well prepared.
Cultivate the product category passion both internally and externally.
Ensure all ATL & BTL collaterals, POSM, samples meant for the launch are well-prepared and delivered accordingly for maximum launch impact.
Implement events and promotions with qualitative executions to maximize commercial returns.
Regular and timely update and exchange with the sales and corporate marketing team to ensure the upcoming activities and marketing initiatives are successful.
Be physically present at all major promotions and events (closed door, pop-up events, workshops, etc.) to ensure smooth operations.
Ensure that all your media plans are in place in accordance to your launch plans.
Follow-up closely with PR and Corporate Marketing team to ensure marketing and PR coverage for the products and launches are in place.
Direct Marketing agency to ensure in-store concepts and activities are well prepared and executed.

Plan and execute impactful promotions and events setup.
Ensure all POSM are delivered in timely basis for the launches.
Execute sales and marketing activities in consensus with HQ
Coordinate between local teams to implement solutions to enhance the effectiveness of sales and marketing strategies

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Objectives of the position:

The Product Manager is responsible for design, development, implementation, and analysis of products. Performs routine engineering design tasks using standard techniques. Fair knowledge of
cable and components applications.

Key Responsibilities

• Planning and evaluating new projects, consulting with other engineers and management as necessary.
• Review new product plans and make recommendations for material selection, based on design objectives such as strength, weight, heat resistance, electrical conductivity, and cost.
• Work with account managers, sales, production and engineers to establish cost estimates and production standards.
• Identifies process bottlenecks and devises solutions to resolve.
• Prepare technical drawings to ensure that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements. Where applicable.
• Optimizes productivity in both the engineering and production areas by designing, implementing and testing new procedures.
• Contributes to the teams’ efforts by successfully completing related tasks as needed.

Skills & Qualification

• Analytical skills for troubleshooting designs that are not working as planned and finding answers that work by asking the right questions and testing options.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively explain details of the process and findings to groups of all skillsets.
• Interpersonal skills to develop strong and positive working relationships with the engineering team and all employees in the production process.
• Strong technical knowledge and critical thinking
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering. Electrical or Electronics preferred.
• 5 years of engineering experience preferred.
• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) systems.

title: Project / Product Manager for ERP System Development
company_info: AppsPOS is a leading provider of customised software solutions to the F&B and Retail sector in Southeast Asia. We are currently seeking an experienced Systems Engineer with a strong background in .NET technologies and ERP system development to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the design and implementation of our ERP system.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
AppsPOS is a leading provider of customized software solutions for the F&B and Retail sectors. Our products include cloud-based Point of Sales systems, mobile app ordering, online payments, customer loyalty programs, kitchen display systems, and queue systems. With a footprint across Southeast Asia, we are rapidly expanding our operations and are looking for a dynamic Project/Product Manager to join our team.

Job Summary:
The Project/Product Manager will be responsible for overseeing the development of a new ERP system. This role requires excellent communication skills, an analytical mindset, and the ability to work closely with both the founder and an offshore development team. Experience with ERP systems is an added advantage, although candidates with the right attitude and willingness to learn quickly are also encouraged to apply.

Key Responsibilities:
Lead the development of the ERP system from conceptualization to launch.
Translate user requirements into development requirements for the offshore developer team.
Work closely with the founder in both pre-sales and post-sales support.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure project milestones are met.
Conduct market research to identify opportunities for product enhancements.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior management.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Business, Computer Science, or related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in project or product management is an added advantage.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex requirements into actionable plans.
Experience with ERP systems is an added advantage.
Candidates without ERP knowledge may apply if they possess a strong work ethic, commitment, and willingness to learn quickly.

What We Offer:
Competitive salary and benefits.
Opportunity to work closely with the founder and senior management.
A fast-paced environment with enormous opportunities for career growth.
Exposure to international markets, particularly in Singapore and Hong Kong.

Benefits Summary:
Consumer products
Basic up to $10k + VB
Monday – Friday: 9am – 6.30pm
Location: Bendemeer Road
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute go-to-market strategy by taking into consideration of the global view. e.g.: opportunities and target customers, initial development of the positioning, value proposition, pricing framework as well as initial capacity plans).
Source, build and maintain relationships with our partners, working closely to design and manufacturer new product models.
You would be required to lead and drive product development, conducting consumer and market research, define product requirements, lead and drive product launches, developing and maintaining user manuals and manage product roadmaps and timelines.
Partner with software development on the product requirements and oversee smart home integration for the product category.
Identify and prioritize new product opportunities for the product category, based on market trends, customer needs and competitive analysis.
Work with marketing to monitor and drive product success.
Drive innovation within product area with industry trends and best practices.
Ensure senior management are up to date with reports and communication on the progress of the product category.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline e.g., Management, Marketing, Commerce, Engineering or Finance.
Minimum of 8 years’ relevant working experience in B2B product management experience with ability to independently lead the agenda.
No fear of the unknown. You have to be an analytical self-starter, comfortable with complete uncertainty as we look to venture into new product lines or models. You need to be able to dive in and test all angles without supervision.
Data driven. You need to be able to structure, quantify and qualify information on product research, and present this to stakeholders explaining the logic. Comfort with spreadsheet software and data modelling is essential.
Strong Business acumen – Understanding of the wider environment within which our business operates and implications of e.g., trends / shifts in sustainability and consumer perception, brand owners’ opportunity & challenges, and being able to drive actionable insights and articulate what products/services to offer to accelerate profitable growth.
Detailed oriented with strong project management skills on multi-market projects

title: Product Launcher
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Banking and Finance, Information Technology, Insurance
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Digital Transformation Office (DTO) plays a crucial role towards Income’s vision of insurance made different by leading innovative digital initiatives and building new business models to serve digital-first consumers and position Income for the future. Some examples include the first rainsurance in Singapore which protects individuals against fare surge on ride-hailing platforms and the first micro-insurance in Southeast Asia which offers flexible pay-per-trip micro premium and accumulative coverage for Grab drivers.

As a Product Launcher of a new business team, you will set and provide direction to the development team and stakeholders throughout the project. You will partner closely with the Lead to assess value, develop use cases and prioritise stories to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy. You will be actively involved in planning product release plans and set the expectation for delivery of new functionalities. In doing so, you play a crucial role in managing timelines and mitigating impediments impacting successful product updates, while delivering a great experience for the customers.

Responsibilies
Responsible for product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle, including gathering and prioritising product and customer requirements, working closely with the development teams, sales, marketing and support to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met
Responsible for product release process and coordinating all activities required to bring the product to market, including coordinating User Acceptance Testing and System Integration Testing
Collaborate well in a team and across cross-functional teams within Income (e.g. IT, Underwriting, Finance, Claims) to scope product requirements, bridging gaps and aligning all teams involved
Requirements
1-2 years track record of digital product management
Experience and knowledge of the insurance industry will be advantageous
Experience with IT development processes, in both waterfall/agile delivery approach
Outstanding communication, presentation, organisational and time management skills
Sharp, analytical problem-solving skills
Strong ownership and project management skills, quick learner, result driven, logical
Keep abreast with competitive landscape and new trends

title: Chief Product Owner, Straight2Bank Mobile
company_info: Singapore Standard Chartered Bank in Singapore is part of an international banking group, with more than 150 years of history in some of the world’s most dynamic markets. Our purpose is to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, and our heritage and values are expressed in our brand promise, Here for good. The Bank has a history of over 160 years in Singapore, where we opened our first branch in 1859. In October 1999, we were among the first international banks to receive a Qualifying Full Bank (QFB) licence, an endorsement of the Group’s longstanding commitment to our business in the country. Singapore is home to the majority of our global business leadership, our technology operations, as well as SC Ventures, our innovation hub. In 2013, the Bank transferred our Singapore Retail and SME businesses to a locally incorporated subsidiary, Standard Chartered Bank (Singapore) Limited (“SCBSL”). And in May 2019, we fully consolidated our business operations in Singapore through the transfer of our Commercial Banking, Corporate & Institutional Banking and Private Banking businesses to SCBSL. SCBSL is one of the highest-rated banks globally: A1/Stable by Moody’s Investor Services, A/Stable by Standard & Poor’s and A+/Stable by Fitch Ratings. In August 2020, we were the first and only bank to be awarded the “Significantly Rooted Foreign Bank” (SRFB) status by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. In December 2020, we were granted enhanced SRFB privileges, in recognition of the significantly higher degree of rootedness exceeding the SRFB baseline criteria.
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
job_category: Banking and Finance, Information Technology, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Role Responsibilities
· In Standard Chartered Bank’s Corporate, Commercial & Institutional Banking (CCIB), we aim to be digital-first and data-driven, delivering enhanced client experiences, driving new wallet share and realizing untapped client value and market opportunities.
· Part of CCIB’s Digital Channels & Data Analytics (DCDA), we are building a complete end-to-end, digital-first client journey from onboarding, transacting to servicing and reporting. We are passionate about developing and delivering Best in Class digital client experience through consistent, well designed, contextual user journeys across all our client touchpoints such as the web and mobile.
· The Chief Product Owner (CPO) of Standard Chartered Corporate Banking S2B Mobile App is a role in the Digital Channel and Data analytics (“DCDA”) team within Standard Chartered’s Corporate, Commercial and Institutional Banking (“CCIB”) client segment. The S2B Mobile App serves our global clients across our 40+ footprint markets. As the CPO you will be responsible for shaping the mobile strategy and roadmap in collaboration and alignment with CCIB businesses, execute on it through disciplined product development, laser-focussed on delivery and time-to-speed. You will lead a cross-functional team of product managers, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to deliver a world-class mobile app experience for our corporate clients.
Strategy
· Define and execute on the mobile strategy for Corporate, Commercial, and Institutional banking (CCIB) to facilitate Straight2bank access ‘on-the-go’ for our clients, across our footprint that will position Standard Chartered as a leader in this space
· Provide thought leadership and be the workstream lead for the ambitious mobile channels workstream
· Working with both a strategic and a tactical focus, the suitable candidate will be responsible for delivery of a significant investment in enhancing our clients’ digital experience. The candidate shall determine priorities, manage deliveries, prioritise product developments based on client requirements and client insights to achieve agreed outcomes.
· Experience building out business benefit case and present to senior leadership audience with the objective of garnering support and resource allocation on proposed mobile initiatives and/or investment asks.
Business
· The role requires close partnership with Financial Markets and Transaction Banking businesses to develop an awareness and understanding of the wider business and their objectives to align the mobile roadmap with these goals to deliver jointly for our clients. Other key stakeholders include frontline, Implementation teams, CFCC, legal and compliance.
Processes
· Roadmap/Backlog Planning: Develop and maintain a detailed product roadmap, prioritizing features, and ensuring alignment with business goals and client needs.
· Product Development: Oversee the entire product development lifecycle, from concept to launch, ensuring timely delivery of features and enhancements.
· Data-Driven Decision-Making: Leverage data and client insights from NPS, GA, CSAT to make informed decisions, optimize product features, and drive continuous improvement. Work alongside Data team in ensuring provision of management information, metrics and useful insights for S2B Mobile App.
· Budget Management: Manage the product budget effectively, making strategic investment decisions to maximize ROTE
People & Talent
· Provide effective leadership and management to direct reports and ensure they are highly engaged and performing to their potential
· Lead and inspire a cross-functional team, including product managers, designers, and engineers, to deliver high-quality mobile features and enhancements.
· Ensure active communication of vision, priorities and progress to the business to foster engagement, awareness and motivation
· Lead the team through example and build the appropriate culture and values with clients and with internal stakeholders. The role requires the ongoing training and development of people and ensures that holders of all critical functions are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles ensuring that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks. This includes strategically grooming talent by moving talent globally, and the ability to attract and retain high quality talent, with succession planning for critical roles.
· Set and monitor job descriptions and objectives for direct reports and provide feedback and rewards in line with their performance against those responsibilities and objectives.
Risk Management
· Review applicable internal policies and procedures to prevent gaps against risk governance framework.
· Identify and mitigate risks related to product development, compliance, legal, and security teams. To have strong engagement and liaison with these teams to drive the regulatory approvals required to ensure Straight2bank Mobile App remains compliant with banking and data protection laws.
· Ensure Country compliance on Group standard for Audit and Control.
· To be the product SPOC with the local risk committees
Governance
· Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group’s arrangements to deliver effective governance, oversight, and controls in the business and, if necessary, oversee changes in these areas
· Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.
· Willingness to ‘speak up’ in the event of any realized or perceived breach of group conduct rules or laws by colleagues
· Willingness to work with any local regulators in an open and cooperative manner.
Regulatory & Business Conduct
· Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
· Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
· Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
· Lead the team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles. Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment.
Key stakeholders
· Technology (Interactive Channels, DCDA Tech, Delivery Teams, Solution Architect Teams, Security Technology Teams)
· Digital Platforms and Products, DCDA (Cash, Trade, FM, Digital Servicing, Client Onboarding, Common Platform Services, Data Analytics & Insights, Channel Performance & Measurement)
· Client Engagement, DCDA (Regional Teams, Digital Client engagement team, Digital Adoption & Growth team, Global deployment, Research and Insight team)
· Client Experience, DCDA (Design Operations, Design Product/Platforms)
· API & Open Banking Ecosystems, DCDA
· Project/Program Management Office, DCDA
· DCDA COO
· Transaction Banking (Cash, Trade, Financial Markets, Implementation Teams, Client Servicing)
Our Ideal Candidate
· 12 + years’ experience with a proven track record of success in Digital or mobile product management and development, preferably in Corporate and Institutional Banking or in a Fintech
· Proven track record in leading and implementing digitalization and/or transformation initiatives preferably in Corporate and Institutional Banking driving adoption of digital solutions and increasing share of revenue and/or realising cost efficiencies by leveraging digital capabilities.
· Experience building out robust business benefit cases and Value propositions to positively influence decision makers on prioritization and resource allocation related decisions
· Solid understanding of the mobile app architecture, OS - iOS, Android, cross-platform development tools like React Native and programming languages such as Swift, Kotlin, Java to effectively engage with technical teams to make informed decisions
· Exposure working on application integration with internal and external services, such as payment gateways, authentication systems, and third-party data providers enabled through APIs and other integration mechanisms
· App Performance Optimization – know how: App size, code, UI and layout
Role Specific Technical Competencies
· App Performance Optimization – know how: App size, code, UI and layout
· Agile methodology: Good understanding of the product development lifecycle using Agile Methodology and relevant prior experience in drafting vision statements, epics and user stories, use case documents, solution papers, business workflow documents and high-level functional flows.
· A skilled negotiator with an ability to work across all organization levels
· Effective and positive written and verbal communications especially when acting as a liaison between departments, internal employees/subordinates and clients.
· Highly experienced in stakeholder management and working closely with global senior leaders, including business product heads, COOs and CIOs
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:
· Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
· Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
· Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
· Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations
· Time-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum
· Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns
· Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
· A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning
· Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

title: Operation Manager (Sushi Production / Outlet)
company_info: JSTT SINGAPORE PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us:
We are a leading sushi manufacturer and distributor with a strong presence in supermarkets in Singapore. We are committed to delivering high-quality sushi products to our customers while providing an exceptional dining experience at our sushi counters. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a dedicated and experienced Operation Manager to oversee both our production facility and outlet operations.

Job Description:
We are seeking an Operation Manager to join our team and take charge of our sushi production facility and outlet operations. The ideal candidate will be a skilled leader with a passion for food production and customer service. If you are a results-oriented individual with a deep understanding of sushi production, supply chain management, and outlet management, we want to hear from you.

Responsibilities:

Production Facility Management:
Oversee all aspects of sushi production, ensuring quality, safety, and efficiency.
Manage a team of sushi chefs, kitchen staff, and production workers.
Develop and maintain production schedules to meet customer demand.
Monitor inventory levels and procurement of raw materials.
Implement and enforce food safety and sanitation standards.
Continuously optimize production processes for cost-effectiveness.

Outlet Management:
Supervise the daily operations of our sushi counters in supermarkets.
Train and motivate staff to deliver exceptional customer service.
Monitor sales performance and implement strategies to increase revenue.
Maintain inventory levels, including fresh ingredients and sushi products.
Ensure compliance with food safety regulations and health standards.
Handle customer feedback and resolve any issues promptly.
Budget and Cost Management:
Develop and manage budgets for both the production facility and outlets.
Monitor expenses and identify cost-saving opportunities.
Analyze financial reports to make data-driven decisions.
Quality Control:
Maintain high-quality standards for sushi products.
Conduct regular quality checks and implement improvements.
Ensure consistency in taste, presentation, and portion control.
Qualifications:
Proven experience in sushi production and outlet management, preferably in a similar role.
Strong leadership and team management skills.
Knowledge of sushi preparation techniques and food safety standards.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle pressure.

If you are a dynamic and driven individual who is passionate about sushi production and providing outstanding customer experiences, we invite you to apply for the Operation Manager position. Join our team and be a part of our journey to deliver the best sushi products to our valued customers.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
QA/QC Manager
Responsible for leading, planning, coordinating and developing the Out-Going Quality Assurance team on policies, procedures and implementations to ensure machine quality before shipment.
Manage the development and implementation of Out-Going QA/QC Processes. This includes:
Out-Going testing/ inspection process for machine acceptance or reject before delivery to customer.
Machine defect/ non-compliance process for reject resolution.
Lead, supervise and develop Out-Going QA/QC capabilities. This includes:
Test / Inspection methodology
Tools and facilities for test / inspection
Engage within QA teams (Supplier and Incoming) on issues and concerns relating to supplier, product and production.
Engage with inter-functional teams (Production, Procurement, Engineering) on issues and concerns relating to planning and execution.
Engage and establish processes with Production teams to support Out-Going inspection / test.
Continually improve processes and tools to be efficient and effective in meeting product and service quality.
Lead and manage a team of technician/s and inspectors across plant.
May perform other duties as assigned by GM and Director of Production.
Manage ISO9001 on quality management and Control.
Produce monthly QA/QC status report and conduct monthly QC meeting.
Communication and follow up with both inhouse and customers claims.
Coordinates with machine shop and assembly in achieving monthly claim ratio.
Ensure company quality polices and procedures are adhered in all phases of work.
Ensure all QA/QC activities such as verifications, inspections and tests are performed in a safe manner.
Conduct and participate in quality audit.
Coordinates and participate in NCR, DCR, concession request, etc.
Establish, collect and maintain records to provide evidence of conformity to requirements.
Requirements:
Minimum Diploma in Mechanical or Engineering. Degree will be added advantage.
Experience in quality function with min 5 years working in a machinery manufacturing environment
Familiar with ISO9001 standards and implementations
Proven qualities and skills with the desire to teach and mentor staff

Possess a Degree preferably in SCM with minimum 4 to 5 years of related working experience in a sales environment preferred

Good interpersonal skills, multi-task and ability to follow-up
Strong team player with an ability to work within a matrix organization

title: Group Product Manager
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At foodpanda, we’re on a mission to redefine how technology, food, people and culture all connect across the 150 cities and 12 countries we operate in. Our Tech & Product teams are working on big challenges and complex scalability problems that come with processing upwards of 500 million orders annually. You’ll play a key role within highly collaborative, cross-functional and agile squads comprised of frontend, backend and mobile engineers, in partnership with design and product owners.
Our tribes and squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment, with flat structures where everyone has a say. We are building large scale and complex systems where you can impact users on a global level whilst enjoying autonomy to influence within a flexible working environment. Here you can learn, thrive and grow to become a better engineer, designer or product manager.

As the Group Product Manager, and a Leader you will be responsible and accountable to define and deliver features that contribute to the growth of vertical across different markets.You’ll define the value propositions, product Vision & strategy, go to market and KPIs we should focus on to grow the foodpanda business. You will be building a product that offers a unique value proposition for our customers, vendors and the platform.
You will also liaise with other product management and leadership teams and work closely with business development, marketing, finance, legal to get feedback from partners ,customers and international teams to define and build product requirements in order to grow the business.

What’s on the menu:
Set the vision, product strategy and roadmap to drive growth and business impact.
Define metrics to measure the health and success of your products and initiatives.
Run experiments to support your product decisions with data.
Identify and execute on opportunities to optimize acquisition funnel and improve user onboarding.
Understand user needs and build delightful user experiences in collaboration with the design team.
Align with business stakeholders and other product teams to drive meaningful outcomes and ensure cohesive user experience.
Lead product execution and help your squad members thrive.
Work closely with the engineering teams across products to build scalable and robust solutions.
Keep apprised of innovations and trends in the industry as well as emerging technologies, and inspire teams to stay ahead of the curve.
What you can bring to the table:
You’ve been successful building products for consumers in growing markets (experience in consumer facing products is strongly preferred)
You are equally comfortable developing product strategies and roadmaps, deriving insights from data and understanding high-level technical architectures.
You are obsessed with the user experience and have a track record of successful collaboration with designers.
You have experience running experiments and leveraging qualitative and quantitative data, balanced with product sense, to drive product decisions.
You are good at leading and influencing, and demonstrated product leadership in the past.
You have solid experience leading agile teams and great at turning epics into well-structured user stories.
You are willing to take action, challenge the status quo and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
You are comfortable with ambiguity and able to balance priorities.
You are great at communications and have experience presenting to senior management and building consensus.
You have a curious growth mindset paired with strong execution.
About foodpanda
foodpanda (small ‘f’) is the world’s favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it’s getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.

Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology, efficiency and simplicity as much as we do, there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.

We always genuinely care about experience, efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda’s operations with the best tools on hand.

title: Associate Product Manager
company_info: Airwallex facilitates the transformation of businesses from offline to online, from local to global. Airwallex was built with a single purpose in mind – to create a world where all businesses can operate without borders and restrictions, and by doing so, propel the growth of the global digital economy.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The product organisation is at the core of Airwallex, bringing together commercial strategy, engineering, design, and financial compliance to deliver Airwallex’s product suite to a customer audience around the world. We care about perfection in the details and creating first-class products at a global scale. Our Product members are creative and dynamic problem solvers who dive into new challenges daily and can communicate across all levels of the organisation.

This role will be part of the online payments product team, building out our online payments capabilities that enable businesses to collect credit card and other forms of payments on their website or app from consumers around the world. As part of this role, you will likely work on various different projects to improve the experience of businesses using online payments, such as:
Creating easy-to-understand user experiences for businesses to set up, monitor and operate their online stores with Airwallex online payments
Reducing integration efforts for businesses to get started with Airwallex through different integration methods and excellent product/ API documentation
Building solutions for platforms and marketplaces that want to enable online payments for merchants on their platform/ marketplace
For this, you will collaborate closely with other product managers, engineering teams and other stakeholders in the business. You will take projects from idea to successful launch and adoption and will be ultimately responsible for the customer's success.

Requirements:
Computer Science (or other STEM) Bachelor's degree or above with a competitive GPA
A minimum of one internship in a top-flight tech company or consultancy
Fluent in English & Mandarin; written and spoken
Solid technical understanding and ability to engage in architectural discussions with engineering teams
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey product strategy to both technical and non-technical audiences
High attention to detail, ability to structure complex problems and inform decisions with data and first-principle insights
Drive, grit and persistence necessary to take ownership and move ideas to reality in short periods of time
Ability to thrive in cross-cultural and cross-functional teams

title: Graduate Production Management Analyst (WEGPMSG)
company: M THREE CORPORATE CONSULTING SINGAPORE PTE. LIMITED
company_info: WANT TO WORK IN THE WORLD OF TECHNOLOGY OR BANKING? KICK START YOUR CAREER WITH WILEY EDGE (FORMERLY MTHREE). GRADUATE TRAINING, ONGOING SUPPORT, OPPORTUNITIES AT BLUE-CHIP COMPANIES - THE ALUMNI GRADUATE PROGRAM GIVES YOU EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER.
job_category: Banking and Finance, Consulting, Engineering, Information Technology
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Graduate Production Management Analyst
Want to work in technology at an investment bank?
Get paid while you train, ongoing support, opportunities at leading global employers – the Alumni graduate program gives you everything you need. (And don’t worry, there’s no training bond. No exit fees, no hidden catches).
Here at Wiley Edge, we pair great graduates with brilliant global businesses. Our clients include tier one investment banks and other organizations across a range of industries.
What you'll do:
Production Management plays a vital role in enterprise technology, from algorithmic trading engines to regulatory reporting.
Think of it as healthcare for technology. As a production management analyst with Wiley Edge, you’ll be on a shared mission to look after the technical systems and processes other teams rely on.
How the Alumni program works:
1. Apply via this job advert.
2. Complete our assessment process.
3. Get trained at Wiley Edge Academy in an online class for 4-8 weeks with other graduates.
4. Join a Wiley Edge client for 12-24 months while receiving support and salary increases every 6 months.
5. The vast majority then convert to permanent employees with the client at the end of the program.
What you’ll learn at the Wiley Edge Academy:
· How to discuss production support activity at a high level including ITIL (information technology infrastructure library), monitoring, DevOps, SRE (site reliability engineering), and disaster recovery.
· How to discuss common financial topics, including financial markets, equity trading, derivatives, currency, treasury, regulation, and risk.
· How to write a basic computer program in Python, including user input, common data structures, and flow of control.
· How to use MySQL to perform CRUD (create, read, update and delete) operations on a relational database stored in a MySQL Server.
What you need:
· Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related STEM subject (science, technology, engineering, maths).
· Good grades. We look for potential, not prestige, but it’s important that you enjoy pushing yourself to pick up new ideas.
· Ability to troubleshoot, taking an analytical approach to solve problems.
· Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.
· The right to work without needing visa sponsorship.
What you’ll get:
· Fully paid, in-depth, interactive training in small classes with graduates like you. Our training is created and delivered by industry experts who know your field inside out.
· A generous graduate salary.
· Pay rises every 6 months to reflect your progress.
· A flexible benefits package.
· Ongoing training and support.
· Valuable industry experience. Ultimately, a foot in the door to build your career in an in-demand niche.
How to apply:
1. Apply to this job advert to tell us a bit about you.
2. Complete the online assessment (we’ll send you a link by email).
3. Complete the interviews with our friendly talent team over phone and video.
4. Lastly, you’ll interview with one or more of our clients.
We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each and every individual who contributes to making Wiley Edge the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within Wiley Edge and with our partner companies, and we're proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish. That means promoting a strong culture of equality but, most importantly, inclusion. We never want people to change - only add to the amazing mix of people that work for Wiley Edge.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
company_info: PropertyGuru.com.sg, Singapore's leading property portal and a flagship website of PropertyGuru's Network – Asia's Property Guru. PropertyGuru.com.sg is used by over 4.5 million consumers who view over 50 million pages. A favourite with local property seekers, PropertyGuru.com.sg is the largest online property database in Singapore, with several awards under its belt and features real time access to multi-media rich content covering property and home-related products, services, news, advice, guides and tools. It works closely with prominent real estate developers in Singapore and overseas, over 20,000 housing agents, and home-related firms.
address: PAYA LEBAR QUARTER, 1 PAYA LEBAR LINK 408533
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Make A Real Difference at PropertyGuru.
Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.

PropertyGuru is Southeast Asia’s leading PropTech company, and the preferred destination for over 41 million property seekers to connect with more than 63,000 agents monthly to find their dream home. PropertyGuru empowers property seekers with more than 3.2 million real estate listings, in-depth insights, and solutions that enable them to make confident property decisions across Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, and Vietnam.

PropertyGuru.com.sg was launched in Singapore in 2007 and since then PropertyGuru Group has made the property journey a transparent one for property seekers in Southeast Asia. In the last 15 years, PropertyGuru has grown into a high-growth PropTech company with a robust portfolio of leading property marketplaces across its core markets; award-winning mobile apps; mortgage marketplace, PropertyGuru Finance; and a host of enterprise solutions now under PropertyGuru For Business, including a high-quality developer sales enablement platform, FastKey, DataSense, ValueNet, Awards, events and publications across Asia.

Responsibilities:
PropertyGuru has decided to fundamentally reshape how users finance homes! Our vision is to marry the home search and home financing journey, making owning a home friction free. We launched our business in early 2020 and are ramping up to ignite the next phase of growth. We are looking for an ambitious, seasoned Product Marketing Manager to join our dedicated FinTech team and help us develop and execute marketing strategies that drive acquisition, adoption, and growth.

About your dream role:
Bring the PropertyGuru Finance Brand positioning to life in collaboration with the brand team.
Devise strategies to enhance brand awareness and consideration among Home seekers.
Collaborate closely with our dedicated product managers to determine our product positioning, messaging, and benefits.
Formulate and execute product marketing strategies and go-to-market plans for our range of digital home financing products.
Stitch together insights from across all the touchpoints and channels in a user’s homebuying journey, identifying areas to improve acquisition and engagement
Oversee and drive marketing campaigns in coordination with dedicated marketing functions, covering agency management, media planning, SEO, paid advertising, and social media.
Develop content strategies, ranging from educational content, market deep dives, and key opinion leader pieces.
Analyze and track marketing metrics to assess the success of initiatives.
Requirements:
8+ years of experience in product marketing.
Strong understanding of product marketing principles and best practices and experience in executing these for online products/services.
Ability to think strategically and provide clear direction for digital product go-to-market while effectively managing rollout details.
Proven experience in developing marketing plans spanning multiple channels, including SEO, Paid, and Social Media, among others.
Proficiency in crafting concise and effective marketing copy for diverse audiences, including both technical and non-technical segments.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and collaborate with various cross-functional stakeholders.
Solid grasp of marketing analytics, understanding user journeys and how to measure their effectiveness.
Positive attitude, unbounded curiosity and comfort in a fast-paced environment.
PropertyGuru Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative an learning environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to gender, identity, race, religion, nationality, age, marital status, disability, or any other protected status, per applicable law. If there is anything we can do to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.
