title: Associate Product Manager
company_info: Fabrica.ai invents and builds automatic tile grouting robots to boost construction productivity and currently pilots on construction sites in Singapore managed by Woh Hup, BHCC, Gin Chia, Soilbuild, and Dragages. This should correspond to about 30% of the Singaporean market. We have early leads in the US and Europe as well. Tile grouting is the process of filling up the gaps between tiles after the tiles have been laid. Grouting is part of virtually every construction project. It is a highly laborious process and one of the most physically damaging tasks in the trade as it hurts tilers’ knees and back. Thus, quality issues would also arise. Our robots are able to grout most given spaces without much issues, we should be ready for mass deployment soon. timelapse: https://drive.google.com/file/d/18N5IF3u6noZfoIzX3Ua7cUbc3O7cCmSx/view?usp=sharing Recently, we had a Presentation to Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7034394354731413504 We have also raised 850k USD from Hoxton Ventures to enable our development in not just our tile grouting robots but also other forms of construction automation. This is in addition to our pre-seed round from our Cambridge University Professor and the owner of BHCC. In addition to Singapore, members of Fabrica AI can be found in Czech Republic, UK (including Cambridge), US, and Switzerland. Tile grouting would serve as a stepping stone for us to expand into other forms of construction automation.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, General Management, Human Resources, Marketing / Public Relations, Purchasing / Merchandising
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Fabrica AI is creating a future where ideating and developing a robot for any task takes days, not years. We believe that by training end to end controls in simulation with reinforcement learning and above that iterating hardware designs, we can automate the whole development process. At the current stage, the most important resource is a large fleet of robots to validate our approaches for our AI system and to collect data. This would help keep us grounded in reality.
To start building up the fleet, we invented an automatic tile grouting robot that boosts productivity by 5x and are piloting it on construction sites in Singapore managed by Woh Hup, BHCC, Gin Chia, Soilbuild, and Dragages. This should correspond to about 30% of the Singaporean market. We have early leads in the US and Europe as well. Tile grouting is the process of filling up the gaps between tiles after the tiles have been laid. Grouting is part of virtually every construction project and a highly laborious process, is considered one of the most physically damaging tasks resulting in tilers’ knees and back issues, and thus quality issues would also arise. We invented a patent pending robot that is able to automatically grout and clean tile gaps with only a press of a button. The operators would only need to reload grout and water.

We have also pitched at the Built Environment Demo Day 2022 organised by BCA as part of the International Built Environment Week (IBEW) and won the Rising Star Award. IBEW has drawn more than 10,000 individuals from over 100 countries.

Recently, we had a Presentation to Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7034394354731413504
We have also raised 850k USD from Hoxton Ventures to enable our development in not just our tile grouting robots but also other forms of construction automation.
Website: https://www.fabrica.ai/
Latest Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/188KeCqgzwHAlwcr5etLjK0jRmFvheAbP/view?usp=sharing

Your role would be a cross between bringing our robot to market and helping to develop our robot, especially from the perspective of our clients. You may be remunerated with a combination of salary and share options. This role requires a reasonable amount of technical understanding/engineering interest.
Having a basic understanding of all technical aspects of our work (mechanical design, 3d printing, electronics design and manufacturing, and software controls).
Visiting industry trial sites to test our robot and giving appropriate feedback and ideas on what we could improve on.
Speaking to industry players, ground workers, understanding the various processes around or related to tile grouting to help us shape our solution, especially from an operational point of view.
Connecting manufacturers and our R&D team to build and iterate on our prototype, creating new avenues for manufacturing at scale, manufacturing for reliability
Sourcing for and testing appropriate equipments and materials for R&D
Scheduling and joining meetings with prospective clients, investors, and partners
Market research for expansion overseas
Accounting, purchasing, logistics, general operations
Scouting for new opportunities, writing proposals for them, and pushing fabrica out there
Contributing to our go-to-market strategy for overseas markets beyond Singapore.
Hiring and recruitment
Website and other marketing/public relations management
Any other operational duties
A great candidate would possess the following:
Value the direct impact on the product and proximity to clients at a startup and the growth potential of a startup
Willing to work without a very well defined job scope and willing to adapt to changes week on week
Ability to think of metrics to measure progress and deciding based on back of the envelope calculations
Keenness to do more than is expected, impact driven
Growth mindset driven
Our development process is very iterative and agile. Thus, there would not be a concrete plan more than 2 weeks ahead and your role/tasks is/are likely to evolve over time. If you like this process, you’d be a good fit for us. You would thus play a significant part in deciding how your work would contribute to our overall goals. Please email your resume to careers@fabrica.ai if you are interested. Thank you.

title: Manager, Product Software Architecture & Engineering
company_info: EQUINIX ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD. Equinix, Inc. (Nasdaq: EQIX), connects more than 4,000 companies directly to their customers and partners inside the world’s most networked data centers. Today, enterprise, cloud, networking, digital media and financial services companies leverage the Equinix interconnection platform in over 30 strategic markets across the Americas, EMEA and Asia-Pacific. By connecting directly to their strategic partners and end users, customers are forming dynamic ecosystems inside Equinix. These interconnected ecosystems enable companies to optimize the performance of their content and applications and protect their vital digital assets.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.
At Equinix, we help the world’s digital leaders scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences, and transform people’s lives. Our culture is based on collaboration and the growth and development of our teams.
We hire hardworking people who thrive on solving challenging problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, and try new approaches, as we grow our product portfolio with new software and network architecture solutions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary
Provides overall software program management, drives adoption of standard methodologies, handles partner's communication, and reviews software design and architecture.

Responsibilities
Lead an experienced team of engineers, and responsible for growing and developing the team while inspiring them to achieve the goals of Equinix
Guide the team towards achieving the annual organizational goals and quarterly objectives and key results
Facilitates quarterly performance of the team
Casts the engineering vision for the team and collaborating with Product Management partners towards achieving the vision
Create a strong engineering culture around Quality, Security, Engineering Excellence and Operational Excellence
Partners with Product Management partners, and other engineering managers to deliver high-quality, scalable, and reliable functionalities
Exercise rigor in prioritizing the roadmap, both functional and technical, to deliver the highest for Equinix customers
Qualifications
More than 8 years of experience working directly with customers & partners providing business & technology solutions, and have led the design and delivery of technical implementations. Possesses hands-on experience and know-how in AWS/GCP and technologies like Ansible, Containers, K8, etc. Certifications like AWS Certified Solution Architect (Professional) will be advantageous
Sound understanding of Identity concepts such as SAML, JWT, Oauth, and also Micro services based architectures, Service oriented design & architecture, Application Integration & Messaging, Security and Web 2.0
Strong understanding of design patterns and standard methodologies in Java platform including UI, Application & Frameworks development
Strong Experience/Knowledge on Data modeling (RDBMS, XSD, JSON), Database/XML interaction, SQL, Stored Procedure and ORM
Experience working with Open Source API Gateway Frameworks, Mulesoft/Apigee API Gateway is a huge plus
Working experience with Swagger (Open API Spec), OAuth, REST, JSON
Good understanding of CI/CD systems and Container based deployments on Docker
Experience working in agile environment and with agile frameworks
Possesses good communication (written and verbal), organization and presentation skills
Required Key Competencies
Technical and Functional Excellence: The candidate will have demonstrated proficiency/capability to handle within a framework of operational and engineering excellence along with direct experience leading a global organization. The candidate will possess a deep technical understanding of current and future trends within the payments industry and be capable of developing and driving a strategy that uses new technology to support system stability, availability, and product evolution and business performance. The individual is proficient in designing, developing, and deploying scalable software solutions to deliver exceptional quality to clients
Thought Leadership: The successful individual brings an approach that embraces innovation and questions conventional wisdom. A recognized domain expert in key areas such as resiliency technology, system availability and tools development. In addition, the individual is an expert with regards to emerging technology trends, innovation, and developments related to mobile applications and digital technologies. Individual also understands quality success measures
Team Leadership: The candidate will recruit, lead, mentor, and develop an excellent engineering technology team and provide opportunities for growth to ensure continuity of the departments leadership. The ideal candidate will develop a culture comfortable with challenging current market paradigms to achieve and exceed goals. The candidate will help build best-in-class capabilities
Individual & Organizational Leadership: The candidate will think with a global mentality and develop solutions to meet the varying needs of everyone, everywhere. The candidate will be mission driven and passionate about having a lasting impact by inspiring change in the payments industry. The candidate will enjoy working at a fast pace, be self-directed, and will be able to manage multiple and competing challenges, issues and priorities. The candidate will be motivated to explore new technologies and learn new things, while also recognizing that many good ideas and implementations may already exist. The candidate will be a customer champion

Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Consultant, Product Management & Propositions (Par / HNW)
company_info: AIA is one of the pre-eminent and the largest listed life insurance groups in the world with an exclusive focus on the Asia Pacific region. This size, leadership position and regional presence across 16 geographical markets can offer you greater exposure to new experiences and opportunities for growth and development. We have a clear vision and throughout the company’s 90 years of history, we continue to change and transform for the future and for the better. In addition to playing an important role in supporting and preserving the economies of markets where we operate, the very nature of the insurance industry is all about providing protection to people when they need it particularly during difficult times. The people at AIA are all committed to working together with this common moral purpose and take great pride from what they do. If these propositions appeal to you and if you are proactive, forward-looking and innovative, consider a career at AIA.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At AIA we’ve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.

It’s about finding new ways to not only better people's lives, but to better the communities and environments we live in. Encompassing our ambition of helping a billion people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by 2030.

And to get there, we need ambitious people who believe in playing an important part in shaping that future. People seeking unmatched career and personal growth opportunities, who are driven to work with, and learn from some of the most inspiring and supportive leaders in the business.

Sound like you? Then read on.

What you will be doing:
Support Development of / Develop competitive and innovative product solutions (including product propositions) to address customer needs and assist in the development of product strategy (as assigned).
Support product implementation activities under the purview of Product Development dept.
Perform market scan & competitor analysis and support Team Lead in monitoring & reviewing assigned product group(s).
Support in pre- and post-product launch activities, to achieve the new product sales targets.
Support in addressing product related queries, issues and maintenance of products post-launch
Support initiatives to drive towards company targets.
Ensure that shared product resources (e.g. product document templates, product database, shared folders etc) are kept up to date in a timely manner
Support for ad-hoc projects requiring product expertise, as required, to help drive company goals and outcomes.
What we are looking for:
Degree holder preferably in Business, insurance or actuarial fields
Minimum 4 years of relevant experience in Product Development or Actuarial Pricing
Preferably with accreditation in relevant modules such as LOMA, M5/M9/HI or passing actuarial exams
Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.

You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date

title: Lead Product Designer
company_info: PropertyGuru.com.sg, Singapore's leading property portal and a flagship website of PropertyGuru's Network – Asia's Property Guru. PropertyGuru.com.sg is used by over 4.5 million consumers who view over 50 million pages. A favourite with local property seekers, PropertyGuru.com.sg is the largest online property database in Singapore, with several awards under its belt and features real time access to multi-media rich content covering property and home-related products, services, news, advice, guides and tools. It works closely with prominent real estate developers in Singapore and overseas, over 20,000 housing agents, and home-related firms.
address: PAYA LEBAR QUARTER, 1 PAYA LEBAR LINK 408533
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Make A Real Difference at PropertyGuru.
Real Aspirations. Real People. Real impact.
PropertyGuru is Southeast Asia’s leading PropTech company, and the preferred destination for over 41 million property seekers to connect with more than 63,000 agents monthly to find their dream home. PropertyGuru empowers property seekers with more than 3.2 million real estate listings, in-depth insights, and solutions that enable them to make confident property decisions across Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, and Vietnam.
PropertyGuru.com.sg was launched in Singapore in 2007 and since then PropertyGuru Group has made the property journey a transparent one for property seekers in Southeast Asia. In the last 15 years, PropertyGuru has grown into a high-growth PropTech company with a robust portfolio of leading property marketplaces across its core markets; award-winning mobile apps; mortgage marketplace, PropertyGuru Finance; and a host of enterprise solutions now under PropertyGuru For Business, including a high-quality developer sales enablement platform, FastKey, DataSense, ValueNet, Awards, events and publications across Asia.
Responsibilities:
PropertyGuru is growing our team of passionate people on a mission to help people find their dream home. The design team at PropertyGuru collaborates with other teams to achieve business goals ensuring a great user experience. We're hiring an experienced designer to contribute and build PropertyGurus’s consumer marketplace for Singapore, Malaysia and other markets. The core responsibility of this role is working with Product Managers to help people find their dream home and engage them with other possible services.

What you’ll be doing
Identify gaps and opportunities to help users to find their dream home faster
Leading marketplace consumer side design to deliver high impact, inspiring design work that is driven by the needs of the customer in mind
Partnering with Product Management, Engineering, and Data Science to build and deliver on product roadmaps, iteratively, and with an experimental mindset
Defining design best practices, helping us become an exceptional place to work for the talented, highly motivated designers that we hire
As a senior member of the team, it’s expected you will support existing designers with their personal and professional development to help ensure design teams are delivering inspiring and effective solutions
Influence the product roadmap and lead new projects.
Create detailed Figma mockups along with your team and then work with engineers iteratively until deployed to production.
Measure and monitor the projects that you ship, talk to users, and iterate again
Requirements:
8+ years of experience in design and 3 to 4 years of managing a small team. Should have worked in medium to large scale organizations
A strong portfolio (preferably in STAR framework) and track record that highlights important business outcomes that you moved in current or previous organizations
You won't sacrifice our user experience to pump up short-term metrics. The long-term is more important to build trust in a 2-sided marketplace and you understand this deeply
A strong command of visual and communication design principles
You deeply care about visual design craft, and are excited to help others level up their visual and interaction execution
Able to function independently and in a team environment, with excellent collaboration skills. Excellent communication and presentation skills; both written and verbal
At PropertyGuru, one of our values is “Create what’s next”. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to push the boundaries of experience through design. If you’re excited about this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be just the right candidate for this.

title: Product and Solutions Manager, Workspace and Collaboration
company_info: StarHub is Singapore's fully-integrated info-communications company, offering a full range of information, communications and entertainment services for both consumer and corporate markets. StarHub operates a mobile network that provides 4G, 3G and 2G services. It also manages an islandwide HFC network that delivers multi-channel pay TV services (including HDTV, Internet TV and on-demand services) as well as ultra-high speed residential broadband services. StarHub operates an extensive fixed business network that provides a wide range of data, voice and wholesale services. Over Singapore’s fibre-based Next Generation Nationwide Broadband Network, StarHub offers a broad range of home and business broadband plans along with a host of advanced media-rich value-added services, such as IPTV for commercial entities. Launched in 2000, StarHub has become one of Singapore's most innovative info-communications providers, and the pioneer in 'hubbing' - the ability to deliver unique integrated and converged services to all its customers. StarHub, listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange since October 2004, is a component stock of the Straits Times Index and the MSCI Singapore Free Index.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a Product and Solutions Manager, to join our Workspace and Collaboration team in the Enterprise Business Group (EBG). As a Product and Solutions Manager, you will be responsible for voice, collaboration, and push-to-talk offerings. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of the StarHub enterprise voice products and omnichannel engagement solutions, in line with customer needs and business objectives. This role is cross-functional by nature and will involve working with internal stakeholders such as Customer Service, Sales, Sales Ops, Finance, and Project Management.
Your main responsibilities
Product development/launch, go-to-market, operations, and life-cycle management
Deliver solution and service bundles
Oversee go-to-market and promotions that are relevant to enterprises.
Manage P&L and capital expenditure. Develop and manage business cases and strive to have the best possible return on investment by leveraging the full spectrum of StarHub and vendor/partner capabilities to reduce time to market and drive adoption and return.
Manage vendor ecosystem for products/solutions assigned, including business models, commercial and operational frameworks and contracts and agreements.
Liaise with internal stakeholders such as Sales, Marketing, Customer Operations, IS, Engineering, Finance, and Legal
Oversee migrations to deliver enhance experiences for our customers.
Support digital transformation initiatives
A few things about you
You prioritise customer experience, and are driven by improving service quality.
Have a good understanding of Telco voice products, Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) telephony, Unified Communications (UC), and modern collaboration platforms.
Knowledge of push-to-talk products and services is advantageous.
Experience in contact centre or omnichannel engagement platforms is favourable.
You understand the process required for product migrations.
You take ownership of the products we manage to ensure its profitability, and delivery in a timely, customer-centric manner.
You have an analytical mind, and can plan and execute in a structured manner.
You have demonstrated the ability to work in a collaborative manner.
You demonstrate a good understanding of finance, contracts, and can navigate complex corporate systems to effectively manage product provisioning and billing.
You have a passion for technology and keep abreast of industry trends and developments.
You are able to cope with setbacks and shifts in priorities, and can find resolutions despite roadblocks.
Qualifications
At least 5 years of experience in product operations, preferably at a software, tech or telco company.
Tertiary degree in Business Management, Engineering, Computer Science or related fields.

title: Assistant Sales Manager
company_info: QUINNOX SOLUTIONS PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The incumbert responsible for customer-oriented sales engineering and business development activities. Your primary tasks will involve telecom IT BSS/OSS presales, providing technical presentations, maintaining relationships with clients and channel partners, and managing internal sales cycle processes.

You will be playing a crucial role in driving sales and building strong relationships with customers and partners. Your technical expertise and business development skills will contribute to the growth and success of the company.

Roles & Responsibilities
Telecom IT BSS/OSS Presales:
Conduct technical presentations and provide documentation to telecom customers.
Understand and analyze customers' requirements to design solutions that meet their needs.
Develop proposals, business case analysis, statements of work, and other relevant documents during tendering.
Business Development:
Work closely with the company's industry business unit leaders to lead and cultivate industry channel business development.
Meet and exceed sales quotas while adhering to the company's sales rules of engagement.
Provide weekly reports of pipeline and sales forecasts.
Product Demonstrations and Support:
Articulate product features and benefits using simplified technical terms during demonstrations.
Provide post-sales customer support as needed.
Sales Meetings and Events:
Present and demonstrate products in sales meetings, product seminars, and exhibition shows.
Sales Processes and Relationship Management:
Update orders and sales records and negotiate the best contract terms.
Be responsible for sales collection.
Maintain strong relationships with existing clients and expand sales territories by meeting new clients.
Liaison and Coordination:
Organize discussions and liaise with the production team regarding issues and effective solutions.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Telecommunications/Computer Science/Electrical/Electronic Engineering/IT or equivalent.
Minimum of 3 years of working experience in the telecom industry and vendor sales.
Experience working closely with sales, marketing, client services, executive management, operation teams, and product management.
Knowledge of Telecom BSS and OSS and cloud-based solutions design for vertical industries like e-commerce, finance, resorts, etc.
Strong customer service, analytical, and interpersonal skills.
Excellent organizational, research, and multitasking abilities.
Willingness to travel.
Ability to report and liaise closely with the HQ R&D department in Mainland CN.

title: Marketing Manager
company_info: Who we are PIF Capital is a One stop Capital Resource Platform to Fast-Track Growth Developer for SMEs. Our vision is to build A+ Companies & Capital Entrepreneur, to grow & corporatize SMEs to maximise their business valuation.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Design, Events / Promotions, General Management, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company
PIF Capital is a boutique consultancy firm dedicated to helping small and medium-sized businesses worldwide fast-track their business growth using capital mechanisms. With over a decade of experience, we have engaged with numerous SMEs, enabling us to identify common challenges and pain points. This wealth of knowledge allows us to tailor our programs specifically to guide and mentor aspiring SMEs, preparing them for their transformative journey towards Capital Entrepreneurship. We are expanding rapidly regionally and we look forward to having additional aspiring marketing personnel to be part of our growing strong team.
CRITERIONS
· Craft, deploy and achieve targeted digital marketing leads, event participation rate, and followers
· Strategize and optimize company’s brand equity/awareness (convectional/digital) i.e. click, followers, reviews
· Well verse/devise/execute/optimize omni-marketing through social media, event, digitalized spaces, etc.
· Ability to propose new digital tools to enhance effectiveness of marketing campaigns
· Ability to implement, track, improvise and report on KPI
· Take full ownership into product development roadmap and crystalize applicable innovative solutions (content, outreach, conversion herein)
· Deep understanding of product knowledge (comprehensive training is provided)
· Spearhead events and explore various governmental grants to reinforce marketing competency
· Provide know-how, mentorship and management to gel the team for optimal execution
· Frame and manage outsourcing marketing agencies in achieving company’s objectives
· Participate in sales activities to better understand, devise, and improvise marketing strategies
· Ability to work and multi-task independently, both effectively and efficiently with speed as centricity
· Team player
COMPETENCIES
· Proficient in digital marketing, platform marketing (Google SEO, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, Tiktok, etc.)
· Proficient in strategy management; content, data analytic, predictive, search engine optimization
· Natural flair in linguistic and language writing (Able to translate from English to Chinese and to communicate in bi-lingual in handling queries related to development of market needs)
· Tech-savvy and a good understanding of marketing web-tools and platforms
· Strong communicator/presenter (clear and precise manner)
· Sharp and sensitive in formulating marketing angles
· Solution provider
· Objective and task oriented
· Confident and abreast with latest marketing strategies
· Fast pace and pro-active
CHARACTER
· Can Do + Positive
· Self-Motivated + Energetic
· Resourceful + Creative
· Relish challenges + Open-minded
· People person + Relationship builder
· Fast + Empathy skill
· Discipline + Structured
CREDENTIALS
· Proven Grade A Marketer and Product Manager
· Minimum 5 years of experience in similar role
· Proven track record of effecting successful marketing strategies leveraging on content, data, outreach, and tools
· Diploma or Degree in Digital Marketing, Mass Communication, Advertising/Media related
· Other related certificate/s is a plus
CAREER
· Promotion pathway; Middle Management of a listed company
· Acquire Skills; Management, Leadership, Mentorship
· Acquire Know-how; Business Model (Scalable & Sustainable)
· As Capital Entrepreneur, Entrepreneurship environment & development
Interested candidates do send us your resume via WhatsApp or Telegram to 87141919 or email to hr@pifcapital.com.
Candidates who are able to start work immediately would be a plus.
We apologize that we will only respond to shortlisted candidates. Thank you for applying.

title: Senior Manager, Solution Architect
company_info: VISA WORLDWIDE PTE. LIMITED
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Manager, Solution Architect
(Default)
Singapore, Singapore
Full-time
Company Description
Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging – where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world – helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.
Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.
Job Description
Team Summary
Visa’s Design and Architecture team in Asia Pacific (AP) is part of Visa’s Product and Solutions function and is responsible for supporting digital solutions architecture across Visa’s issuers, acquirers, group service providers, merchants, e-commerce enablers, wallet providers, IOT partners and third-party payment processors. The Solution Architecture team is responsible for working across cross-functional stakeholder teams both internally and with external clients to prioritize, define and drive the end-to-end product development lifecycle.
This is a great opportunity to be a member of a high-performing team, who wants to bring new, intuitive, and frictionless experiences to our customers.
What a Senior Manager, Solution Architecture does at Visa
Apply a unique blend of leadership and tactical skills as well as a very strong understanding of business, technical and operational aspects of product management and development, with industry leading experience in the areas of payment card processing, network processing, e-commerce, mobile technology, digital payments, issuance, digital enablement, business user experience and adoption, research and analytics, and financial analysis.
Write technical product requirements for the software development team and ensure that all requirements are met during the development phase and before going live.
Manage technical product management functions including functional specs, roadmap, issue/risk management, and definition of success criteria for pilots.
Conduct post project assessment and create recommendations to identify successful and unsuccessful product elements and continuous refining of tech solutions
Proactively identify platform risks and consistently feed improvement, enhancements at various levels.
Design technical interfaces required for developing use cases for Digital Payments, Data and Business solutions.
Actively engage with Product, Technology and Client Service teams to ensure Visa Business Solutions products are successfully developed and business goals are supported in a cost effective, timely manner with a resulting high level of client satisfaction.
Engage with clients to gain feedback on new product offerings for continuous improvements.
Transition products and services, once developed, to core support and implementations teams to reach market scalability goals and define production support framework.
Plan and conduct User Acceptance Testing with key stakeholders, bug bashes, and hackathons.
Own and develop clear and concise product documentation detailing the pilot requirements and technical architecture.
Provide updates and highlight any technical issues on weekly basis to the executive management.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously and ensure on-time/quality delivery.
Why this is important
The role is the subject matter expert and lead for all VBS development projects for Design and Architecture, and be dedicated to drive integrated program enablement for the Visa Business Solutions (VBS) team which brings payment solutions and associated services to emerging business verticals. The role holder will work closely with our customers, industry players and internal stakeholders to bring the best experiences and commercial solutions to market.
Projects you will be a part of:
Visa Business Solutions is poised for growth as we embark on initiatives to drive new flows through new digital solutions through specific vertical solutions including virtual cards, mobile capabilities, and other payment solutions. By working with our Issuers clients, partners, as well as both local and regional Visa teams, this role brings exciting opportunities for individuals looking for a challenging, innovative and fast-paced environment where solutions are bespoke, new and potentially groundbreaking. You will get a holistic experience across research, product development, partner engagement, commercialization and sales. The solutions you build will not be client specific but scaled for an entire vertical ecosystem in AP.
This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
Qualifications
What you will need:
Minimum 8-10 years of industry experience
Strong payments domain knowledge to be able to design and architect solutions, develop new use cases for customers and have a strong understanding of technical integrations for payments platforms
Experience as a solution architect for complex payment related use cases for large client partners, managing requirements of various payment players to build payment tie-ups and prescribing simple workflows to make more convenient and simpler
Understanding of systems and processes coupled with analytical ability to solution architect complex projects involving interfaces between various systems within organization
Ability to build and maintain strong business relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
What will also help:
Expert knowledge of API technologies and systems used in payments, mobile and e-commerce, consumer authentication, 4-party payment model, authorization and clearing process, near field communication (NFC) and tokenization while keeping step with market developments
Ability to partner with various teams to solution architect digital products offered through Visa Network and Visa Developer Platform (VDP).
Experience providing consultative support to other teams for various Visa’s digital offerings such as VTS, Loyalty Products, Business Solutions, Data Products & Risk Products.
Please Note: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the evolving visa/travel restrictions in place, we are currently only able to extend offers to candidates with the right to work in Singapore. We are keeping the situation under close review and will adjust accordingly should the restrictive measures be lifted.

title: Director of International Sales Management (PV Product Business)
company: LESSO NEW ENERGY DEVELOPMENT PRIVATE LIMITED
company_info: LESSO Solar is the Flagship Business Unit of LESSO Group (HK-listed manufacturer of building materials), specialising in manufacturing solar modules, inverters, energy storage systems, and providing solar-energy solutions with global production capacity of over 10GW by the end of 2023. Our markets cover China, South East Asia, Europe, Africa and etc. We envision to build a sloar-powered world! https://www.linkedin.com/company/lessosolar/about/ https://www.youtube.com/@lessosolar
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities:

International Market Strategy Development: Responsible for formulating the international sales strategy, including market positioning, target customer segments, sales channels, to achieve the company's international market expansion and sales goals.
Sales Team Management: Lead and oversee the international sales team, ensuring its efficient operation, including team recruitment, training, motivation, and performance evaluations.
International Customer Relations: Establish and maintain international customer relationships, engage in strategic negotiations with key clients to enhance customer satisfaction, and seek new business collaboration opportunities.
Achieving Sales Targets: Develop sales plans and objectives, supervise the execution of sales activities, ensure the realization of sales targets, and promptly adjust strategies to adapt to market changes.
Market Analysis and Competitive Intelligence: Regularly analyze the dynamics of the international market, understand competitors' strategies, and monitor market trends, providing valuable information for the company's international market strategy.
Sales Policies and Contract Negotiation: Develop international sales policies, assist the team in contract negotiations, and ensure that contract signings align with the company's interests.
Sales Data Analysis: Collect and analyze sales data, provide reports on market share, sales trends, and product demand, offering data support for decision-making.
International Market Promotion: Collaborate with the marketing department to create international market promotion plans, enhancing brand awareness in international markets.
Compliance with Regulations: Ensure the compliance of international sales activities, adhering to international trade regulations and standards.

Qualifications:

1) Bachelor's degree or higher in Marketing, New Energy, or a related field.
2) Minimum of two years of experience in solar industry sales, with familiarity in photovoltaic products and solutions preferred.
3) Excellent leadership and team management skills.
4) Outstanding communication and negotiation abilities, with experience in international business contract negotiations.
5) Ability to analyze international market trends and formulate strategies.
6) In-depth understanding of the international photovoltaic market and industry trends.
7) Willingness to adapt to frequent international travel, with cross-cultural work experience being a plus
8) Location: Singapore/Foshan/Hong Kong

title: Product Manager

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job description – Product Manager
Product Planning, Contracting & Portfolio Management
Proactively plan, develop, own and manage tours through the product lifecycle while remaining in line with business timescales

Willingness to travel occasionally for trade shows, product contracting, planning and destination familiarisation
Able to start work immediately or in short notice.

· Able to work independently

Please provide the following information in your resume:
1. Recent photograph
2. Reasons for leaving your last employment

5. Availability

title: Senior Product Manager
company_info: The ShopBack Group is Asia-Pacific’s leading shopping, rewards, and payments platform, serving over 40 million shoppers across ten markets. Driven by the vision to become the world's most rewarding way to shop, ShopBack is dedicated to saving members money and time, while delivering delightful experiences with every purchase. The platform also enables merchants and brands to engage with their members in a cost-effective manner. Founded in 2014, ShopBack now powers over US$3.7 billion in annual sales for over 15,000 online and in-store partners, with over half a million transactions happening via the platform daily. In 2022, ShopBack expanded its offerings into the realm of financial services with the launch of ShopBack Pay and PayLater - providing members with responsible and convenient payment options at checkout, while empowering partners with more ways to engage potential customers.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
ShopBack : Better Shopping, Every Day.
The ShopBack Group is Asia-Pacific’s leading shopping and rewards platform, serving over 30 million shoppers across ten markets. Growing from a team of six back in 2014 to over seven hundred today, ShopBackers across the region come together with a singular mission: to make shopping rewarding, delightful, and accessible for all.
Joining forces with leading buy now, pay later (BNPL) player hoolah and with the launch of ShopBack Pay, the Group now offers shoppers a responsible and convenient payment option at checkout.
More than half a billion shopping trips start with ShopBack each year. The Group powers over US$3.5 billion in annual sales for over 10,000 online and in-store merchant partners, across categories ranging from fashion, beauty, F&B, electronics, travel and more. If you are passionate about building and scaling up businesses in this fast-growing landscape, come and join our growing ShopBack team!

ABOUT THE TEAM
The Regional Product management team at ShopBack is crucial in connecting our commercial, engineering, design and data teams with our customers and merchants.
As a Product Manager, you will play an important role in implementing strategy, road maps and features, while adhering to business goals.
Our Merchant product team focuses on building a unified platform to serve business users and merchants within the ShopBack ecosystem, where merchants can enjoy different services with a one-stop solution. With a comprehensive analysis of different services, we aim to provide our merchants with an excellent user experience across all our markets and platforms. Using centralized merchant data, our team continuously explores systematic ways to expand the scale of merchants, and optimize our operating efficiency to ensure that our merchants have the best possible experience while working with us.
Responsibilities
Lead strategy/ product direction, owning the end to end merchant experience
Identify industry trends, conduct market / competitor / user research for Merchant products and tools
Manage senior stakeholders - have strategy and planning discussions with business leaders and provide execution updates, co-own financial targets for the performance of the product
Identify key levers that have the most impact on business, and share creative product solutions
Work with a diverse and multicultural team from diverse backgrounds
Lead a team of product managers - take ownership of merchant products, from product ideation, design, technical development, testing and roll out, to post-launch improvements and iterations
Partner closely with engineering, UX, data, operations and finance leaders and local / regional teams to build product solutions for merchants in each market
Collaborate closely with product marketing and commercial teams to drive GTM strategy, ensure strong internal stakeholder communication in place
Merchant products include ecommerce platform plugins, ShopBack for Business, merchant payment app & API integration product, merchant settlement & reporting, centralized & automated merchant data service, and other merchant tools
Requirements
A proven history of success in product management roles: min 8 years in product management and have grown to lead product manager roles & have shipped products as an individual contributor and also have led teams to ship products with well defined metrics
People management experience: you’ve been responsible for performance management, have navigated tough conversations with direct reports, and you feel comfortable supporting product managers to achieve their career goals
Entrepreneurial mindset: you must be comfortable rolling up your sleeves, thriving in ambiguity, and getting the work done with uncertainties and able to react fast to change when needed
Prior experience in owning / driving the building and shipping of complex, SaaS products at scale is preferred, must have good understanding about B2B products, compared to B2C products
Prior experience in managing complicated systems (e.g. payment system, trade system, order system, merchant platform) is preferred
Passionate about pushing boundaries and creating value in your product space - the role is not about just doing the minimal, genuine excitement for solving problems and a strong sense of empathy for merchants and their staff are needed
Strong communication skills to effectively communicate business or technical information with different audiences verbally or in writing.
Bachelor’s degree required, computer science related disciplines are preferred

title: Oncology Product Manager
company_info: Daiichi Sankyo is a global pharmaceutical company with corporate origins in Japan. We provide innovative products and services in approximally 30 countries/regions around the world. With more than 120 years of scientific expertise, our company draws upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help patients. Through the outstanding knowledge and commitment of our 17,000 + employees worldwide, we create innovative new and generic medicines, and new methods of drug discovery and delivery. We share a passion for innovation, as well as compassion for the patients around the world who are in need of our medicines.
job_category: Healthcare / Pharmaceutical, Medical / Therapy Services, Sales / Retail
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Overview:
As a product manager, you will be responsible for the development and execution of product strategies for assigned products. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including but not limited to, market access, medical, regulatory, finance, and legal/compliance, to ensure successful product launches and lifecycle management.
The role requires the ability to analyze market data and identify key trends, lead the effort in forecasting, develop pricing and positioning strategies, and provide training and support to sales teams. You should have a strong understanding of local Singapore regulations and industry trends, as well as excellent communication and leadership skills.
In addition to the usual marketing scope, this role is required to create synergy with the alliance partner to enable the team to excel on the same goal for the product(s) assigned. You will be responsible to ensure that all operations related to the product run smoothly in the alliance team
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and execute product strategies for assigned pharmaceutical products
Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs and market trends
Develop and implement marketing plans to drive product sales and market share
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, access & policy, medical affairs, regulatory, finance, supply chain, legal/compliance to ensure product success
Manage product life cycle from development to launch and post-launch activities
Develop and manage product budgets and forecasts
Monitor and analyze sales performance and market trends to adjust product strategies as needed
Manage relationships with key opinion leaders, healthcare professionals, and other stakeholders (e.g. patient associations)
Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements and guidelines
Skills required:
Analytical
Attention to detail
Business acumen
Customer focused
Creative
Digital marketing capability
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in life sciences, pharmacy, marketing, business administration or related field
3 – 5 years of experience in pharmaceutical product management or related field
Oncology (Breast cancer, lung cancer) experience is required

title: Product Manager, Indent
company_info: DFI Retail Group (“Group”) is a leading pan-Asian retailer. At 30th June 2021, the Group and its associates and joint ventures operated over 10,000 outlets and employed some 230,000 team members. The Group had total annual sales in 2020 exceeding US$28 billion. The Group provides quality and value to Asian consumers by offering leading brands, a compelling retail experience and great service; all delivered through a strong store network supported by efficient supply chains. The Group (including associates and joint ventures) operates under a number of well-known brands across food, health and beauty, home furnishings, restaurants and other retailing, in particular Cold Storage, Giant, Guardian, 7-Eleven, Jasons and MarketPlace in Singapore. The Group’s parent company, Dairy Farm International Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a standard listing on the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group's businesses are managed from Hong Kong by Dairy Farm Management Services Limited through its regional offices. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. In Singapore, The Group served as the largest and fast growing, retailer with more than 30 years’ experience. Since the first store opened in 1983, we are the emerging market leaders in "Best Practice" retail initiatives and technology with a team of over 6,500 employees in over 850 stores island-wide working together to deliver outstanding customers success in retail markets.
description:

DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group.

Continuously improve efficiencies and reduce costs to minimise loss potential by analysing current processes and systems
Ensure appropriate team job satisfaction and performance levels through effective development, creation and implementation of action plans, systems and standards

Training Opportunities
Career Advancement

title: Product Manager
company_info: DFI Retail Group (“Group”) is a leading pan-Asian retailer. At 30th June 2021, the Group and its associates and joint ventures operated over 10,000 outlets and employed some 230,000 team members. The Group had total annual sales in 2020 exceeding US$28 billion. The Group provides quality and value to Asian consumers by offering leading brands, a compelling retail experience and great service; all delivered through a strong store network supported by efficient supply chains. The Group (including associates and joint ventures) operates under a number of well-known brands across food, health and beauty, home furnishings, restaurants and other retailing, in particular Cold Storage, Giant, Guardian, 7-Eleven, Jasons and MarketPlace in Singapore. The Group’s parent company, Dairy Farm International Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a standard listing on the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group's businesses are managed from Hong Kong by Dairy Farm Management Services Limited through its regional offices. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. In Singapore, The Group served as the largest and fast growing, retailer with more than 30 years’ experience. Since the first store opened in 1983, we are the emerging market leaders in "Best Practice" retail initiatives and technology with a team of over 6,500 employees in over 850 stores island-wide working together to deliver outstanding customers success in retail markets.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
DFI Retail Group (“Group”) is a leading pan-Asian retailer. At 30th June 2021, the Group and its associates and joint ventures operated over 10,000 outlets and employed some 230,000 team members. The Group had total annual sales in 2020 exceeding US$28 billion. The Group provides quality and value to Asian consumers by offering leading brands, a compelling retail experience and great service; all delivered through a strong store network supported by efficient supply chains. The Group (including associates and joint ventures) operates under a number of well-known brands across food, health and beauty, home furnishings, restaurants and other retailing.

DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group.

The Role
To develop and implement strategic plans for assigned categories within the framework of a disciplined category management business process so as to achieve company’s financial goals and objectives, improve market share, customer satisfaction and productivity performance measures for the company
Achieve category sales, profit and income goals and objectives through developing and implementing business plans for the assigned categories
Develop, implement, and manage an optimum product mix that focuses on customers’ needs
Develop and implement promotional trade plans that bring excitement and incremental sales and profitability to the stores
Maintain strong supplier partner relationship in the pursuit of the growth of business
Manage sourcing of right products internationally, which fits the demands of local customers
Perform periodic range reviews to maximise the sales and profitability performance
Develop and implement a competitive pricing strategy that delivers value to our customers
Establish collaborative retailer/supplier relationships to maximise income/terms/discounts to improve sales and profitability of category
Ensure compliance with the Company’s policies including but not limited to; the product inventory management process
Achieve reduction in shrink budget objectives through disciplined buying and inventory management processes
Extract and prepare weekly analysis report for submission to Senior Management
Participate, communicate and support a culture of learning, teamwork and sharing internally and externally with the stores, DFI business units in Singapore
Any other adhoc projects or duties as required
About You
Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role
Degree in Business, Retail Management or relevant discipline
Possesses knowledge in sourcing or buying
Good organizational and communication skills
Excellent stakeholders management
Benefits
Team Member Discount
Subsidized Medical and Dental Benefits
Training Opportunities
Career Advancement
Working Location: Tampines North

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Drive card customers engagement and acquisition on our digital platforms.

1. Develop ideas to grow cards customers penetration and acquisition channel share by leveraging on our digital platforms.

2. Lead/coordinate the development of key digital initiatives with various stakeholders from onboarding till fulfilment.

3. Conduct experiments to assess market adoption and iterate continuously to achieve the desired outcome.

4. Design Customer Journey with data in mind. Work closely with a wide range of stakeholders on customer immersions to understand customer job to be done and define a digital
experience that truly meet customers’ needs across different digital touchpoints.

5. Analyse and leverage on internal Data to identify areas of opportunities to increase penetration of digital adoption

7. Engage Product and Business Analytics on targeted marketing campaigns to target the right customers.

8. Work closely with a wide range of stakeholders on customer immersions to understand customer job to be done and define a digital experience that truly meet customers’ needs across different digital touchpoints

11. Provide end to end support on internal systems migration/implementation and work closely with delivery and technology teams on feature/campaigns testing, implementation and new requests, including documenting the test scope and processes.

12. Manage the resolution of system UAT and production issues with technology team and business users.

title: Managing Director, Product and Sales Activation, APAC - Singapore
company_info: GOOGLE ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PRODUCT AREA
When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.

Regional Product and Sales Activation (PSA) partners closely with APAC GCS Sales to define, test and launch new products, scale campaign best practices, and align strategy between sales and product management teams. PSA’s relationships with sellers, deep product expertise and competitive insight accelerates priority growth areas such as Automation, Commerce and Video. Meanwhile, the market insights PSA uncovers guide the development of products to better serve the needs of our customers and cultivate business growth. As part of the APAC PSA, you will partner with other regional teams and global PSA leadership to set and deliver on GCS business priorities, and define, customize and implement strategies across all countries and region wide in APAC. As the leader of PSA APAC, you will guide the team that is responsible for defining and executing the go-to-market strategy for priority areas across all segments of the GCS business (a diverse set of customers including large managed accounts, agencies of all sizes, channel partners, and newly acquired advertisers). Your team plan will include strategic accounts, training and sales enablement resources such as narratives, playbooks and event strategy. You will serve as a key member of the APAC GCS Sales management team, accountable for all product-related initiatives. Your team will support product leads in major product launches/betas and will get involved directly with planning and co-pitching for strategic accounts. As the leader in this role, you will also collaborate with PSA leaders in other regions to coordinate appropriate global efforts.

Qualifications
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Define product Go-to-Market strategy and goals by working with global counterparts
Manage, develop, inspire, and motivate the team, ensuring successful delivery against goals. Work with the Heads of APAC Sales and team to define and execute priority areas (e.g., mobile, brand and core)
Develop an activation strategy and tactical guidance to drive product adoption
Speak at external events, and regularly lead strategic discussions with some of the region's biggest customers and most strategic agency and channel sales partners
Influence the global product team in shaping the product roadmap by gathering actionable customer and competitive insights, conducting immersion sessions for product managers, and testing beta products
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of relevant experience in sales and advertising in the digital space.
Client-facing experience.
Experience leading teams and influencing cross-functionally.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in the product/solutions environment, or working with the product organization.
Knowledge of online media and advertising solutions.
Demonstrated sales management, project management, change management, and leadership skills.
Excellent communication and strategic thinking skills.

Job Description:

Reporting to Production Manager, Production Engineer shall lead and deliver the manufacturing function within budget and output targets to meet customer requirements and standards. Full accountability for ensuring safety, customer quality, delivery and cost requirements are met.

title: Product Owner
company_info: The SingTel Group is Asia's leading communications group, providing a wide spectrum of multimedia and infocomms technology (ICT) solutions across 3 global business units. Group Consumer focuses on next-generation communication, infotainment and technology services to consumers and small businesses. Group Enterprise provides innovative and comprehensive ICT solutions, i.e. satellite services, international data and managed services, cloud computing, enterprise mobility services, and end-to-end solutions. Group Digital L!fe strives to bring people together with a cutting edge mix of digital services such as NextGen TV, e-books, music, digital concierge, cloud-based gaming and hyperlocal content. Headquartered in Singapore, SingTel’s 130 years of operating experience has played a pivotal role in the country’s transformation into a major communications hub. Our Australian arm, Optus is an innovative leader in integrated telecommunications. Through our strategic investments in five regional mobile operators, Telkomsel, Globe Telecom, Advanced Info Service, PBTL, and Bharti Airtel, we are a major communications player in Asia and Africa. SingTel is the largest listed company on the Singapore Exchange by market capitalisation. We have a vast network of offices in countries and territories throughout Asia Pacific, in Europe, USA and Australia. The Group employs more than 21,000 staff worldwide and has served 468 million mobile customers globally as of 31 March 2013.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Understand the business strategy, goals, and initiatives
Understand the customers’ needs and experience, and continually test your assumptions
Understand how technology supports the business and the jobs-to-be-done to build and sustain a secure, stable, reliable platform/channel
Align the team and stakeholders on the product vision, roadmap, and value to be achieved
Own and prioritize the product backlog
Write epics and user stories
Lead the following agile cadences: sprint planning, sprint review, backlog grooming
Participate in the following agile cadences: daily standups and sprint retrospective
Work with the team to agree upon the definition of done

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client, a leading FinTech Group that is at the forefront of digital innovation, and dedicated to revolutionizing financial services through the implementation of cutting-edge blockchain technologies, is seeking an experienced and motivated individual to join as a Blockchain Engineering Manager. In this role, you will lead a team of cross-geographically talented engineers and spearhead the development, deployment, and maintenance of our blockchain-based solutions. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of blockchain technology and its application within the financial sector, coupled with exceptional leadership and management skills.
Responsibilities:
Lead and manage a team of blockchain engineers, providing clear guidance, support, and mentorship throughout the project lifecycle.
Oversee the development, implementation, and maintenance of our blockchain-based systems and applications, ensuring high-quality deliverables that meet business requirements and industry standards.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product management, design, and business stakeholders, to define project goals, prioritize work, and achieve desired outcomes.
Provide technical leadership and guidance in architecture design, development methodologies, and best practices, leveraging your deep expertise in blockchain technology and related tools.
Conduct code reviews to maintain high-quality code and adherence to coding standards, identifying areas for improvement and providing actionable feedback for continuous enhancement.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in blockchain technology and industry trends, evaluating their potential impact on our products and services, and making recommendations accordingly.
Manage project timelines, resource allocation, and project dependencies, ensuring timely delivery of milestones and facilitating effective communication across teams and stakeholders.
Foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment, promoting knowledge sharing, professional growth, and a culture of innovation within the team.
Requirements:
Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in software development, with recent hands-on experience in blockchain development.
A deep understanding of blockchain technologies, such as Ethereum, Hyperledger, or Polygon, possesses blockchain maintenance capabilities.
Proven track record of successfully leading and managing a team of software engineers, with the ability to motivate, inspire, and mentor team members.
Extensive knowledge of software development methodologies, coding standards, and best practices, and a keen eye for detail and quality.
Solid understanding of agile project management principles and experience working in an agile development environment.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, with a demonstrated ability to think strategically, anticipate challenges, and find innovative solutions.
Strong passion for blockchain technology and its potential to transform the financial services industry.
With well over a decade of a solid and enviable track record behind us, headquartered in Hong Kong, Pinpoint Asia Infotech Pte Ltd (EA License: 22S1136) is the go-to IT Search Firm for several top Investment Banks and Financial Institutions.
If you are interested in the above position, please send your CV to Charlie Kim @ resume.sg@pinpointasia.com (EA Registration number: R22104834)

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Test / Inspection methodology

• Engage within QA teams (Supplier and Incoming) on issues and concerns relating to supplier, product and production.

• Engage and establish processes with Production teams to support Out-Going inspection / test.

• Manage ISO9001 on quality management and Control.

• Communication and follow up with both inhouse and customers claims.

• Ensure company quality policies and procedures are adhered in all phases of work.
• Ensure all QA/QC activities such as verifications, inspections and tests are performed in a safe manner.
• Conduct and participate in quality audit.
• Coordinates and participate in NCR, DCR, concession request, etc.

• Experience in quality function with min 5 years working in a machinery manufacturing environment
• Familiar with ISO9001 standards and implementations
• Proven qualities and skills with the desire to teach and mentor staff.

title: Product Manager
company_info: Portcast Pte Ltd. is an early stage technology startup which uses machine learning models and Artificial Intelligence to generate actionable insights for the logistics and maritime industry. We are incubated in a leading deep-tech startup accelerator in Singapore organized by Entrepreneur First and SG Innovate. Reach us as https://portcast.io or write to us at contact@portcast.io
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Portcast:
Our mission is to transform international supply chains to be more resilient by helping logistics companies realize the full potential of their data. Our customers include some of the world’s largest shipping lines, cargo airlines and international manufacturers. This covers 90% of the world trade volume that travels via ocean and 35% of world trade value that travels via air.
Based in Singapore, and backed by leading VCs and senior industry advisors, Portcast is a team of young tech and industry talent building a game-changing product for the logistics and shipping industry.
About the role:
We are looking for a Product Manager who is passionate about delivering best-in-class products. As the Product Manager, you will play a key role every step of the way from ideation to prioritization, from vision to strategy, from design to implementation, from customer feedback to customer satisfaction, from MAU to ARR. You will become one of our industry experts, combining customer insights, industry knowledge and technical excellence to make our platform best-in-class.
What You’ll Do:
As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for improving the existing product (including the managing the launch of new features) in line with customer requirements as well as shaping the overall product strategy. Some of your responsibilities include:
· Develop deep expertise: Acquire in-depth knowledge of our product, market, and competitive landscape, establishing yourself as a product leader and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
· Define product strategy and roadmap: Coordinate and define the product strategy and roadmap, driving successful product launches.
· Create product requirement documents: Document comprehensive product requirements aligned with business goals, market trends, and customer needs.
· UI/UX mockups: Collaborate with the in-house designer to create UI/UX mockups for new features.
· Conceptualize product roadmap: Play an active role in the conceptualization of the product roadmap.
· Collaborate with engineering: Work closely with the engineering team to deliver effective solutions.
· Prioritize enhancements and new features: Help drive consensus and prioritize between enhancements to existing functionality and new features.
· Gather and structure customer requirements/feedback: Proactively collect and organize customer requirements and feedback.
· Design and refine product features: Iteratively design new features, mock up concepts, and develop the product roadmap in collaboration with engineering, data science, and business teams.
· Drive ruthless prioritization: Work with the technical team to prioritize product features that deliver value to our users.
· Manage sprint process: Oversee the sprint process, timelines, user stories, roadblocks, and metrics for the engineering team.
· Support commercialization: Support the marketing and sales team in effectively commercializing the product.
To thrive in this role, you must have:
· A bachelor's or master's degree or equivalent, ideally with specialization in Computer Science, Business, Information Systems, or related disciplines.
· 5+ years of working experience with 3+ years of product management experience.
· Experience managing a SaaS or data heavy/analytics product.
· Proven success in impactful product initiatives that significantly benefited users.
· Demonstrated track record of delivering scalable and specialized products aligned with business strategies.
· Demonstrable experience balancing the scalability and specialization of a product.
· Strong problem-solving skills and ability to envision product vision, strategy, roadmap, features through customer discussions as well as through market research.
· Ability to influence and collaborate across functions and locations to reach ambitious goals.
· Ability to connect the dots between consumer insights through data, primary research (user interaction) secondary research (surveys) and market trends (industry and market).
· Ability to work in a fast-paced environment to execute, learn and iterate quickly.
· Experience in startup environments is a plus.
· Understanding of the logistics / analytics / real-time transportation visibility platform is a major plus.
