title: Senior Product Manager, Games Development
company_info: Mighty Bear is a Singapore-based studio building the next generation of massively multiplayer online mobile games. The team is a collective of games industry veterans from the likes of King, Ubisoft, EA, Lucasarts, Disney, Gameloft, and Jagex. We aim to make games that combine the depth of desktop gaming with the accessibility of mobile. We make games the Mighty Bear way – using a set of principles and values bear-lues which we believe in and practice everyday.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are on the prowl for more Bears to join us at our Global HQ (AKA Bear Force One)! Being a Bear means that you'll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and is dedicated to making games which make players smile.

We are looking for an experienced and creative Senior Product Manager who is passionate about crafting games that players love. Possessing visionary talent in game design and game culture, you also hold deep knowledge of live project management, human psychology, economics and are a well rounded leader in games.

You’ll illuminate the road ahead, leading the way with a cross-functional and dynamic team of developers to design, build, and operate commercially successful games that fulfil the company's vision.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity, welcome applications from candidates from all walks of life, and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all Bears.


Your responsibilities will include:
Being responsible for the commercial and critical success of games
Articulating and driving the original game vision, and translating the vision into design requirements, roadmaps and prototypes
Communication and alignment with stakeholders (including the team and partners) on the game vision and business modelling
Overseeing development and ensuring what's being created is in line with the vision at a competitive and high level of quality
Working closely with the development team and Project Manager to ensure that the game ships on time as a high-quality experience
Development and content risk management and mitigation. Evaluate, escalate and manage challenges in development and operations, including active re-scoping and prioritisation of activities
Objective analysis of user and market data, and the ability to combine that with a strong sense of empathy for the user to derive relevant improvements for a live game
Maintaining and sharing state of the art knowledge on the state of play in games and content trends.
Maintaining a healthy and productive team throughout the product life cycle

As a successful candidate, you would have:
An insatiable passion to lead the creation of the next big thing with an openness to web3 and a desire to create the games which will define the next decade of gaming
A proven track record driving development and live operations for multiple games
The ability to relate sincerely through innate knowledge to every discipline involved in mobile and web game development
Exceptional leadership qualities and interpersonal skills
A deep knowledge of the games industry and the wider market for games/ mobile games, and a keen interest in related creative arts (music, film, literature, etc.)
A working knowledge of development and tools for Android and iOS
Excellent communication skills - verbal, written and presentation
The ability to think equally creatively, commercially and strategically
An outlook wired to lead in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment

As a bonus, you would:
Experience and knowledge of existing web3 products and technologies
Have experience working on a successful ($60m+ annual revenue) free-to-play game
Be able to devise and present ideas for new games
Have experience working with Unity 3D
Have a deep knowledge or prior experience in one or more of Design, Art, Programming, Project Management, or Quality Assurance.

If you want to be part of a team that's committed to transparency and openness, then Bear Force One is the place for you!

We are always on the lookout for interesting people - even if your profile doesn’t meet the requirements fully, we'd love to hear from you!

Whether you’re new to the industry or have several years of experience, here are some pointers on things we look for at Bear Force One: http://bit.ly/MBG-HowToLandYourDreamGamesJob and when you’re ready, just click to apply!

title: Senior Technical Product Manager, E-commerce
company_info: We are Trustana - a curated marketplace of verifiable, international traders. Designed to empower buyers and suppliers to grow their businesses with confidence, Trustana connects trustworthy trade partners and supports them through their end-to-end trade journey. We are proud to leverage decentralised technology to ensure that our customers have control and ownership over their data. We're headquartered in Singapore with operations throughout ASEAN. Trustana is founded by Temasek, an investment company headquartered in Singapore and is being built in collaboration with BCG Digital Ventures. Trustana is part of the Affinidi Group and is built using Affinidi technologies.
job_category: Consulting, F&B, Information Technology, Logistics / Supply Chain
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Technical Product Manager, E-commerce
Overview:
As the Senior PM for our Product Data Catalog System, you have a big role. You'll boost our product catalog, work with different teams to improve accuracy, make catalog management easier, and lead the way in sharing data. You will be pioneering AI centric solutions and features for the industry in ways no one or very few are working on!
What you will be working on:
Evolve our Product Catalog Data Ecosystem: Immerse in the collection, storage, and normalization of product data. Champion automation at pivotal junctures.
Steer Architectural Design: Forge and refine high-tier architectural designs and mappings, all dovetailed to our product information management system.
Integrating AI features: Innovative solutions from onboarding and data enrichment to localization and analytics!
What You Bring to the Table:
Senior PM Credentials: A history with 5+ years in senior product management, preferably orbiting around extensive product catalogs, commerce platforms, or advanced technical infrastructures.
Tech Architecture Acumen: An adept grasp on the intricacies of scalable, multifaceted solutions.
B2B SaaS DNA: A proven narrative in sculpting solutions for B2B SaaS or vast-scale B2C products.
API Mastery: Past encounters designing and working with APIs.
Database Design Savvy: A background in managing and optimizing large-scale database designs.
About Trustana:
We're not just another tech company. At Trustana, we're reshaping the landscape of product information across channels with a unique fusion of open technology and advanced AI automation. If you're a visionary eager to redefine the AI-driven product catalog world, especially for global retail giants and leading brands, we want you on board.
Interested? Let's reshape B2B Commerce together at Trustana!

Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for an experienced Production and Operations Manager to oversee and manage the set production and technical requirements for luxury and lifestyle events, pop-ups, and exhibition.

You will ensure events are successful, paying attention to production quality, time and budget constraints, and will get exposure to projects with international luxury and premium lifestyle brands.

Good remuneration package, including project-based incentives
Supportive and cohesive team environment
Annual Dental, Optical & Medical Entitlements
Hospital & Surgical Insurance Entitlements
2-days flexible Work from Home arrangements per month (bi-weekly)
Off-in-lieu provided for work on weekends and public holidays
Good opportunities to work on overseas projects for wider exposure
SCOPE OF WORK
Be part of the production and operations team in planning and coordinating events and exhibition in Singapore and regional countries
Manage overall production and operations timelines and quality
Oversee vendors & logistic agencies to ensure deliverables are met
Cost negotiation and managing suppliers’ relationships
Project operations planning and administration which include pre-event preparation, onsite execution and post event closing
Internal liaisons and communication with our projects and design divisions
Production management from fabrication to on-site set up supervision and management for events and exhibitions

Proactively handle any arising issues and troubleshoot any emerging problems during set up and event day

CRITERIA
Between 3 - 5 years’ experience of production and operations management for premium lifestyle events & exhibitions

Understand AutoCAD layout and technical production plans
Possess positive attitude and in good health.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Lead the Production Division in the formulation and implementation of Production business plans to achieve the company goals and objectives.
Manage and promote the company’s core values, business objectives and targets, including the development of supporting personnel and features for the continued growth of the company.
Induct, train, coach, develop human resource and succession planning for the division.
Participate and contribute actively either as the Chairman or as a member in the various committees of the company or any other company wide gathering.
Maintain the discipline and cohesiveness of staffs under charge, working towards achieving the corporate objectives. Have a nose in recognizing problems.
Need to write to internal or external customers in the most effectively and concise manner. Conversely, must be able to converse concisely and timely.
Coordinate and take leadership of all the managers and assistant managers who are head of their respective department.
Manage and delegate work within division sphere.
Lead in the management and control of budgets of jobs designated to the department.
Lead and formulate plans for expansion/improvement for the production division.
Oversee all production and maintenance projects to the satisfaction of client’s requirements by providing technical and management guidance to production departments.
Ensure all production department projects are plan, coordinated and executed smoothly to meet customer’s requirements with highest quality and EHS compliance.
Manage and deploy production resources (manpower, material, tool & equipment, logistics, technical etc) efficiently and productively.
Analyze job scope and plan resources with the department heads.
Liaise with customers on job matters.
Manage sub-contractors.
Chair and conduct daily production and monthly safety committee meetings.
Approve in house training programs and training materials.
Conduct in-house training for staffs and when required.
Forecast the divisional requirements.
Communicate and carry out the management requirements to subordinates.
Implement the company’s IMS system for continuous improvement.
Conduct post project performance evaluation and identify areas for improvement.
Ensure project cost are controlled within budget and minimize wastage.
Continuously review and improve work methods and enhance productivity of workmen.
Conduct internal audit and self-assessment for IMS.
Oversee the development of production indicators, man-hour standards, work instructions and risk assessments.
Act on behalf of the COO in his absence.
Perform any other duties assigned by the COO.

Minimum Requirements
A Degree or Diploma in Engineering.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in Engineering Maintenance Services and 5 years’ experience at the managerial level.
Possess strong leadership and organizational qualities.
Possess strong written and spoken communication skills.
Possess own transport

Company Benefits
Transport, Medical & Dental benefits
Phone allowance
Performance bonus
Growing company with potential career advancement

title: Assistant Restaurant Manager
company_info: At 4FINGERS, we’re nuts about chicken. So when we discovered the best Asian crispy chicken in New York City’s grungy subway scene, we knew we had to share it. And so began the revolution of crispy chicken. From a single restaurant in ION Orchard, we conquered Singapore with our 13th restaurant. And that's just here. We have already welcomed 4 strong allies - Malaysia, Indonesia, Australia and Thailand - and are looking to have the United States to join the brotherhood. We are a young brand with a voice, and a burning desire to grow. We are not afraid of challenging the status quo and are rigidly stubborn about the food we serve - great food in a great environment with exceptional hospitality. We are looking for someone with a drive to create change and a passion for good food. Wanna make your mark with us? 4FINGERS is on the prowl for revolutionaries who want to head our movement, and make a difference to the casual dining service attitudes and help elevate our brand experience to new heights.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview of Position:
To assist Restaurant Manager in creating and maintaining a culture of customer service, employee recruitment and development, and business profitability, while upholding the brand standards as set by 4Fingers.

Assist the Restaurant Manager in delivering Service Commitment Responsibilities:
Consistently delivers our 4Fingers customer program
Conveys passion about his/her work, the products we serve, and the 4Fingers brand
Maintains a comprehensive knowledge of all 4Fingers products
Manages the customer environment
Handles customer requests and complaints in a positive, professional manner.
Create a customer experience that delivers the promise of the 4Fingers brand. This includes a genuinely friendly service that generates regular customers return; accurate orders; hot & fresh food.
Assist the Restaurant Manager in delivering Talent Management Responsibilities:
Responsible for the recruitment and selection process in the restaurant.
Maintains a positive working environment to promote a culture of passion, teamwork and respect.
Maintains communication within the shop.
Creates shop objectives and action plans to achieve the target
Utilizes retention and rewards tools to motivate restaurant staff. Manage the crew which includes rostering, regular coaching, communications.
Assist the Restaurant Manager in delivering Business Responsibilities:
Maintains highest standards of ethics and integrity.
Maintains highest standards of personal conduct and appearance
Identifies, establishes, and implements local promotions designed to maximize sales for the operation, with the agreement of 4Fingers.
Implements brand promotions.
Manage day to day operations that includes the highest safety and hygiene standards compliant with regulations.
Develops sales, cost, profit targets
Responsible for the completion of daily, weekly, and monthly restaurant reports.
To keep and implement 4Fingers standards, policies, and procedures.
Manage raw materials, supplies, equipment and IT systems.
Control operational costs and identify measures to cut waste
Assist the Restaurant Manager in delivering Leadership Responsibilities:
Delivers outstanding results through goals and clear priorities
Makes timely and high-quality decisions and adds value through their knowledge and expertise.
Inspires and motivates with a high level of commitment and performance
Develops people and self
Values diversity through people
Requirements:
Have minimum 3 to 5 years of relevant experience, supporting Restaurant operations listed.
Handson person at all times.
One with great passion, to operate like a business owner, people orientated, driven and hungry.
Able to drive, manage people and takes pride in delivering the best to the customer
Consistent, persistent, independant
Great problem solver, with excellent communication skills

title: R0280921 - International Private Bank Agile - Client Journey Product Owner Domain Lead and Digital Channels Lead Product Owner - Director
company_info: About Deutsche Bank A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and opportunities to excel.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Details of the Division and Team
Deutsche Bank’s Private Banking business is one of the largest wealth managers worldwide. We offer affluent clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Private Banking.
As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations. We create lasting value for clients. We develop bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate & Investment Bank and Deutsche Asset Management. We combine financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships.
What we will offer you
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.
You can expect:
Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits
Gender Neutral Parental Leave
Flexible working arrangements
25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement
Your key responsibilities
Product Owner Domain Lead and Lead Product Owner Responsibilities
The Emerging Markets Product Owner Domain Lead (PODL) for Client Journey is responsible in defining and realising the purpose for the respective group of squads in line with the Tribe Domain and Region.
In the PODL capacity in Client Journey, you are responsible to set the agenda and act as an oversight lead for the Emerging Markets squads covering our clients in APAC, Latam and MEA, in both Digital Channels (focused on e-banking platform) and Sales Enablement (focused on core CRM system to service Relationship Managers).
You will be reporting into global Tribe Domain Lead Global Channel and Process and work in partnership with Tribe Lead Digital Channel and Regional Change Lead whilst working closely with business and RMs to drive digital client experience.
The APAC Lead Product Owner (PO) for Digital Channels within Client Journey is responsible for APAC (SG and HK) Digital Channels across Deutsche Wealth Online “DWO”, the core e-banking platform offered to clients. You will work closely with the POs for DWO in APAC and the other booking centers
The Lead Product Owner is accountable for maximising the value of features delivered with his/her multidisciplinary Agile team. The features may be purely IT-technical, non-technical or a combination addressing end-to-end requirements including related processes, initiative roll-out and adoption.
The Lead Product Owner is the person with ultimate accountability for designing, building and running digital journeys and its related end-to-end processes that are wide ranging in nature, best-in-class, simple, easy-to-use, and benefit Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management Emerging Markets digital clients.
As a Lead Product Owner, you are managing together with the other POs the interface to internal and external customers, users and stakeholders, being accountable for the product vision, delivery roadmap, product backlog and the realisation of the agreed product outcomes, meeting relevant quality parameters.
In this combined dual PODL and Lead PO role, it is critical to align scope and priorities to relevant strategic and business goals with clear requirements for customers, users and management/stakeholders alike.
As a servant-leader, you enable your Agile team to work in a self-directed way with team members supported in applying their skills to innovate and deliver the agreed product outcomes.
You are a constant source of guidance and review feedback for their Agile team and stakeholders, you also sign-off work products completed by the Agile team.
Key Responsibilities
In your PODL capacity, you will serve as a key stakeholder with senior management and helping define and drive to delivery initiatives for both Emerging Markets Digital Channels and Sales Enablement.
Responsible for the regional alignment of deliveries for the Tribe Domain across tribes.
Align with regional Product Owners and Global Tribe lead for creating and continuously iterating on a multi-year product roadmap and creating the business requirements.
Help set Regional Priorities / OKRs and Milestones in line with global vision.
Drive People and Talent Management for your region; define Total Performance Indicators (TPIs) for POs and resolve escalations in regions.
Work to support influencing priorities in a global and regional context
In your Lead PO capacity, translate strategic and business requirements and pipeline into a clear implementable digital change roadmap.
Oversee, drive and manage the end-to-end delivery of Client Journey digital change, partnering with various other Agile tribes, and Run the Bank Subject Matter Experts including Business, COO, Divisional Control Office, Operations, Legal and Compliance.
Leveraging Digital technical insights, market trends and customer research to design seamless customer journeys, increasing conversations and transactions.
Work closely with the end-users / internal clients to plan and prioritize in line with expectation and needs.
Assess value, develop cases, and prioritize stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value.
Ensure deliveries are high quality, on time and in line with Agile QBR timelines and business needs.
Lead other POs and squad members to develop state-of the art digital solutions.
Act as a leader, instilling confidence to the overall squad and being front-runner and example for the whole team.
Aligning with Scrum Master to communicate progress of the Agile delivery team including status reporting.
Liaising with business and control functions stakeholders to create a go-to-market strategy and on-going adoption strategy to increase usage of digital channels by clients in line with regulatory requirements.
Expected to play an end-to-end delivery role with the ability to closely liaise with the technical implementation team.
Key overall day-to-day tasks include:
- Prepare and provide transparent clear updates on initiatives to various stakeholder both within and outside Agile organisation.
- Development of professional working relationships with various stakeholder groups (Business, Control Functions, External Vendors) across all seniority levels and regions.
- Scope the system / digital solutions / business process: Work closely together with the Journey Experts and Business Analysts and other squad members, to ensure right granularity of requirements specification on an epic / story level.
- Support client acquisition and digital solutions adoption activities based on structured data analysis and KPIs tracking.
- Translate business needs: Create models, diagrams, presentations and other documentations that support the target audience to understand the business requirements.
- Facilitate communication at team level in order to create consensus on scope, design decisions, and implementation decisions.
- Validate E2E requirements, UAT Testing, Sprint Demos etc (if required).
- Proactively Identify risks / issues that might affect squad’s overall health.
Your skills and experience
Digital native, with 15 years’ experience in Digital product management in financial services, investment, wealth management and/or private banking domains, with at least 8years spent as a Product or Channel Owner.
Experience with digital e-banking platforms or similar digital client offerings and have experience rolling out applications in the Client Channel domain.
Strong Agile team leadership experience and technology delivery, and understanding of digital channels technologies with ability to lead a multi-functional team comprising of business and technical resources.
Experience with CRM systems and nice to have experience with Avaloq core banking system.
Individuals must have client experience design, following Design Thinking, Human Centered Design and similar methodologies.
Strong domain experience in Wealth management and/or Private Banking to be able to address customer pain points and drive innovative solutions.
Experience leading large cross functional teams and ability to manage / influence outside direct line of responsibilities.
Awareness and understanding about digital developments and customer expectations from digital banking products and services.
Strong understanding of customer experience design and user experience principles
Understanding the Agile delivery principles and strong knowledge about scrum & Agile lean delivery being an official Certified product owner.
Excellent communications and stakeholder management.
Expertise in conceptual modelling; ability to see the big picture and envision possible solutions.
Relevant and demonstrable experience in designing and documenting requirements in Agile teams on digital transformation.
Clear ability to provide concise, precise and analytical answers to a wide array of Digital / CRM / Business related topics.
Knowledge of Agile methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban, ...) and tools (Jira or Confluence).
Understanding of latest client channel technology stacks and technology architecture standards.
Experience in working in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
Ability to deal with complex and ambiguous situations independently and with limited guidance.
Independent and proactive working method and a high-quality standard.
Flexibility for moving between different requirements on a timely manner.
Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply.
How we’ll support you
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
About us and our teams
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.
Deutsche Bank & Diversity
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

title: IT Development Manager (e-Commerce)
company_info: TWG Tea Company Pte Ltd implies a long history of perpetual exploration and creativity… Offering over 800 teas from 36 different countries including countless exclusive teas all hand blended in Singapore, TWG Tea has one of the largest selections in the world. We create daring and exclusive blends, using the most fragrant flowers and fruits from Europe, the most exotic spices, and only the finest, single estate teas from remote and mysterious regions of the world. TWG Tea sources, blends, designs, manufactures, packs and distributes high quality loose and packaged teas, teabags, tea accessories, tea infused patisseries and gourmet products, showcased in our own directly operated and uniquely designed TWG Tea salons, boutiques and retail counters, and distributed to a network of wholesale luxury hotel and restaurant customers throughout Asia, the Middle East, North America and Europe. TWG Tea is expanding its business and is looking for energetic, innovative and committed candidates with relevant experience to join us
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
In this exciting opportunity, you will lead and expand a team of web-developers to meet the needs of our growing e-Commerce business through continuous enhancements. You will be the front-line IT support to the e-business team members in ensuring all critical issues are resolved timely.

Primary Relationships
The position reports directly to the Head of IT. Within the organization, this position has primary working relationships with IT Support Team and Digital Sales and Marketing Team at TWG Tea headquarters. Outside the organization, the position coordinates primarily with platform vendors and partners.

Responsibilities:
Formulate support and development methodologies and enforce conformance by all parties
Responsible for ensuring on-time delivery of all digital marketing campaigns and initiatives over Omni-Channel platforms and global marketplaces from a technical angle
Responsible for working closely with e-business team members to transpose digital business needs into action plans, and drive the deliverables to succession
Generate meaningful insights through data-driven analysis and post-mortem reviews
Continuous innovation on ways to enhance the worldwide digital presence and customers’ online (UI/UX) experience, social listening, SEO and other digital online
Lead and coordinate with various departments and business partners/ platform vendors to meet target objectives globally, including make proposals to streamline internal processes
Responsible for infrastructure scalability and able to cope with seasonable traffic requirements
Review and manage partner/vendor contracts, ensuring vendors meet their Service Levels
Build test case scenarios and formulate roll-out plans to ensure quality delivery from vendors, ensure uninterrupted deployment as well as ‘go-live’ strategies

Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related disciplines
Minimally 3 years’ experience in leading a support and development team
Must have eCommerce project development and implementation experience using Agile Methodology.
Good track record of product management and development covering multiple platforms, but not limited to, e-Commerce, m-Commerce/Mobile App, CRM, SEO, Online Marketing etc
Familiar with maintaining Cloud infrastructure like AWS and Microsoft Azure
Minimally 5 years’ experience in an eCommerce environment, always updated with digital news preferably in the online luxury space
Experienced working with online platform giants like Amazon, Google, Zalora etc is a bonus
Minimally 3 years’ experience in web and Mobile App development, CMS platform management, integrations with databases, CRM and ERP systems
Possess hands-on skills in web/mobile programming languages like C++, HTML, CSS, Xamarin, React Native on both Android and iOS platforms
Must have experienced in administrative setup and maintaining CICD using tools like JIRA software management, service management, Github, AppVeyor, Jenkines, Azure Devops, etc
Must have experience managing source codes and change management using Githubs/ Gitlabs, Bit Torrents, etc
Ability to be hands-on to guide and mentor the team of developers to collectively meet targets
Possess outstanding leadership skills with great communication skills to lead and influence multiple cross-functional teams, management and partners
Energetic, independent and self-motivated individual with good business acumen
Strong communication skills with excellent command of English
A plus point to be fluent in spoken Chinese or French (in order to liaise with TWG Tea partners in North-Asia and Europe)

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Please apply with a detailed resume indicating reasons for leaving, last drawn salary, expected salary and date of availability.

title: Portfolio Manager, Business Banking
company_info: Singapore Standard Chartered Bank in Singapore is part of an international banking group, with more than 150 years of history in some of the world’s most dynamic markets. Our purpose is to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, and our heritage and values are expressed in our brand promise, Here for good. The Bank has a history of over 160 years in Singapore, where we opened our first branch in 1859. In October 1999, we were among the first international banks to receive a Qualifying Full Bank (QFB) licence, an endorsement of the Group’s longstanding commitment to our business in the country. Singapore is home to the majority of our global business leadership, our technology operations, as well as SC Ventures, our innovation hub. In 2013, the Bank transferred our Singapore Retail and SME businesses to a locally incorporated subsidiary, Standard Chartered Bank (Singapore) Limited (“SCBSL”). And in May 2019, we fully consolidated our business operations in Singapore through the transfer of our Commercial Banking, Corporate & Institutional Banking and Private Banking businesses to SCBSL. SCBSL is one of the highest-rated banks globally: A1/Stable by Moody’s Investor Services, A/Stable by Standard & Poor’s and A+/Stable by Fitch Ratings. In August 2020, we were the first and only bank to be awarded the “Significantly Rooted Foreign Bank” (SRFB) status by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. In December 2020, we were granted enhanced SRFB privileges, in recognition of the significantly higher degree of rootedness exceeding the SRFB baseline criteria.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Role Responsibilities
· Business Banking (BB) provides our SME clients with a suite of Cash Management, Lending, Trade, Treasury, Insurance and Wealth Management products and solutions to support their growth journey.
· This is a relationship management role covering all BB products and services. As a Portfolio Manager, you will be managing a portfolio of high-revenue mass market clients. You are expected to actively develop the accounts within your portfolio to meet and exceed set targets, including that for various campaigns that are rolled out throughout the year. You will take time to understand your clients and have a view on their needs and structure, as well as take ownership of account periodic reviews where necessary. You would ideally already have, or be prepared to quickly demonstrate, a basic understanding of BB products and solutions. You must be comfortable with calling your clients and making appropriate cross-sell that meets their business needs.
· This role reports directly to Head, Segment Management, Business Banking and will work closely with key stakeholders such as Product, Segment, Service and Governance, and other Sales teams to effectively meet the needs of your clients.
Business
You must have, or quickly demonstrate:
· A keen understanding of all the products available to the clients, including cash management, loans, trade, wealth management, insurance, and treasury solutions
· Comfort in calling and speaking to both business owners and key transactors as part of your daily activities to deepen your understanding of your clients’ business needs and structure
· An ability to identify and suggest to your clients the appropriate products and services that meet their needs
· Willingness to work across teams and functions to deliver the best outcome for your clients. You will need to be self-driven, resourceful and take a pro-active approach towards resolving client issues
Regulatory & Business Conduct
· Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
· Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
· Conduct Principles. Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment.
· Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key stakeholders
· Product Managers, Segment Managers, Service and Governance team, Operations, CDD team and BB Sales teams
Our Ideal Candidate
· Bachelor’s Degree in Accountancy, Banking & Finance, Economics or comparable.
· 2 + years of relevant working experience in a financial institution, preferably with experience handling business clients.
· Strong analytical, reasoning, and presentational skills.
· Experience in products - cash management, loans, trade, wealth management, insurance, and treasury solutions.
· An ability to identify and suggest to your clients the appropriate products and services that meet their needs
Role Specific Technical Competencies
· Experience in products - cash management, loans, trade, wealth management, insurance, and treasury solutions
· Familiar customer due diligence processes including FATCA and CRS adherence.
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:
· Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
· Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
· Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
· Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations
· Time-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum
· Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns
· Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
· A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning
· Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

title: Production Manager
company_info: Oxerra Asia Pacific Pte. Limited (the "Company") is a subsidiary of a global organization that is engaged in the manufacturing and global marketing of synthetic inorganic pigments and additives for construction, paints and plastic industries, with an annual turnover of more than USD500 million globally.
job_category: General Management, Human Resources, Logistics / Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary:
A production manager responsible for the day-to-day production at a manufacturing plant in Batam, Indonesia. The individual in this role will assist in setting up the plant to be ready for production and oversees the work of production personnel to ensure maximum productivity and efficiency.
Key Responsibilities:
Manage the day-to-day production of the manufacturing plant
Ensure production targets are met on time. Maintain optimal quality of all products and recommend improvements to production process.
Supervise efficient operations of all plant equipment to achieve all plant objectives. Ensure that all machinery is properly maintained and perform troubleshoot to as necessary to resolve issues.
Supervise the work of production personnel, including technicians, engineers, maintenance workers, and other production related support staffs and provide appropriate training to all employees to ensure optimal level of performance.
Ensure all safety precautions are taken, including ensuring that all safety regulations are followed by workers, providing guidance to workers on how to perform their jobs safely and efficiently, and training new employees on proper safety procedures.
Maintain accurate records of inventory, production, and other relevant data.
prepare appropriate budgets and reports on plant performance, including productivity, efficiency, and quality for submission to management to ensure optimal level of profitability for plant.
Ensure compliance with all regulatory and legal requirements. Perform regular inspection on all machinery and maintain compliance with all regulations.
Requirements:
Minimum qualification of Diploma in engineering, manufacturing or related field
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in-charge of production (preferably in chemical related industry)
Strong leadership with good teamwork and communication skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
Experience with Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma processes
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Physically able to work in a manufacturing environment

Exceptional problem-solving and communication abilities.

Esevel is a fast growth tech startup that is creating the future of work by helping companies with distributed teams provision and support their teams in Asia.

title: Group Product Manager, Retention
company_info: Circles.Life Technology Pte Ltd (CLT) is a subsidiary of Circles.Asia, the holding company of Circles.Life brand. With our game-changing digital products and leading no-contract data focused mobile plans, we're bringing a whole new experience to the digital consumer market. Our mission is to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and to disrupt the multi-trillion global telco industry.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
Founded in 2014, Circles is a global technology company reimagining the telco industry with its SaaS platform - Circles X, helping telco operators launch and operate successful digital brands through its offerings.
Having pioneered a successful blueprint for disrupting the telco space in Singapore, Circles has since launched its own digital telco, Circles.Life, in Singapore, Taiwan and Australia. Circles has also partnered with other telco operators to launch digital services, enabling our partners to accelerate growth and capture market share within a short period of time.
Today, Circles is partnering with operators in 14 countries to deliver delightful digital experiences to millions of people through our businesses.
We are backed by global investors such as Sequoia, Warburg Pincus, EDBI and Founders Fund – renowned backers of industry-shaking innovators.

About This Role
We are looking for a strong product leader to lead our Monetization/ Retention squad for Circles.Life B2C markets across Singapore, Australia, Taiwan and Indonesia. The role will be responsible for increasing the Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) of our existing subscriber base across these countries.
The Group Product Manager (GPM), Monetization/ Retention will be responsible for collaborating with Commercial, Marketing and Customer Happiness teams to define a coherent vision for the user experience, and define and drive the overall product strategy to increase CLV. This will include improving the user experience of Circles products (in order to drive higher retention, engagement and NPS), as well as identifying and building innovative products to increase CLV.
The GPM, Monetization/ Retention will lead a team of 2-3 product managers, in addition to driving some of the larger strategic initiatives directly.
This role reports to the Director of Product, GMS and is based in Singapore
What you’ll be responsible for:
Team Leadership: Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of 2-3 Product Managers, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Product Strategy: Develop and execute a clear product strategy that aligns with the company's vision, ensuring product roadmaps are well-defined and prioritized.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including design, engineering, marketing, and data analytics, to ensure the successful delivery of product initiatives.
Market Research: Stay current with industry trends, market dynamics, and customer preferences, conducting in-depth market research to identify new opportunities and challenges.
Product Development: Oversee the end-to-end product development process, from ideation and concept validation to launch and post-launch optimization.
Metrics and Analytics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success and iterate on features based on data-driven insights.
Customer Focus: Champion the customer voice within the organization, advocating for user-centered design and continuous improvement of the customer experience.
Risk Management: Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure the successful delivery of products on time and within budget.
Stakeholder Communication: Effectively communicate product updates, progress, and outcomes to internal and external stakeholders, including executives and investors.
Job Requirements
Minimum of 7 years of experience in product management, preferably in consumer-facing tech companies.
Proven track record of successfully leading product teams and delivering consumer products that have achieved market success.
Strong understanding of user-centered design principles and the ability to champion the customer's perspective.
Exceptional strategic thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Data-driven mindset with the ability to leverage analytics to inform product decisions.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, or a related field (MBA is a plus).
What’s on offer:
We provide a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect:
Unique opportunity to be a part of innovating the telecommunications industry
Once in a lifetime chance to help shape a brand from the ground up
Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio
Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups
Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment

title: Wealth Management Operations - Onboarding Product Analyst
company_info: About J.P. Morgan J.P. Morgan has been a leader in helping companies grow and markets develop throughout our history. We collaborate across the globe to deliver the solutions and advice to meet our clients’ needs, anywhere in the world. We operate in 100 countries and hold global leadership positions across our businesses. When you join J.P. Morgan you’ll be: working with a team committed to being the best; earning the trust of our clients; demanding excellence of yourself. What makes this the best place to build your career? Because we’ll make the most of all your talents, not just your technical skills. We’ll challenge you, but we’ll also make being here as stimulating and diverse as your life is. You’ll be given the tools, training and support needed to help us keep doing first-class business in a first-class way, as we have for over 200 years. Our global platform allows you to have more mobility, choices and opportunities to contribute than you ever imagined. It all adds up to the perfect opportunity to take your career further with us.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
If you enjoy working in a fast paced environment with an analytical and logical mindset to understand complex processes, this could be the role for you.

As a Product Specialist, you will be part of Product Team and provide support for various initiatives and any associated business transformation projects. You may be involved in multiple initiatives, working across the whole Product lifecycle, researching new initiatives, business process changes, configuration changes or system modifications. Through strong partnership with Business, Operations counterparts, and as part of a Triad with Design & Research and Technology, you'll work on product deliverables. Primary areas of focus will include Product discovery work and analysis, design and requirements gathering and development in an Agile fashion and by partnering with Scrum Teams on 2 weeks sprints but also process modelling and redesign, user interaction (gathering feedback, providing training and day to day collaboration). As a Product Specialist, you'll critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Additionally, you'll assist in the overall coordination and management of the product, including status, scorecards, and other key product management functions.

Job responsibilities:
• Coordinate with various areas of Operations, Middle Office, Finance and Technology to build business requirements, procedures, and processes. This will include product delivery management, requirements management (elicitation, documentation, prioritization, etc.), process mapping, process design, procedure authoring, org design, capacity sizing, etc.
• Conduct data analysis, data collection, and synthesis to translate into empirical solutions or evidence that can optimize our set of Products.
• Work with the Triad and business partners to design, introduce, or re-engineer existing processes and business applications
• Conduct product management, planning and analysis, including, documenting business requirements via stories, detailing issues and problems, and drafting business and technical work/data flows
• Facilitate or support product management, create materials for presentation, and provide reporting/metrics as required

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:
• Bachelor's degree required
• At least 1 year of Product management / business analysis experience including knowledge and exposure to Agile / Scrum ceremonies
• Good communication and presentations skills with the ability to deal with different stakeholder groups to elicit business requirements, procedures, and processes
• Intermediate experience using Microsoft Office, including Excel, Visio and PowerPoint
• Good organizational and prioritization skills, detail-oriented, and strong interpersonal skills
• Ability to analyze and resolve product-related issues and follow through with set objectives
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, be flexible, follow tight deadlines, organize, and prioritize work

To apply for this position, please use the following URL:
https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=b5794999519bde36ae4ffb7cbb3da2af

title: Manager, Product Marketing
company_info: SPH Media’s mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world. It has several business segments in the media industry, including the publishing of newspapers, magazines, and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns and operates other businesses including radio stations and outdoor media.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a key member of the Enterprise Marketing team, this role will be responsible to effectively position and promote products to the B2B target audience, driving market adoption, and supporting the sales team with relevant marketing collateral and strategies. The ideal candidate will need to have a product marketing background and a proven ability to work independently.


Roles & Responsibilities
Product positioning and messaging: Identify the buyer personas and target audience for products. Leverage market research to understand and determine the products’ value proposition, customer needs, pain points for key segments.
Marketing collateral and content creation: Strategize and create various assets including website content, brochures, infographics, case studies, white papers to showcase product value targeting at various key segments. Develop compelling content for B2B audiences, such as blog posts, videos, thought leadership articles, events and reports.
Sales enablement: Create sales enablement assets such as sales presentations, product guides, FAQs to support the sales team in effectively communicating product value to B2B customers.
Engagement initiatives for large accounts (Education Sector): Collaborate with the sales and editorial teams to develop and implement engagement strategy to engage end users effectively to drive product usage.
Market intelligence: Conduct market research and analysis to identify new market opportunities and potential threats. Provide market intelligence to internal teams to inform decision making.
Collaboration and cross-functional support: Collaborate closely with internal teams (sales, editorial, product, customer experience, design) for alignment.
Budget Management: Monitor and track marketing spend to ensure that it remains within budget.
Requirements
At least 5 years of working experience preferably in conceptualising, proposing, planning and executing marketing campaigns.
Degree qualification in Business / Marketing or related discipline.
Strong project management, organisational and communication skills.
Written and spoken Chinese will be an advantage as part of marketing Chinese products.
Ability to work independently while meeting expectations and collaborating within teams.
Experience in event management and knowledge of digital marketing will be an advantage.

title: Product Owner
company_info: We are a diverse group of problem-solvers building a platform and super-app for the maritime space. Our practical goal is to empower seafarers to have better control over their money, finances and career opportunities. This, we hope will transform the lives of seafarers and the people around them. Our long-term vision is to empower seafarers while transforming the shipping sector to be part of a sustainable, transparent and efficient world. As a traditional yet foundational sector in our global society we believe in the significant potential of transformation. We are a seed-stage corporate venture started with global growth ambitions starting from South, Southeast and East Asia. We are looking to build a global team headquartered in Singapore, the world's prime finance and shipping hub.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At SeaBoard, we are a global and diverse group of problem-solvers passionate about improving the life of seafarers and their families. To do so, we are building a super-app to transform the maritime sector by streamlining their institutional finances in order to empower seafarers and their families. We are a seed-stage fintech corporate venture started in Singapore with our sights set for the globe. We believe in creating a sustainable, transparent, and efficient world, and we need your help to achieve this.
What is the opportunity?
We are on the hunt for a Product Owner with a tech edge, someone who’s as excited about mapping out strategies as they are about understanding the nuts and bolts of technological integrations. With our recent successes and growth, we are keen to expand our horizons and bring in top-notch talent that can steer our product direction with expertise.
As a leader in our Singapore-based product engineering team, you will work closely with the founding team, designers, and other engineering leaders to build and ship a product that aligns with our vision of empowering seafarers.
Position: Product Owner for Marine FinTech Corporate Venture
Reports to: CPO
Load: Full-time
Location: Singapore
What will you be doing at SeaBoard?
Technical Oversight: Spearhead the execution of banking and payment integrations, ensuring that our product not only meets industry standards but surpasses them. Understand and interpret our visions into feasible deliverables and manage the execution of plans.
Product Strategy & Execution: Guide our team’s direction in conceptualizing, developing, and refining our product to meet the needs of seafarers and their families. Convert our aspirations into actionable tasks and oversee their realization.
Project Management: Structure our aspirations into actionable plans, manage deliverables, and maintain alignment with business goals.
Leadership & Team Collaboration: Working alongside our designers, engineers, and leaders, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our product’s future. By fostering a culture of excellence, mentorship, and innovation, you’ll help to inspire and uplift our team members.
Specifically, you will be doing:
Define product roadmap while ensuring alignment with our mission to empower seafarers.
Collaborate with tech teams to ensure seamless and efficient execution of product features and integrations.
Work closely with our financial integration partners to enhance product capabilities and ensure robust financial functionalities.
Engage with stakeholders to gather insights, prioritize features, and manage expectations.
Work cross-functionally with designers, engineers, and business leaders to drive product outcomes.
What would we want you to bring?
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, or related field with 10+ years of experience in product management experience.
Prior experience in startups, ideally during their initial stages.
Proven track record as an expert Product Manager and competent Project Manager.
Technical proficiency to direct and oversee banking and payment integrations; a background as a Technical PM is a plus.
Previous leadership roles, showcasing your ability to lead and inspire teams.
Preferably, experience in FinTech and a basic understanding of coding, validating your technical PM capabilities.
Excellent communication skills, adept at articulating ideas and bridging gaps between tech and non-tech stakeholders.
An entrepreneurial mindset, always seeking innovative solutions to complex challenges.
Passionate about our mission, with a deep-seated desire to make a significant impact in the maritime fintech space.
Join us in our mission to empower seafarers and transform the shipping sector. If you are looking to make a difference and work on challenging problems, we would love to hear from you.

title: VP of Product
company_info: Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on the construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man, Machine, Material, Money) resources. Our solutions help digitise all your work processes, and connect all key project stakeholders - developers, consultants, fabricators, contractors, and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform. Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come. Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow
job_category: Building and Construction, General Management, Information Technology
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What you will be doing:

We are looking for a VP of Product who will play a part in developing solutions that will completely revolutionize the construction industry. You will get to work closely with the CEO and be in charge of projects as you play a crucial role in aligning stakeholders and executing our product roadmap. You are responsible for a business’s product planning and execution all through the lifecycle of the business.
Work with C-level management to develop customized and impactful software solutions for clients.
Define the organizational vision that Hubble needs to be successful in scaling our end to end product lines.
Foster and sponsor innovation in our suite of products and identify new opportunities that will accelerate our technical capabilities and reduce the time to market of our products.
Bridge communications between business and engineering in order to prioritise feature development to deliver best-in-class products with strong market fit.
Build a sustainable talent pipeline and grow healthy, creative, empowered and autonomous product teams.
Drive excellence and mentor younger product managers and designers on best practices in the field of Product Management and UIUX.
Interface with Product Engineering and IT Operations to ensure appropriate systems are in place to achieve goals.
What we need from you:
5+ years of leading product teams with a consistent record of developing talent.
8+ years preferred of product management experience overseeing the design, development and launch of successful services, with at least 3 years of multi-level management (manager of managers).
Experience working in both highly agile environments as well as large product development efforts.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to take the initiative to forward team goals.
Enjoy solving complex problems with technology.
Strong business acumen, team player, results-oriented.
Experience and exposure to the construction industry preferred.
Experience in B2B product development is a nice to have.
About Hubble:

Hubble is a leading construction management platform that seamlessly connects stakeholders across the entire value chain to build better, faster, safer, and more cost-effective projects. Our company was founded in 2016 with a mission to automate construction and build wealth for our clients.

Today, we are proud to have automated more than 300 construction sites worth over $50 billion worldwide. Our full suite of software solutions include document, workforce, safety, quality, material, payments, and building management, and are used daily by over 90,000 users from 3,700 companies.

Headquartered in Singapore, we operate from offices in Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines. Our team of passionate and diverse professionals is dedicated to transforming the built environment by building autonomous construction sites through innovative technology and collaborative partnerships.

What Hubble will give you:

Hubble is built by a team of talented, driven, and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. We do not let history and traditions dictate and limit our dreams to shape the world. We adopt the same mindset with our hiring. We are looking for the best and we want to bet on you. If your mindset is right, we promise you the ride of your life.

Who will you be working with:
Purpose driven
Hungry, ambitions, and self-motivated
Meritocratic, results/performance > age/bureaucracy
Resourceful, independent, chart our own destiny
Determined, perseverance, and hard working
Creative, innovative, out of the box
Yes, the above is everyone of us at Hubble.
Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

Roles & Responsibilities:
Menu Planning and Development: Collaborate with our dietary team to plan nutritious and delicious menus for patients, staff, and visitors, taking into consideration dietary restrictions and preferences.
Food Production Management: Oversee food production processes, including food preparation, cooking, and assembly, ensuring that all meals meet the highest quality and safety standards.
Inventory Control: Manage kitchen inventory, including ordering supplies, monitoring stock levels, and minimizing food waste.
Team Leadership: Lead and motivate kitchen staff, including chefs, cooks, and support personnel, to ensure a positive working environment and high-quality food production.

Quality Assurance: Implement quality control measures to maintain consistent food quality and taste. Address any customer complaints or concerns promptly and professionally.
Equipment Maintenance: Oversee the maintenance and repair of kitchen equipment to ensure smooth operations.
Vendor Relations: Build and maintain strong relationships with food suppliers and vendors to secure the best products and pricing.
Menu Cost Analysis: Analyze menu costs and pricing to maximize profitability while maintaining affordable options for patients.
Requirements:
Proven experience in a leadership role within a commercial kitchen or foodservice operation.
Strong knowledge of food safety regulations and industry best practices.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and make quick decisions.
Proficient in budget management and cost control.
Culinary or foodservice management degree or certification preferred.

title: Manager, Services & Lifecycle Support, SEA
company_info: BRUKER SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. Bruker enables scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. Bruker’s high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular and microscopic levels. In close cooperation with our customers, Bruker is enabling innovation, productivity and customer success in life science molecular research, in applied and pharma applications, and in microscopy, nano-analysis and industrial applications. In recent years, Bruker has also become a provider of high-performance systems for cell biology, preclinical imaging, clinical phenomics and proteomics research, clinical microbiology, and for molecular pathology research. Today, worldwide more than 6,000 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents. Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems and a strong reputation among its customers. Being one of the world's leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker is strongly committed to further fully meet its customers’ needs as well as to continue to develop state-of-the-art technologies and innovative solutions for today's analytical questions.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The primary objectives are:
Provide and achieve targets and goals to develop and grow the Service Business unit to maximize volume and profitability.
Lead the assigned service operations team to successfully meeting their objectives, providing growth plan and guidance.
Aid instrument sales by maintaining and developing effective, working customer relationships via valued service products.
Observing competitive and market trends.
Oral and written negiotiations with customers, suppliers, partner companies and internal departments.
Ensure customer loyalty and satisfaction throughout any interaction with Bruker local operation
Ensure fulfilment of business plans for service (PnL) as well as for instrument installation for the entire BBIO portfolio in the area of responsibility
The position will be allocated in Singapore or Thailand, Bangkok providing easier and faster access to our installed base in South-East Asia.
The achievement of set objectives, training requirements and further career development possibilities will be assessed on an annual basis
The normal work place is in a Bruker office
The assigned territory is Singapore, Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, Vietnam, Philippines
The job holder must act in accordance with environmental, health and safety policy and ISO 14001 / OHSAS 18001. In particular, it must ensure the health and safety of employees, review and minimize the environmental impact of the company's activities, products and services, and comply with the requirements of relevant european, national and local laws and regulations.
Duties
Lead the assigned service operations team.
Coordinate problem resolution with other departments including engineering, customer service, sales and applications to expedite repairs.
Review performance reports and documentation from customers and field representatives, inspect malfunctioning or damaged product to determine nature and scope of problem.
Analyze review and inspection findings to determine source of problem, and recommend repair, replacement, or other corrective action.
Serve as a communication link between the customer and the company to ensure effective service is provided to the customer.
Monitoring the expense budget (salaries, expenses, rents, tools, etc.).
Promote and sell the LabScape products (Service Agreements, on-site on-demand and Enhance your lab) as offered by Bruker BioSpin to all existing and new customers.
Evaluate needs and negotiate contracts directly with key accounts or indirectly with 3rd Party Service Providers subject to chart of authority.
Develop existing and build new customer relationships ensuring Bruker is seen as a long-term business partner.
Develop proposal for sales campaigns for specific service products and markets/customers and align campaigns with the Global Market Product Manager for Services & Lifecycle Support before execution.
Monitor changes or developments within the industry and report to management.
Documentation of activities in our CRM program (Salesforce.com).
Support Mentoring program for collegues.
Be responsible for the maintenance and delivery of the Service Contract obligations as well as growth of the business for all product groups in BBIO
Deploy global strategy into the regions of responsibility
Control and mandate adequate training level of the service team and monitor training certificate validation.
Establish local escalation process and act as interface to global 2nd level support as well as to the management (RSLS)
Manage and provide all required contract documentation, both externally for the customer and internally for the company.
Monitor resource workload and efficiency. Build up regular reporting and control of appointment scheduling
Focusses on leveraging the E-Store sales and its product range.
Work closely with the relevant product manager to leverage further growth potentials and identify wins.
Other duties as assigned that are broadly in line with the above and key objectives.
Required Qualifications
M.S. or B.S. level chemist, biochemist, physicist or engineer with NMR work experience.
Demonstrated familiarity with a variety of NMR experiments and laboratory experience.
Proven experience and ability with spectrometer hardware and troubleshooting hardware problems.
Previously managing service or instrumentation within science or engineering discipline
A very high degree of understanding business processes and ability to discuss and persuade at all levels of an organisation
Current valid driving licence
No visa disqualification from the USA or EU.
Valid passport and able to travel extensively both domestic and international travel
Required Skills and experiences
Hands-on knowledge and experience of promoting and selling after-sales support.
Computer literacy for document, presentation preparation and report writing
Excellent interpersonal communication (both written and oral) skills in local language and English
Proven negotiating skills.
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to deal with people at all levels.
High level of management skills and experience

title: Product Manager - Security Engineering
company_info: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
As part of the Security Engineering team, we are responsible for supporting the company's construction of security capabilities and platform services, combining other teams to create efficient and high-quality service docking capabilities, enhancing interactive experience, and lowering the user's barriers to understanding and using security services.

Responsibilities
- Manage the entire product line life cycle, from strategic planning, design, development, and tactical activities of our in-house security product and system.
- Support product positioning and customer demand, and guide product development from conception to launch.
Evaluate product functionalities and performance and propose enhancements to products based on market feedback.
- Research, analyse, and understand user requirements from business teams, and generate ideas to improve internal under satisfaction and make impacts.
- Drive research studies to explore new technology and oversee development of business proposal for new internal opportunities.
- Lead product design by preparing product requirement documents, designing product prototypes, driving collaboration with R&D, design and QA teams to achieve success.
- Perform metrics analysis to continuously improve the product; collect user feedback for product improvement and optimization.

Qualifications
1. Bachelor degree or above, majoring in information security or computer related is preferred.
2. Minimum 3 years of working experience as a Product Manager, understanding the basic knowledge of information security, and having experience in security/ mid-platform product construction is preferred.
3. Excellent communication skills and product thinking, able to think from a user/business perspective.
4. Good logical thinking capability, self-driven and result-oriented.
5. Good product doc writing ability, with hands-on experience in product design tools, such as axure , sketch, figma, etc.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
