description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Objectives of the position:

The Product Manager is responsible for design, development, implementation, and analysis of products. Performs routine engineering design tasks using standard techniques. Fair knowledge of
cable and components applications.

Key Responsibilities

• Planning and evaluating new projects, consulting with other engineers and management as necessary.
• Review new product plans and make recommendations for material selection, based on design objectives such as strength, weight, heat resistance, electrical conductivity, and cost.
• Work with account managers, sales, production and engineers to establish cost estimates and production standards.
• Identifies process bottlenecks and devises solutions to resolve.
• Prepare technical drawings to ensure that installation and operations conform to standards and customer requirements. Where applicable.
• Optimizes productivity in both the engineering and production areas by designing, implementing and testing new procedures.
• Contributes to the teams’ efforts by successfully completing related tasks as needed.

Skills & Qualification

• Analytical skills for troubleshooting designs that are not working as planned and finding answers that work by asking the right questions and testing options.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively explain details of the process and findings to groups of all skillsets.
• Interpersonal skills to develop strong and positive working relationships with the engineering team and all employees in the production process.
• Strong technical knowledge and critical thinking
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering. Electrical or Electronics preferred.
• 5 years of engineering experience preferred.
• Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) systems.

title: Product Manager - Aircon / Displays / Home Appliances
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Engineering, General Management, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the role:
PRISM+ is a rapidly growing and ever-evolving organisation based in Singapore. This role reports to the Product Director and will take charge of the management of a category of hardware products. We are in search for an experienced Product Manager in Air-conditioning/Displays/Home appliances industry for our products.

As the Product Manager, you will be responsible for the strategic planning, commercialization, operationalisation and drive the growth of your product category. You are involved full product lifecycle management which includes define requirements based on customer feedback, market trends, market research, and business goals. You will work closely and support cross functional teams and our partners, and become the point of coordination for ensuring the products deliver the best value and experience for our customers. You will need to be able to build strong rapport, be curious, meticulous and have solid technical competency.

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and execute go-to-market strategy by taking into consideration of the global view. e.g.: opportunities and target customers, initial development of the positioning, value proposition, pricing framework as well as initial capacity plans).
Source, build and maintain relationships with our partners, working closely to design and manufacturer new product models.
You would be required to lead and drive product development, conducting consumer and market research, define product requirements, lead and drive product launches, developing and maintaining user manuals and manage product roadmaps and timelines.
Partner with software development on the product requirements and oversee smart home integration for the product category.
Identify and prioritize new product opportunities for the product category, based on market trends, customer needs and competitive analysis.
Work with marketing to monitor and drive product success.
Drive innovation within product area with industry trends and best practices.
Ensure senior management are up to date with reports and communication on the progress of the product category.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline e.g., Management, Marketing, Commerce, Engineering or Finance.
Minimum of 8 years’ relevant working experience in B2B product management experience with ability to independently lead the agenda.
No fear of the unknown. You have to be an analytical self-starter, comfortable with complete uncertainty as we look to venture into new product lines or models. You need to be able to dive in and test all angles without supervision.
Data driven. You need to be able to structure, quantify and qualify information on product research, and present this to stakeholders explaining the logic. Comfort with spreadsheet software and data modelling is essential.
Strong Business acumen – Understanding of the wider environment within which our business operates and implications of e.g., trends / shifts in sustainability and consumer perception, brand owners’ opportunity & challenges, and being able to drive actionable insights and articulate what products/services to offer to accelerate profitable growth.
Detailed oriented with strong project management skills on multi-market projects
Excellent communication skills in English is a must, with a strong preference for candidates with the ability to communicate in Mandarin Chinese at a Business level.
Benefits:
Attractive remuneration package
Annual outpatient benefit (Includes dental and optical benefits)
Health insurance
Annual increment
Performance bonuses
Birthday leave

title: AVP, Digital Product Management, Consumer Banking Group (ID: WD58084)
company_info: DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. DBS has been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by The Banker, a member of the Financial Times group, and “Best Bank in Asia-Pacific” by Global Finance. The bank has also been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for seven consecutive years from 2009 to 2015.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Business Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
Digital revolutions are set to change the way we live, work and play. That’s why we’ve spared no effort in ensuring we are at the forefront of this new generation. Our new digital banking initiative will focus on creating innovative products and services to integrate banking into our customers' digital lifestyle.
Responsibilities
Product Management
Collaborate closely with the team, including Investment Product, Product Managers, other sub-platform teams, Platform Lead and Design teams to develop and implement investment portfolios that meet different customer needs on the Digital Portfolios Platform.
Apply a data-driven mindset and utilise digital analytics tools to drive decision-making.
Have a business mindset and keep in view business metrics when developing portfolio propositions.
Project Implementation
Participate in defining business requirements to ensure that the requirements are ready for the technology team and platform vendors.
Understand integration points and develop error and fall-back requirements with the technology team and platform vendors.
Formulate and articulate clear and understandable product vision, objectives, and requirements to development teams for each sprint.
Ensure the squads’ backlog are created and prioritised in advance for every sprint, support prioritisation of defects where necessary.
Ensure consistent implementations across different channels and portfolio types.
Work closely with key stakeholders, including Delivery, Technology, Operations and Design teams by participating in squad rituals, to ensure timeliness of project deliverables.
Customer Feedback Management & Reporting
Ensure all customer feedback are timely raised and tracked for investigation; closely follow-up to reduce potential delays in response time.
Update all stakeholders on a regular basis on the project status and blockers (if any).
Requirements
Technical skills/Academic qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business or similar field.
Proficient in handling Scrum and Agile methodologies.
At least 4 years of working experience as a digital product manager or related role preferred.
Interpersonal skills
Self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Passion for mobile & web technologies in a UX-driven environment.
A quick mind with a problem-solving aptitude, creative & pragmatic.
Good project management skills with attention to details, ability to multi-task and work within tight timelines.
Strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills, with good oral and written communications skill in English.
Experience working with cross-cultural teams is a plus.
Good knowledge of investment products and digital platforms are added advantages.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

title: R0292110 - CB- Product Manager for Fund Services - VP
company_info: About Deutsche Bank A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and opportunities to excel.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Details of the Division and Team:
At the heart of Deutsche Bank is the Corporate Bank (CB), a market leader in cash management, trade finance, lending, trust and agency services and securities services, as well as risk management for foreign exchange and interest rates - Securities Services (SeS) provides custody, clearing and settlement and fund services to global custodians, broker/dealers, and prime brokers as well as buy-side firms and other institutional clients.
In SeS, we are recruiting a fund accountant professional with deep traditional experience in accounting, instrument valuations, fund administration operations; familiar with insurance/asset owner segments and who wants to further deepen and extend his/her career capabilities with digital data, cloud and artificial intelligence in fund services.
As such, we offer the position of APAC regional product design and delivery subject matter expert (Accounting & Valuations) who will directly report into the Fund Services Tribe Lead/global head of fund services product management. The successful candidate will work with him and the other forward looking stakeholders to drive a multi-year strategic transformation delivery roadmap and deliver positive impacts.
The successful candidate should have interests to leverage his/her existing experience and expertise with leading technology, and to work with operations to facilitate and deliver new, automated impactful value for asset managers and owners. In doing so, he/she will collaborate across sales, operations, technology and risks management teams to define, communicate, roadmap and deliver to agreed results and milestones, and function as an empowered subject matter leader in the ongoing fund services strategic transformation.
What we will offer you:
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce is better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.
You can expect:
Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits
Gender Neutral Parental Leave
Flexible working arrangements
25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement
Your key responsibilities:
Lead the design/redesign, definitions and descriptions of fund services accounting, financial instrument valuation and reporting services/microservices for asset owners, asset managers and operations. Incorporate approved new services into the fund services strategic transformation roadmap, facilitate execution dependencies and resourcing. Reporting services include client customisation requests, regulatory-required and year-end/periodic period financial statements.
Analyse and relate IFRS, local accounting standards and financial instrument valuations to data description and product/data sources required for necessary and insightful reports for regulators, asset manager/owner clients and internal stakeholders. Collaborate with different subject matter experts like data engineers and developers.
As a subject matter expert in multidisciplinary teams to implement transformation deliverables and services.
Support set-up of accounting and financial instrument valuation methodologies for clients as required. Support trouble shooting, risks reviews, and contribute to client’s RFPs and inquiries.
Work across sales, operations, technology and risks management to implement digital data-driven reporting services on timely basis to clients and markets; manage book of work; propose ideas, identify and escalate emerging risks, involve new facilitators and mitigate inhibitors of success.
Review, streamline range of customised reports and establish going forward basis to realise operations scalability and cost saving.
Review and facilitate standardisation of data description and entity relationships.
Be involved in relevant industry working groups related to fund administration.
Conduct internal trainings.
Your skills and experience:
8 to 10+ years of fund administration operations hands-on experience including client and regulatory reporting and financial year-end activities.
4 to 5+ years of experience in insurance fund administration or investment servicing operation requirements including look-through accounting, unit-linked funds, insurance assets accounting and segregated mandates.
Demonstrable knowledge of fund administration lifecycle processes including exceptions and main risks.
Evidenced expertise in IFRS and/or local equivalent accounting standards, financial instrument valuations and reporting in the asset management/owner industry.
Demonstrated track record in timely deliveries and performance under time pressured situations.
Proven analytical and skills to communicate (written/verbal/listening) clearly and in detail.
Evidenced knowledge of digital data, cloud and/or artificial intelligence. Beginner’s level is acceptable.
Familiar with a matrix reporting environment, comfortable with ambiguity, able to plan, empathetic and see from different point of views, driven and able to multi-task.
Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply.
How we’ll support you:
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Coaching and support from experts in your team
About us and our teams:
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do.
Deutsche Bank & Diversity
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

title: Product Development Manager
company_info: SKYLINE BUSINESS CONSULTING PTE. LTD.
job_category: F&B, Marketing / Public Relations, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Advertisement

Company Name: FARMHOUSE LEGEND PTE. LTD.

Farmhouse Legend Pte. Ltd. envisions a bright future, acting as a bridge between Southeast Asia and exceptional catering firms globally. We currently seek a driven Product Development Manager to amplify Nong Geng Ji, our renowned Hunan cuisine brand, in Singapore. Established in 2017, Nong Geng Ji thrives on quality ingredients and Hunan culinary heritage, attracting locals. The Product Development Manager will be pivotal in crafting food items, product formulas, and raw material operations for the brand's expansion.

Position: Product Development Manager

Salary: $8000 SGD - $12000 SGD

Job Responsibilities:

● Develop and innovate menu items in accordance with the company's business goals and policies. Responsible for menu updates and seasonal iterations.
● Familiarize and master the characteristics and combinations of various food ingredients. Able to independently research and develop new products or improve product formulas and process workflows, and establish standard operating procedures (SOPs).
● Responsible for strategic planning and patent layout of research and development projects. Collect and research information related to new products, track and understand the dynamics of the catering and market, stay informed about policies and industry regulations related to product development, and integrate them into the product development process.
● Clearly define the technical requirements for equipment and facilities related to production. Actively seek suitable suppliers for raw materials, semi-finished products, and related items for the company.
● Establish departmental operating mechanisms and develop and improve various management systems and workflows within the department.
● Plan and establish a technology research and development team, supervise, evaluate, and train subordinates.
● Manage and control the cost expenses, time, and human resources costs incurred during the completion of projects in the department.
● Coordinate the work relationships between the research and development department and other departments within the company.


Requirements:

● Demonstrated expertise in product development and management skills, possess the ability for financial management and cost control to ensure the restaurant's economic operation.
● A minimum of 10 years of hands-on involvement in the intricate world of Hunan cuisine, indicating deep culinary experience.
● Capable of independently developing new dishes, having innovative capabilities to offer new flavors and dishes to attract customers and maintain competitiveness, improving traditional Hunan cuisine, and possessing in-depth knowledge of ingredients.
● Profound familiarity with Nong Geng Ji's brand evolution and business strategies, substantiating a comprehensive understanding.
● A preference for candidates with at least 15 years of involvement in the food and beverage sector, emphasizing substantial industry experience.
● Exceptional communication abilities, encompassing strong verbal and written skills, are required.
● The role demands relocation and frequent international travel, underscoring the necessity for mobility and flexibility.
● A bachelor's degree in business administration or equivalent field is a bonus point.

MUFG Bank’s parent, Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group, Inc. (MUFG) is one of the world’s leading financial groups. title: Team Lead / Manager - Application / Product Security
company_info: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the company
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
The team is missioned to build infrastructures, platforms and technologies, as well as to support cross-functional teams to protect our users, products and infrastructures. In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and secure-by-design systems and solutions. Our challenges are not your regular day-to-day technical problems; you'll be part of a team that's developing new solutions to new challenges of a kind not previously addressed by big tech. It's working fast, at scale, and we're making a difference.

Responsibilities
- Lead and manage a team of passionate individuals focused on improving the security posture of the company's products and systems.
- Develop positive and trusted relationships with business partners both inside and outside of the company.
- Ensure individual support and talent development for direct reports, leading the team in terms of technical excellence and practicing ByteStyle principles.
- Design and perform tests and check cases to analyze design, architectures, existing systems services, operating systems, networks and applications from a security perspective, via black box testing, code reviews, automation, threat modeling and research. This is to meet confidentiality, integrity, authentication, availability, authorisation, and nonrepudiation standards.
- Translate requirements into test plan, write and execute test scripts or codes in line with standards and procedures to determine vulnerability to attacks.
- Certify infrastructure components, systems and applications that meet security standards.
- Discover security issues that appear under new threat scenarios, support incident response, forensics, remediation in a cross-functional environment driving towards incident resolution.

Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other relevant majors.
- 5+ years of security engineering experience such as design review, threat modeling, security mitigation development, security tooling development or privacy engineering.
- 2+ years of people management in an engineering organization, strong leadership skills and stress-resistance.
- Advanced knowledge and understanding in various disciplines: web application security, mobile app security, network security, operating system internals and hardening, applied cryptography, cloud computing. You're expected to be an expert in at least one of these areas.
- Solid experience in writing and reviewing code in at least one of the following programming languages: JavaScript (Node JS), Go, Python, Java, C++, Rust.
- Strong problem-solving skills and excellent debugging / troubleshooting skills.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

title: ISM General Manager
company_info: For more than a century, Brother has won recognition as a brand synonymous with delivering product innovation and customer satisfaction. A Japanese company founded in 1908, Brother has 17 production sites (incl. five factories of Brother Industries, Ltd.) and 52 sales companies operating in 44 countries in different regions today. Brother is now a leading brand that produces quality innovative products for the print and imaging, labelling and sewing markets. Key products include laser printers, Multi-Function Centres (MFCs), fax machines, labellers, label printers, and a wide range of home and industrial sewing machines. A trusted brand worldwide that believes in the "Customer First" approach in all aspects of our business, Brother has continuously met the varied needs of our customers through our comprehensive range of quality solutions.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As an Industrial Sewing Machine (ISM) General Manager, You Will
Fulfil, but not limited to, the following roles and responsibilities:

1. Expand new business of production management system with IoT/Cloud/AI technology to garment factories all over Asia
Sales & Marketing
- Develop sales growth strategies, sales budgets, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), Product Development (PD), and Product Launch (PL) plans, and seek consensus from management.
- Implement a PDCA cycle for action plans executed by sales staff in each country, ensuring alignment with the above strategies.
- Regularly visit customers to promote our system and gain a deep understanding of their operations and needs.
- Collaborate with Japan HQ to plan and execute digital marketing initiatives.
- Create sales promotion materials in collaboration with Japan HQ.
Development support
- Propose new system features to Japan HQ to drive sales.
- Collaborate with software engineers from Japan HQ to discuss the specifications of new features.
- Conduct Proof of Concept (PoC) and test the new features at customer locations.

2. Grow and maintain the business of industrial sewing machine in Pakistan and Sri Lanka
Develop action plans, KPIs, and PD strategies to achieve sales budgets, and obtain consensus from management.
Implement a PDCA cycle for action plans executed by sales staff, based on the strategies.
Regularly communicate and visit dealers and end customers to promote sales and strengthen relationships with them.
3. Manage supply chain for the business of industrial sewing machine all over Asia
Develop action plans to maintain and improve Quality, Cost, and Delivery (QCD) metrics, and seek consensus from management.
Implement a PDCA cycle for action plans executed by your staff.
Take the initiative to resolve emergency issues such as stock shortages by effectively communicating with Japan HQ.

We’d Love to Hear from People With
Communicate effectively with software engineers from Japan HQ in Japanese, specifically related to software development. Thus, fluency in Business Japanese is essential.
Possess a strong understanding of software concepts, including web applications, networks, and cloud technologies.
Demonstrate a track record of at least 5 years as a project manager, successfully driving new business initiatives in a B2B environment.
Possess a minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in industrial sewing machine sales.
Possess knowledge and experience in logistics operational management.

title: Manager, Social Enterprise
company_info: RecruiterPal is a cloud-based recruitment platform that helps you to recruit staff faster and easier, giving you full control and overview of your entire recruitment process.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
MINDS has been caring for Persons with Intellectual Disabilities (PWIDs) and their families since 1962.
Grounded in the belief that all PWIDs have innate abilities and talents, MINDS is committed to empowering them and enhancing their quality of life, while advocating for greater inclusivity for PWIDs as a nation.
MINDS is today one of the largest charities in Singapore employing more than 850 staff. With the key focus to expand community-based services, improving the employability of PWIDS, strengthening education, and engendering inclusive community living, MINDS offers a holistic range of services and programmes across the PWIDs’ lifespan.
These include schools, employment and training development centres, home-based care services and community-based services to cater to the physical, psychological, environmental and social needs of PWIDs. For more information, please visit www.minds.org.sg.
RESPONSIBILITIES
To manage subcontract work operations and relationships with partners. He/She will liaise with production centres to ensure smooth business operations. He/She will also generate leads for subcontract work and group employment for persons with intellectual disabilities.
Develop new business opportunities
Develop goals and objectives to increase employment of PWID
Designing and implementing plans to promote the attainment of goals
Develop partnership programmes for business or employment opportunities
Generate leads for business/employment growth
Support Snr Manager during annual budgeting
Work with various sectors to understand needs and identify available work opportunities for employment of PWIDs or jobs available for Assisted Employment or Subcontract work in the EDCs
Guide team members to align with Assisted Employment/Subcontract/Enclave projects and work streams
Engage team in project execution from ideation to implementation
Work closely with EDCs and any other internal stakeholders for coordination to execute the projects
Ensure organisation has adequate resources to complete its activities
Organised and co-ordinate operations with production teams in ways to ensure maximum productivity
Manage key accounts and build strong relationship
Business negotiation with key resources required for the project
Manage relationship with partners/vendors/supplier
Contract negotiation
Manage any business dispute/crisis
Work with internal stakeholders for coordination in managing crisis
QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Business Administration or equivalent from a recognised tertiary institution
OTHER INFORMATION
Min 2-5 years’ experience in supervisory position
Proficiency in English
Possesses strong business acumen or past business development/ project management experience.
Experience in disability sector will be an added advantage
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - MINDSG LTD

title: Specialist - Product Development and Management (Digital Initiatives), Metals and Minerals
company_info: RIO TINTO IRON ORE ASIA PTE. LTD.
address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Specialist - Product Development and Management (Digital Initiatives), Metals and Minerals
Why Explore
· Be part of one of the world's largest Metal, Minerals and Materials Groups.
· Be a part of a diverse and inclusive team.
· Be a leader in the energy transition, de-carbonisation, ESG evolution and digital transformation.
· Create products and solutions that drive and materialise a Green, Transparent and traceable future.
· Be the creative arm for commercial solutions that cater to end user requirements and lead the thinking of how materials can help deliver the energy transition.
· START the journey towards the future with us as we materialise possibilities.
· Based in Singapore.

About Rio Tinto
As the world’s second largest metal and mining group, Rio Tinto is a global company with footprint in ~35 countries and 60 locations. It is a leading voice in the metals and minerals sector on ESG, Digital offers, strategic partnerships and marketing and thought leadership. The commercial strategy is primarily designed around customer centricity, shift from selling to solutions and in partnership with supply chain partners accelerate the journey towards de-carbonisation, energy transition and green solution provider.
To see the journey we are on, click on the link below:
www.startresponsible.com
To materialise the energy transition the world is on, we want leaders who can help shape this future and think differently to position Rio Tinto as the partner of choice for our customers, end users and consumers. We materialise possibilities.

About the role
As the Specialist – Digital Development and Management, support the Manager of Digital Products and Platforms through the development of product life cycle planning and commercial strategies that will enrich and be compatible with the product development roadmap. This role will be responsible for creating the solutions and products, ensuring the commercial products to be market leading or disruptive, and deliver value, in collaboration with commercial digital team, product sales teams, and product groups, along with key Metals and Minerals marketing team pillars. Join this fast paced team that is accountable for driving the external industrial strategy of the company for and with our customers and supply chain.
Reporting to Senior Manager, Market Development and Strategy, Pacific, this role will:
Lead the development and implementation of the key digital initiatives in Metals and Minerals Marketing that are required to deliver Commercial Strategy for overall value enhancement, such as START digital traceability solution.
Act as the interface;For Commercial Service & Digital team to ensure regular support for the digital initiatives and maintenance
For each product Sales team, as part of global Product Development team, to manage commercial digital product development process
Manage enquiries from and interaction with Sales team in Pacific region for Rio Tinto commercial product offering, capturing the market and customer insights, and future market needs, that are reflected in the product development strategy.
Be an advocate and thought leader for digital technology and innovation in Metals and Minerals Marketing, contributing to the opportunities for business improvement across Metals and Minerals business portfolio.
Support Market Development team in Pacific, synergising Product Development capability, to connect key industrial end users’ strategic agenda with Rio Tinto’s commercial product offering, by participating development discussions.
About you
To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Commerce, or equivalent is required. MBA will be beneficial.
Strong strategic and commercial acumen with at least 8 of prior experience in commercial strategy or sales & marketing,
Strong working knowledge in metals and minerals sector (Copper / Aluminium / Lithium / Borates etc)
Ability to understand digital technologies and best practices for how deliver an outstanding customer experience with support from internal and external resources
Ability to present and breakdown ideas in a simple and digestible manner
Ability to effectively navigate ambiguity and change context to develop workable and sustainable solutions
Influencing skills with the ability to translate business and technical content into actionable insights
Possesses innate curiosity, observes empathetically and enjoys creatively-driven problem solving, not taking “no” as failure but as an opportunity
Ability in navigating and operating successfully in a global matrix organisation for effective stakeholder engagement in a multicultural context, and business partnering skills being key requisites.
Competencies in collaboration, listening, ability to receive and provide feedback in a positive manner and embodiment of Rio Tinto behaviours will be required https://www.riotinto.com/en/can/about
Fluency in English (verbal/written)
Ability to travel
It would be beneficial if you have:
MBA
Professional working knowledge of an Asian language, preferably Mandarin Chinese / Korean / Japanese / Thai, due to business requirement
Experience in working globally across diverse cultures
Where you will be working
Rio Tinto Commercial puts the company’s value over volume approach into practice, with the goal of maximizing the value of our physical flows to improve both our business and that of our customers. Headquartered in Singapore, and integrated with Rio Tinto’s assets, hubs, and offices globally, our Commercial group works hand-in-hand with our product groups to ensure both the amount and types of products we produce meet our customer’s needs, and manage the trade-off between volumes, quality, cost and capital expenditure.

About us
As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.
Aluminium for cars and smartphones. Copper for wind turbines, electric cars and the pipes that bring water to our home. Iron ore to shape our city skylines. Borates that help crops grow, titanium for paint – and diamonds that celebrate the best things in life.
Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents.

Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce
We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.

Every Voice Matters
At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, the LGBTI+ community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

title: Product Manager

English proficiency with a minimum of 3 years of experience.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job brief
We are looking for an experienced Production Manager to organize and oversee the manufacturing of goods. You will be ultimately responsible for the smooth running of all production lines and the quality of output.
We expect you to have deep know-how in production procedures. Ability to direct personnel towards maximum performance will set you apart as a leader. Decision-making and problem-solving will take up a great part of your day. If you are up to it, we’d like to talk to you.
The goal is to ensure an efficient and productive manufacturing process that meets customer requirements.

Responsibilities
· Liaise with other managers and management to formulate objectives and understand requirements
· Estimate costs and prepare budgets
· Organize workflow to meet specifications and deadlines
· Monitor production to resolve issues
· Supervise and evaluate performance of production personnel (quality inspectors, workers etc.)
· Determine amount of necessary resources (workforce, raw materials etc.)
· Approve maintenance work, purchasing of equipment etc.
· Ensure output meets quality standards
· Enforce health and safety precautions
· Report to upper management

· Proven experience as production director
· Deep knowledge of production management
· Understanding of quality standards and health & safety regulations
· Knowledge of performance evaluation and budgeting concepts
· Experience in reporting on key production metrics
· Proficient in MS Office and ERP software
· Outstanding communication ability
· Excellent organizational and leaderships skills
· Attention to detail
· Strong decision-making skills and a results-driven approach

title: Staff Product Manager
company_info: Airwallex facilitates the transformation of businesses from offline to online, from local to global. Airwallex was built with a single purpose in mind – to create a world where all businesses can operate without borders and restrictions, and by doing so, propel the growth of the global digital economy.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role will work on building Scale, one of Airwallex’s flagship products. Scale enables Platforms (such as marketplaces) to embed financial financial services at the point of need, at speed and anywhere in the world. With Scale, Platforms bring merchants and users together in a single, centralised solution, delivering powerful account management, collection, conversion and payment capabilities with tailored user experience.

As a product analyst owning the needs of Scale platforms in a priority industry, you will build a picture of the objectives and needs of this customer group, through collaboration with Airwallex’s go to market teams, exploring & testing Platform needs through direct interactions with both existing and prospective customers, complemented with external research as you see fit. You will spend most of your day analysing customer needs, prioritising pain points & possible solution options, leading discovery & research on specific business problems, all whilst feeding back your understanding of the Platform customer group to Product stakeholders, and accompanying Product iteration as we deploy solutions for this priority Platform industry group.

This role is based in Shanghai and will work closely with a dedicated engineering team as well as the global product management team of Airwallex.

What You’ll Need
We look for great people with motivation and drive to build global financial infrastructure. We encourage talents from all kinds of backgrounds across junior and senior levels to apply.
Required:
You have a bachelor degree of a leading universityYou are ruthless in prioritisation and focused on building something that customers wantYou have structured problem-solving skills, fast learning ability and willingness to challenge the status quoYou have excellent communication skills in English and can craft great communication material for different audiences (e.g. developers, client stakeholder, internal management)
Preferred:
You have experience in product management, software development, management consulting or banking with an outstanding track record of achievementsYou have experience with B2B SaaS products, ideally API basedYou have experience in payments products in fintech, bank, payment service provider or other financial institutionsYou have a technical background and experience with agile software developmentYou have experience in analysing customer requirements and writing requirement documentationYou have experience working in international teams and startup environment

title: Senior Regional Product Manager, Robotics
company_info: EPSON SINGAPORE PTE LTD Epson Singapore Pte Ltd was established in October 1982 as Epson Electronics (Singapore) Pte Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Seiko Epson Corporation, Japan, with the objective of promoting the sales and marketing of Epson printers in the region. In 1987, our business scope was expanded to include the sale of electronic components and system devices. The company was subsequently renamed Epson Singapore Pte Ltd in 1988. Our product portfolio saw rapid expansion in the following years to include more IT based products such as colour inkjet printers, scanners, digital cameras, large format printers, laser printers and serial impact dot matrix printers that cater to both business and personal user environments. In recent years, we have also successfully entered the competitive market of visual instruments with highly-sophisticated LCD projectors and peripherals as well as system devices such as crystal oscillators, camera modules, D-TED colour LCD modules, ultra-compact TFT LCD modules, LCD modules, LCD drivers and ASIC/System LSI microcomputers. Then there are also the highly regarded Epson Point-Of-Sales receipt printers that have been holding a worldwide leadership position. The attainment of ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 certifications in November 1997 and March 2000 respectively is a reflection as well as an affirmation of our commitment to excellent product quality and good corporate citizenship. Epson Singapore is committed to complying with the Environmental Policy established. January 2001 marked an exciting milestone in the new millennium for Epson Singapore when we were accorded the status of regional headquarters. With that move, our regional sales network was substantially enlarged to include countries in Southeast Asia with the highest economic growth potential. Most recently in April 2012, Epson Singapore was made the regional sales and service headquarters for our world-rernowned factory automation robots. Our regional product sales now cover Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Indochina and the South Asian nation of Pakistan. Epson Singapore is proud to be part of the rapid economic growth of the region that could only come about because of sound economic policies, dedicated workforces and the pervasive use of IT in government, industry, business and in homes. Epson first started life in Suwa, Japan in 1942 as "Daiwa Kogyo" - a company making wristwatch parts for its parent company, Seiko. The Epson name was subsequently derived in 1975 from the idea of the company being the offspring ("son") of the innovative and successful EP-101, the world's smallest electronic printer (EP) which was created by the company in 1968. This revolutionary commercial printer was developed from the world's first digital printing timer that was specially designed for the Tokyo Olympics in 1964.
description:

title: Lead, Product Marketing Manager
company_info: AIA Group Limited (“AIA”) and Discovery Group Limited (“Discovery”) have agreed to establish a digital health technology and integrated solutions business (“Amplify”) that aims to transform how payors, private hospitals, corporates and public healthcare systems deliver health and wellness for patients and communities across Asia. Amplify brings together the best of partners through a combination of Discovery’s globally proven healthcare technology, intellectual property and expertise and AIA’s brand, established market position, distribution assets and decades of well-established leadership and execution capabilities. Initially focused on serving AIA businesses to help increase new business value and deliver financial benefits, Amplify will over time also serve and partner with other key healthcare system participants including private hospitals, corporates, public healthcare system providers and pharmaceutical and MedTech companies. Amplify will create value and deliver better outcomes for stakeholders across the healthcare value chain: • Innovative private health insurance propositions • Medical cost optimisation and improved quality of care through expertise in case, disease, payment and network management • Claims and core operations process transformation and automation • Value-based provider network management through incentives aligned around cost-effective and efficient care • Digital engagement through wellness programmes and online portals • Data management and analytics for ongoing value generation
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Instructions for interested applicants
Please apply for this position via the following link
https://aia.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/amplifyhealthexternal/job/Singapore-SG-Amplify-Health/Lead--Product-Marketing-Manager_JR-42694

Job Description
Role and responsibilities:
As the product marketing manager, you play a pivotal role in communicating the value of your product to customers, partners, media and employees. You define and execute marketing strategies and are responsible for ensuring that your product is strategically positioned to meet the unique needs of customers. You are a key partner to the product manager, working closely to create and manage product marketing strategies and campaigns to drive product adoption and usage.
A day in your life as a product marketing manager at Amplify Health may include these activities:
Market research – you are familiar with A/B testing, UX research and other qualitative methods
Customer insights – you distill data and knowledge to insights that can be applied to create effective concepts and communications
Product positioning – you work with your product manager counterpart to develop relevant and compelling propositions
GTM strategy – you partner product and commercial teams to create effective go-to-market strategies to penetrate new segments and markets
Content creation and production – you are creative, resourceful and are passionate about producing engaging content that changes perceptions, attitudes and behaviours
Product training for commercial and partner teams to effectively sell products – you empower the commercial and partnership teams with the requisite knowledge to achieve high lead to sale conversion ratios
Product marketing asset utilisation tracking – you take a test and learn approach to all creative work, and you track performance of every piece of content to achieve the highest return on your investment of time and resources
Manage product marketing asset library – you maintain an up-to-date library of assets that are easy to access and use
Compliance – you ensure that all marketing materials and activities adhere to industry regulatory standards

You are a perfect match if:
You are well versed in topics that don’t necessarily fit neatly in a single discipline: ideation, agile development, launching releases, go-to-market and demand generation.
You are drawn to details. Product marketing involves a lot of minutiae and you apply your strong project management skills to everything you do.
You love data. You have an innate need to understand the market, get into the minds of your customers and to help your team understand how to best position your product. Qualitative studies, focus group discussions and in-depth studies or UX research are some of the tools you use to uncover insights on your customers.
You are collaborative. You work well across functions and squads to consistently produce superlative results where the whole is greater than the sum of the parts.
You can demonstrate familiarity with common tools used in product marketing.
You have marketing experience in healthcare, insurance and technology.
You are adept at using tools like Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics, Adobe Experience Cloud, LinkedIn and video and podcasting platforms.

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. Team Introduction
Evaluation is a very important link in search engines, which can help search engines evaluate the quality and relevance of search results, thereby improving users' search experience. As an independent team in the search product department, our evaluation team provides independent, objective and accurate evaluation viewpoints by formulating and implementing a global evaluation plan, combined with various evaluation and research data, to help the entire product development team continuously understand users' needs and optimize user experience. Daily work of the team covers user research, data analysis, project management and other related areas. If you are interested, we would be delighted to have you join us.
Job Description
1. Responsible for improving the quality of search results and search effects of international short video products, and formulating relevant evaluation and research plan documents for different product functions, content and strategies;
2. Collaborate with the international operation team, promote the global implementation of the overall research and evaluation plan, formulate corresponding monitoring and checking plans, and ensure the timeliness and accuracy of the delivery of the evaluation report
3. Based on the evaluation report, combined with user research and objective data, analyze user needs and satisfaction, make reasonable judgments on the advantages and disadvantages of search products/strategies, and make relevant optimization suggestions;
Qualifications
1. Have a solid understanding of search products and mechanisms, understand search quality evaluation methods and processes. Having prior experience with search products is considered a bonus factor.
2. Be capable of analyzing diverse user data, delving deep into user needs, and constantly optimizing the user experience of search products;
3. Possess strong logical thinking, innovative spirit, and strong project management ability;
4. title: Product Delivery Manager
company_info: Milieu Insight is a consumer research and analytics company. We help businesses thrive in a data-driven world of rapid change, where the need for reliable, quick information to make strategic decisions has never been greater. We believe in the transformative power of going beyond insights and we’re driven by our passion to understand people - how they think, feel and act. Through smart automation, best-in-class technology, a core focus on user experience, and most importantly, an amazing team, we collect and deliver consumer insight like no other research company around.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Website: www.mili.eu
LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/milieuinsight
Facebook: www.facebook.com/MilieuInsight
Product Delivery Manager @ Milieu
WHAT WE DO?
To put it simply, Milieu empowers businesses and organizations with knowledge about their customers attitudes and behaviours so they can make better decisions, faster. You could call us a market research firm, but our approach to and solutions for consumer research are unique. Through smart automation, best-in-class technology, a core focus on user experience, and most importantly, an amazing team we collect and deliver consumer insight like no other research company around.
HOW WE DO IT?
We collect our data through a proprietary mobile app known as milieu surveys. The opinions shared by our community of panellists are synthesized through our proprietary algorithms, allowing us to gain a deep understanding of what drives their personal and social motivations, as well as their consumption habits.
WHAT MOTIVATES US (and hopefully you)?
We’re a team of explorers, always looking for new, better and more effective ways of working in our craft. Our curiosity pushes us to challenge the status quo, design and build cutting edge solutions, and even challenge our customers to embrace new ways of thinking about and using consumer insight.
So if you’re someone who isn’t comfortable wandering off the beaten track and challenging convention, we’re probably not the right fit for each other. But if you are, read on!

OK, SO WHAT ABOUT THE ROLE?
Milieu is working on a new product rollout in 2023 that will allow us to include SaaS-oriented solutions to our overall product offering, and also provide us with a strong foundation to continue rolling out new products and features regularly over time. This Product Delivery Manager role will be part of our newly created Rollout/Implementation team that will be tasked with ensuring the successful delivery of new products/features to internal users and clients.

As Product Delivery Manager, your core responsibilities include

1) Driving the adoption of new products and features with internal users
Integrating new products & features to existing workflows
Developing efficient operational processes to support new products & features
Ensuring the adoption of new products & features by internal end-users
Development of a knowledge base and best practice guide for the new products/features
Regular training internal end-users on new products & features
2) Supporting the commercialisation of new products and features
Operational support to ensure successful commercialisation of new products & features
Ensuring the successful adoption of new products & features by clients
Supporting regular training of new products and features to drive adoption amongst clients
Managing and delivering client projects that involve new products & features
Collecting, consolidating and prioritizing client feedback on new products & features
3) Ensuring continual improvements of products/features through internal users and client feedback
Conducting feedback sessions with internal end users/clients to collate product feedback
Contextualizing product feedback through clear user requirements/technical specifications
Developing a clear and realistic product roadmap through prioritization of product feedback
Working with product team to ensure product improvements are implemented
Ensuring product improvements are integrated into existing workflows/best practices
A FEW OTHER THINGS WE LOOK FOR
You’ll likely have at least 6-8 years professional experience working at either a research firm, advertising agency or within a research/analytics role at an agency or brand.
Background in statistics or research methods is ideal
Strong experience working with and retaining customers, including experience developing customers growth strategies.
You like a fun, cool, tech-focused, fast-paced start-up environment
You are responsible, accountable and can work well independently and with others in a fast-paced environment
You are resourceful and open minded
You demonstrate strong analytical thinking, organizational skills & attention to detail
You have excellent communication skills
You embrace change, and can adapt to a changing work environment
You’re a trailblazer, and are comfortable paving a new path to find solutions and ways of working

title: Product Specialist - Die Lid Attach
company_info: BESI Company Profile Besi is engaged in one line of business, the development, manufacturing, marketing, sales and service of semiconductor assembly equipment for the global semiconductor and electronics industries. Customers Besi's customers are primarily leading multinational chip manufacturers, assembly subcontractors and electronics and industrial companies. Customers are principally independent device manufacturers (IDMs) which purchase Besi's equipment for internal use at their assembly facilities and assembly contractors which purchase Besi's equipment to produce packages for third parties on a contract basis. Besi's equipment performs critical functions in customers' assembly operations and in many cases represents a significant percentage of their installed base of assembly equipment. Global presence Besi is a global company with headquarters in Duiven, the Netherlands. It operates eight facilities comprising 535,000 square feet of space for production and development activities, as well as eight sales and service offices across Europe, Asia and North America. End 2012 Besi employed a total staff of 1,539 fixed and temporary personnel of whom approximately 54% were based in Asia and 46% were based in Europe and North America.

title: REGIONAL SALES MANAGER (CLEANING CHEMICALS)
company_info: Gemini Personnel was founded in 1983 and has since become synonymous with delivering sustainable client driven human capital management solutions to a wide spectrum of clientele across Asia. With a breadth of experience in unique international staffing markets, we have developed a service offering that brings regional expertise direct to our clients operations without the need to source from multiple vendors. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Regional Manager, Robotic Solutions (Product Marketing & Product Management)

Job Summary
As Product Manager manage Robotics BU in product marketing to effectively ensure achievement of business plan/set target objective in terms of sales, profitability, and sustainability.
Responsible for managing and implementing marketing activities through strategics plan, research, and action plan implementation.
Ensure adherence to set systems thereby ensuring a professional approach to entire robot business activity.
Key Accountabilities

1. Marketing:
Formulate efficient & intuitive Go-to-market strategy for sales with Robotics BU management.
Market research including competitors’ info and customer’s feedback on our products features/improvements etc. back to RHQ & HQ.
Marketing tools preparation (product presentations, success cases, videos, demo units, websites …)
Event management (Seminars, webinars, exhibitions, road shows etc.) with robot country teams and Brand & communication (B&C)
Marketing collateral based on industry strategy.
2. Digital Marketing:
Digital Campaigns, Integrated marking communications, Robotics website updates with B&C team etc. Write copy for diverse marketing distributions (brochures, press releases, linked-in articles, success stories, website material etc.)
3. Product Management:
New product launches, Product EOL communication, Demo Kits for market (Exhibition, partners, end customer)
4. Price management:
Setting prices at regional level and country level, Loading same into the systems, Special price requests to Japan, price approval with internal forms & systems.
5. Budget management:
Working with Managers for budget preparation & system entry, Sales gap analysis and forecast every quarter & monthly monitoring against plan. Confirm the budget plan data entry & report to managers periodically.
6. Conduct market research and analysis to evaluate trends, brand awareness and competition ventures. Preparation of monthly marketing, sales reports etc.

7. People management – 2-3 teams of admin and marketing members to be managed smoothly.

Key Job Requirements Job / Skills Competencies
Creative, Innovative & Challenge driven.
Industrial Robot knowledge and experience will be an added advantage.
Excellent communication, commercial skills, People skills & Team working culture.
Project Management; Able to relate & close working with various internal, external stakeholders.
Good understanding of market research techniques, data analysis and statistics methods
Knowledge of strategic planning and marketing best practices
Familiar with digital marketing, social media, and web analytics
Proficient in MS Office and marketing software (e.g., CRM, SAP)
Willing to travel 30-40% regionally.
Critical Work Experience
At least 3-5 years of product manager experience on the job preferably robotics/automation multinational company experience
Qualifications
Bachelor of Engineering in Mechanical/ Robotics & Automation/Electronics/Mechatronics. MBA (Marketing Management/Digital Marketing/Business Administration) will be an added advantage.

title: Product Sales Specialist - Data Center Networking Strategic Sales
company_info: CISCO SYSTEMS (USA) PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Yare an expert sales professional who wants to join an industry-leading solution sales team at the world’s top networking company. The Global Data Center Networking strategic sales organization seeks a premier and motivated Product Sales Specialist to help drive the most strategic portions of our Data Center Networking portfolio.
This inlcudes our world-class software solutions like Nexus Dashboard, our industry-leading Fibre Channel SAN offerings as well as our best-in-class Ultra Low Latency products.
Who You'll Work With
You will be paired with a technical solutions architect and work very closely with customers, internal Cisco sales teams, partner teams and our own cisco product/engineering teams.
We provide customer feedback and direction to engineering and product management. We help our sales force, partners, and customers stay up to date on the latest product enhancements, as well as understand the value, and opportunities that come with the most complete and advanced networking products in the industry.
Who You Are
You love a challenge and want to drive compelling customer outcomes. You're a thinker, a creator, a leader, a maker. You are a quota-carrying overachiever who consistently delivers against your forecast and goals. Landing a new customer and closing the big deal is what you wake up for every day and you want to be part of an amazing, high-energy, rapidly growing business at Cisco.
If the above gets you excited, you have a deep sales background with strong product positioning expertise and exceptional closing skills, as well as a positive, hard-working attitude, then Cisco Data Center Networking is where you should be.
Required Skills:
Strong networking background leading large, complex, technology sales requiring C-level executive support
Consistent track record with Financial Services firms, especially High-Frequency Trading environments
Carried a quota and consistently met/exceeded your forecast and goal
Experience working in an overlay sales role, or are open to it
Experience selling through channel partners
You are efficient selling remotely or in-persona and traveling up to 20% of the time
Desired Skills:
8+ years selling Software solutions for the Data Center
Direct sales/account management experience at Cisco, or one of our partners or competitors
Strong working knowledge of the Data Center networking marketplace
Strong working knowledge of the Storage Area Networking marketplace
Strong working knowledge of the networking needs of Financial Services organizations
Why Cisco
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re currently the 6th largest software company in the world!
Beyond that...we're a leading security company, a blockchain company, an AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us into a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!
Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
In charge of a dynamic digital SoC design team that develops state-of-the art video processing, neural processing, advanced video analytics accelerators, and the entire Camera Processor SoC.
Leading the team to explore, evaluate and define innovative SoC architectures, to meet or exceed the technical requirements of the SoC.
Responsible for the successful implementation of the designs in Verilog/SystemVerilog coding, metrics measurement to meet key objectives and follow-through in comprehensive verifications to successful silicon.
Lead IC design team to execute chip design projects from definition to on-time high quality tapeouts.
Work with cross functional teams for analog IP design, physical design, packaging design, test engineering, QA, toolchain, and SDK etc by resolving conflicts and reaching resolutions for mass production.
Manage technical requirements and effective resource allocation.
Assist software team in completing pre-silicon FPGA verification and post-silicon validation.
Enforce and constantly refresh solid design and verification methodology to team members.
Perform effective design and test plan reviews at both module and chip level.
Requirements
Strong knowledge in chip-level technical project management
SoC architecture and design, and RTL coding with Verilog/SystemVerilog
Work experience in ARM and/or RISC-V processor system
Work experience in EDA flow, especially in Synthesis/STA SDC constraints on chip level
Work experience in analysis of power, timing and area
At least one of scripting languages (e.g. Perl, Python, TCL, or Bash)
Disciplined, quality-minded, and highly driven for excellence
Work experience in always-on system, automotive system, secured system, bus interconnect, neural processing, video processing and video analytics is a plus
Experience in system modelling and simulation using emulator and SystemC is a plus
At least Bachelor degree in electrical engineering or computer engineering with > 10 years of relevant technical expertise
Passionate and strong in general programming is a plus
Desired Skills: Electrical Design, Video Analytics, Architects, Electrical, PLC, UVM, Good Communication Skills, Video Processing, AutoCAD, Team Player, Manufacturing, Electrical Engineering, Layout, CAD, Electronics, Commissioning

title: Sr. Manager, New Product Development, BK, APAC
company_info: Burger King Worldwide, Inc. is the second largest fast food hamburger chain and one of the most recognizable and respected brand names in the world. The BURGER KING® system operates in nearly 13,000 locations serving more than 11 million guests every day in 86 countries and territories worldwide. The Company remains headquartered in Miami, FL, where it was founded in 1954 as the original HOME OF THE WHOPPER®. In 2010, 3G Capital, a multi-billion dollar global investment firm focused on long-term value creation, purchased Burger King® and later returned the chain to the New York Stock Exchange with the stock ticker BKW. At Burger King Worldwide, our vision – to be the most profitable QSR business, through a strong franchise system and great people, serving the best burgers in the world – and our values – Bold, Accountable, Empowered, Meritocratic and Fun – are the foundation of the work we do every day.
