title: Scrum Master / Project Manager (IT)
company_info: The Software Practice is a technology company based in Singapore that builds software applications for clients as well as for its own business. Our core strength is in building large and complex web and mobile applications. We’re a full service development firm who’ve launched several products working with clients from an idea to a prototype to production with real world users. In the past, we’ve built applications that have been used by hundreds of thousands of users. Our expertise lies in being able to architect stable, highly scalable and performant platforms for web and mobile applications. Our clients range from small start-ups looking to build and launch their product from scratch to a critical internal applications for Government organizations(like DSTA - the Defence Science and Technology Agency and BCA - the Building Construction Authority of Singapore).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a product manager who sits at the crossroads of business, technology and end-user experience.
You’ll take ownership of a number of delivery engagements at TSP and be involved in the entire project lifecycle, from helping the client define the vision of the product, to ensuring pixel perfect design before launch. You’ll work with our team of engineers and designers, along with the client, to iterate and drive the product from initial scope to production.
Our ideal candidate should have a strong business acumen and moderate to advanced knowledge in information technology (IT) related domains.
Responsibilities
Perform needs assessment by running requirements gathering workshops with business owners, users and client IT departments.
Analyse and model business processes and create detailed and clear documentation (pitch decks, functional specifications etc) that are easy to understand.
Author and review documents, closely track timelines and manage different stakeholders to ensure project gets delivered on time.
Design workflows and experiences that can solve complex user problems (not graphic design - but user experience design in the form of wireframes, user-flow diagrams and so on).
Develop and run roadmaps and sprints to manage traffic for multiple projects at once.
Conduct daily/weekly meetings with development, design and QA teams to monitor progress, clarify scope, remove blockers and set direction.
Clearly communicate project status to clients and management.
Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the management team.
Requirements
Minimum 3 years experience as a Project Manager/Scrum Master with a track record of having delivered software projects successfully (Preferably in greenfield implementations of software systems).
Diploma/Degree in Computer Science, Infocomm Technology, Computer Engineering or related subject area with excellent academic records or demonstrable evidence of personal achievement.
A keen interest in software (web and mobile apps) is a must.
You must be able to set and define systems and processes to deliver end-product with meticulous attention to detail.
You must have excellent communication and should be able to work well with multiple groups and levels in TSP and our clients’ organisations. You must be able to write clearly and concisely.
You must understand nuances in implementation approaches and be able to make sensible trade offs along the way to ensure high product quality and on-time delivery
You should have good design sensibilities
Experience working with Singapore Government would be a plus.
If you are interested in joining us, kindly submit your application via https://thesoftwarepractice.freshteam.com/jobs/ld556QAii9lk/scrum-master-consultant-software-delivery

title: Channel Account Manager (IT Industry)
company_info: ACA Pacific Technology is an established IT Marketing and Value-Added Distribution Company since 1986. Serving the Asia-Pacific region for more than 20 years, our forte is in selecting and integrating the "Best-of-Breed" software and hardware to meet changing business dynamics. With our committment to drive business values to our partners, ACA provides unparallel levels of channel sales and marketing support and constantly engages the world's top IT manufacturers and developers in the technology arena. Our product and services offering includes; - Business and Imaging Solutions - Design Automation Solutions - Media and Entertainment Solutions - Creative Finishing Solutions - Enterprise Security and Networking Solutions - Enterprise Storage and Backup Solutions - Authorized and Certified Training Centers Today, ACA continues to be a leading dstributor of IT supplies in Asia, with an extensive network of over 800 trained and certified channel partners offering an extensive range of integrated solutions, products and professional services in Singapore, Australia, Malaysia, Indonesia and Thailand.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are seeking a Channel Account Manager to join our dynamic team in the fast-paced IT industry. As a Channel Account Manager, you will play a vital role in establishing and nurturing strong relationships with our channel partners to drive sales, increase market share, and achieve business objectives. Your focus will be on managing and expanding our channel network to maximize revenue and create mutually beneficial partnerships.

Responsibilities:
1. Channel Partner Management:
o Develop and maintain strategic relationships with existing channel partners, such as value-added resellers (VARs), system integrators, and distributors.

o Collaborate with partners to align business goals, establish joint business plans, and drive mutual growth.

o Provide regular training, enablement, and support to partners to enhance their product knowledge and capabilities.

2. Sales and Revenue Generation:
o Work closely with channel partners to identify sales opportunities, develop sales pipelines, and close deals.

o Collaborate with internal sales teams to ensure effective lead management and seamless handover of opportunities.

3. Channel Development and Expansion:
o Identify and recruit new channel partners to expand market reach and coverage.

o Conduct thorough evaluations to assess potential partners, considering their expertise, market presence, and alignment with company values.

o Provide ongoing support and resources to enable partners to effectively promote and sell the company's IT products and solutions.

4. Collaboration and Communication:
o Foster strong cross-functional relationships with internal teams, including sales, marketing, product management, and support.

o Collaborate with marketing teams to develop channel-specific marketing campaigns, collateral, and promotional materials.

o Communicate regularly with channel partners to provide updates, share information, and promptly address any concerns or issues.

o Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and conferences to enhance brand visibility and strengthen partner relationships.

Requirements:
· Experience in a Sales Role or similar role within the IT industry is advantageous.

· Demonstrated track record of achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth through channel partnerships.

· Strong understanding of channel management strategies, partner ecosystems, and indirect sales models in the IT industry.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence at all levels.

· Solid negotiation and problem-solving abilities to address partner challenges and resolve conflicts.

· Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret market data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.

· Proactive and results-oriented, with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.

· Familiarity with IT products, solutions, and industry trends.

· Willingness to travel as needed to meet with partners, attend industry events, and visit customers.

Join our innovative team and be part of the IT industry's transformation. Apply now and contribute to our success as a Channel Account Manager.

Fresh Graduates are welcome to apply.

title: Demand Program Manager, Google Workspace - Singapore
company_info: GOOGLE ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
PRODUCT AREA
The web is what you make of it and our team is helping the world make more of the web. From open-source pros to user-experience extraordinaires, we develop products that help users connect, communicate and collaborate with others. Our consumer products and cloud platforms are giving millions of users at homes, businesses, universities and nonprofits around the world the tools that shape their web experience -- and changing the way they think about computing.
JOB DESCRIPTION
ADDITIONAL JOB DESCRIPTION
The Google Cloud organization works with companies to make them more productive, mobile, and collaborative. The Google Cloud SMB sales team focuses on selling at scale to the lower end of the market - a critical segment that delivers a significant proportion of total business.
The SMB GWS Programs team plays a critical role in defining and driving strategic and operational initiatives for SMB across Cloud, working in partnership with Marketing, Product, Finance, Sales Operations, and our regional sales teams. We are a high-impact team working on a range of critical projects to supercharge the GWS business. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing strategies to attract new customers in your region in close partnership with regional marketing.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead inbound demand generation efforts for the region, from optimizing existing campaigns/programs and channels (e.g., Events, Contact Sales) to developing new initiatives to increase top of funnel demand, driving significant QSOs, and pipeline growth.
Own the touched demand funnel and drive conversion rate improvements by analyzing and optimizing across people, processes, and systems to improve business outcomes.
Drive the rhythm of the business, leading regular reviews to discuss demand forecast verus targets between sales, marketing, and partner teams in each region.
Lead outbound demand generation by developing impactful campaigns, call cadences and enablement for the Sales developer team, working in close collaboration with RevX and Sales on messaging and business plays.
Identify risks and issues that preclude the team from hitting OKRs and raise with RevX, Marketing, and Sales Operations teams to resolve.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in strategy, marketing, operations, program management, product management, or consulting at a high tech company.
Experience with tracking marketing campaigns and CRM systems (Marketo, Salesforce).
Experience with data analysis, business case development, and financial modeling.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in a SaaS/IaaS/PaaS company, focused on growth.
Experience with project management in initiating and executing complex, cross-functional projects with minimal guidance.
Ability to influence executive level cross-functional stakeholders, and achieve key targets and metrics in a team environment.
Intermediate/advanced SQL skills.

title: Relationship Manager, Priority Clients
company_info: Singapore Standard Chartered Bank in Singapore is part of an international banking group, with more than 150 years of history in some of the world’s most dynamic markets. Our purpose is to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, and our heritage and values are expressed in our brand promise, Here for good. The Bank has a history of over 160 years in Singapore, where we opened our first branch in 1859. In October 1999, we were among the first international banks to receive a Qualifying Full Bank (QFB) licence, an endorsement of the Group’s longstanding commitment to our business in the country. Singapore is home to the majority of our global business leadership, our technology operations, as well as SC Ventures, our innovation hub. In 2013, the Bank transferred our Singapore Retail and SME businesses to a locally incorporated subsidiary, Standard Chartered Bank (Singapore) Limited (“SCBSL”). And in May 2019, we fully consolidated our business operations in Singapore through the transfer of our Commercial Banking, Corporate & Institutional Banking and Private Banking businesses to SCBSL. SCBSL is one of the highest-rated banks globally: A1/Stable by Moody’s Investor Services, A/Stable by Standard & Poor’s and A+/Stable by Fitch Ratings. In August 2020, we were the first and only bank to be awarded the “Significantly Rooted Foreign Bank” (SRFB) status by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. In December 2020, we were granted enhanced SRFB privileges, in recognition of the significantly higher degree of rootedness exceeding the SRFB baseline criteria.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Role Responsibilities
The purpose of the role is to
· Maximize new business/acquisition/referral opportunities and deepening existing customer relationships to the specified service standards for the Priority Clients segment
Implementation and oversight of the below individual responsibilities:
· To conduct a professional, consultative financial analysis and profiling session with customers to meet their financial needs/objectives.
· To foster and deepen customer relationships by providing regular market information updates and trend analysis on local and international financial products.
· In consultation with the PB team manager/ branch manager/ PTL, draw up monthly plans for achieving/exceeding sales targets to meet new business and customer acquisition goals
· To participate in marketing and promotional activities for customer acquisition.
· To source and call on individual prospects
· To provide quality, efficient after-sales services
· To manage anti-attrition and retention of clients
· To organise and conduct sales presentations to groups, clubs, associations, companies and other organisations.
· To solicit referrals from other parts of SCB eg. RMs from C&I, staff, etc.
· To comply with all applicable money laundering prevention procedures and in particular, report any suspicious activity to the Transaction Monitoring Unit.
· To ensure compliance with all regulations and controls as set by the Bank and external regulatory authorities.
Strategy
· Responsibilities that are related to the development and implementation of a strategy, for example, Awareness and understanding of the Group’s business strategy and model appropriate to the role.
Business
· Responsibilities related to the delivery of business and/or financial objectives.
Processes
· Reference the processes for which the Role Holder is responsible, as per the Operational Risk Framework definition of first / second line.
People & Talent
· Responsibilities that are related to the development and implementation of a strategy, for example, Awareness and understanding of the Group’s business strategy and model appropriate to the role.
Risk Management
· Responsibilities relating to identifying, assessing, monitoring, controlling and mitigating risks to the Group, as well as an awareness and understanding of the main risks facing the Group and the role the individual plays in managing them.
Governance
· Responsibilities relating to the direction, planning, structure, frameworks (e.g. processes and policies) and oversight.
Regulatory & Business Conduct
· Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
· Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
· Lead the team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles. Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment.
· Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key stakeholders
· Cluster Heads, Product Managers, STMs and etc.
Our Ideal Candidate
· RNF & CFMAS Certificates
· 3 years of experience in Wealth Management
· Graduate / Diploma
Role Specific Technical Competencies
· Client Acquisition Experience
· Account Management (of HNW Individuals) Experience
· Technical knowledge and expertise in consumer banking products (i.e. Treasury, Equities, Funds, Insurance, etc.)
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:
· Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
· Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
· Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
· Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations
· Time-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum
· Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns
· Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
· A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning
· Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

title: Product Manager
company_info: Aiken was founded under the belief that a world where all companies have access and usability of deep technology is better than a world without. Today, Aiken is actively developing technology solutions powered by AI to ignite a new generation of growth for companies.Harnessing both creativity and tech, this powers our 3 key business units of Creative Campaigns, Platform integration and bespoke AI & Data products. We have an extensive list of clients such as Mastercard, Shiseido, Bvlgari, Amway, Finnair, Huawei, Tencent. With strong vertical expertise in travel, beauty, luxury and technology.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a versatile Product Manager who can efficiently handle multiple responsibilities within our organization. In this role, you will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to development, launch, and growth, while also managing client relationships and overseeing project execution. Your ability to balance these responsibilities will be vital in delivering exceptional customer experiences, achieving project objectives, and driving overall product success. Previous experience in the finance sector is preferred, as it brings valuable insights and expertise to the role.
You will embark on a wide-ranging journey, immersing yourself in a diverse array of industries. This expansive exploration will allow you to delve deep into their inner workings, fully immersing yourself in their processes, all while pioneering innovative product offerings.

Product Strategy
Develop a comprehensive product strategy and roadmap aligned with the company's overall vision and objectives.
Identify market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape to drive product innovation and differentiation.
Product Development
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, and marketing, to define product requirements, prioritize features, and deliver high-quality releases.
Drive the end-to-end product development process, from ideation to launch, ensuring timely delivery within budget and scope.
Product Launch and Adoption
Develop go-to-market strategies and collaborate with marketing and sales teams to drive product adoption and revenue growth.
Create product documentation, sales enablement materials, and training resources to ensure successful product launches and customer onboarding.
Client Management
Build and maintain strong relationships with our clients, ensuring their satisfaction, and driving revenue growth.
Utilize exceptional communication and organizational skills to understand client needs, manage expectations, and deliver exceptional service.
Thrive in a fast-paced environment, taking a proactive approach and demonstrating strategic thinking.
Market Research
Conduct market research and competitive analysis to gain insights into customer needs, industry trends, and emerging technologies.
Utilize market knowledge to inform product decisions, identify new market opportunities, and drive product enhancements.
Customer Focus
Act as the customer advocate and champion, continuously gathering customer feedback and understanding their pain points.
Translate customer insights into actionable product improvements and enhancements to maximize customer satisfaction and retention.
Analytics and Performance Tracking
Define key product metrics and implement analytics tools to measure product performance, usage, and customer satisfaction.
Leverage data-driven insights to identify areas for improvement and make informed product decisions.
Collaboration and Leadership
Foster a collaborative and cross-functional work environment, effectively communicating product vision, priorities, and goals to stakeholders at all levels.

Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree/Diploma in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
At least 5 years of full-time, product management experience in digital/technology fields.
Experience with loyalty programs/gamification/platforms services is an advantage.
Excellent communications and presentation skills with proficiency in both written and spoken English.
Excellent strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
Solid project management abilities with a track record of successfully delivering complex projects on time.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence without direct authority.
Strong customer focus with the ability to empathize with user needs.
Data-driven mindset with proficiency in analytics tools and metrics tracking.
Fluent in Mandarin or at least be able to speak Mandarin, writing is optional.

title: Product Manager
company_info: Tech Data connects the world with the power of technology. Our end-to-end portfolio of products, services and solutions, highly specialized skills, and expertise in next-generation technologies enable channel partners to bring to market the products and solutions the world needs to connect, grow and advance. Tech Data is ranked No. 83 on the Fortune 500® and has been named one of Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies for 10 straight years. To find out more, visit www.techdata.com or follow us on Twitter, and Facebook.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose:
The Product Manager has overall responsibility for achieving the sales and profit targets for the related product groups and creating the highest return for both Tech Data and the vendor. While responsible for revenue outcomes, this is a sales enablement position. This will be achieved through marketing programs, sales training, sales support, technical pre-sales support, vendor contract and vendor relationship. These activities, especially sales and marketing are targeted at both the Tech Data extended sales team and the partner community.
Responsibilities:
Creation of business plans for the vendor product group and associated services.
Development and implementation of sales enablement programs for Tech Data and partners.
Ensure that the technical sales support teams are appropriately trained to support the relevant product groups.
Development and implementation of marketing programs to support product group objectives.
Creation of joint initiatives with our vendor and business partners.
Responsible for effective planning, including inventory turns, inventory fulfillment and inventory obsolescence minimisation.
Implementation of business plans that achieve agreed vendor revenue targets and generate the planned profit outcomes.
Achievement of revenue plans by brand and by market segment.
Coordinate the various functions within Tech Data in order to deliver the outcomes agreed in each product plan.
Ensure that executive business relations with vendor partners are of the highest order, are proactive and that the engagement is continually monitored so that new initiatives can be introduced as required.
Maintenance and development of operational level vendor relationships.
In order to execute product leadership it will be necessary to maintain knowledge of sales processes, proposals, pipeline management, partner engagement so that remedial actions can be recommended where necessary.
Ensuring highest and continuously improving levels of vendor and partner satisfaction.
Maintain a high level of safety awareness within your team to promote a safe working environment for all team members.
Maintenance of an accurate pipeline by product group.
Measurement and maintenance of critical product group performance data in order to ensure that Tech Data meets its vendor commitments and fully leverages all commercial opportunities for rebates and other vendor investment initiatives.
Business forecasting and business planning for product groups with vendors.
Provision of various reports for the purposes of commercial decision making.
Be the advocate and leader for the relevant product groups in Tech Data and be the advocate and leader for Tech Data within the relevant vendor community.
Provide direction, development and support to ensure the sales team is performing at optimum levels for the relevant product group. This will require a close working relationship with the Channels Sales Director.
Deal effectively and efficiently with unsatisfactory performance and/or behaviour within your team.
Provide an appropriate example of leadership, by way of behaviours, to the wider organization.
Proactively contribute as a member of the leadership team to the commercial ‘well-being’ and longevity of the business.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
Minimum 4-6 years experience within IT distribution
Minimum education level required is a Bachelor’s Degree
Appropriate vendor product sales certifications
Strong leadership attributes
Self-starter
Results focused
Sound business acumen
Ability to work with little direction
Capacity to lead vertial teams
Influence business outcomes without having direct control

description:

Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices, including Mountain View, Seattle Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. Join us.
The SG product team will focus on implementing user privacy control and data control, identifying the relevant opportunity areas, prioritizing the privacy problems we must to solve, and rapidly creating innovative user experience solutions.

-Work directly with engineers, designers, and data analysts to deliver the privacy features.
-Advising on new feature development and product roadmaps.
Qualifications
-3+ years of experience with user experience design
-3+ years of product management experience build privacy features and platforms at a consumer or entertainment company

title: Lead Quantitative Researcher - Product Management
company_info: No information added.
address: The Working Capitol, 1 Keong Saik Road 089109
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As a Lead Quantitative Researcher, you will partner with and support the wider Product Management organization across all verticals. You will play a vital role in the product development lifecycle of new products and the continuous improvement of current products.
This position is an excellent opportunity for someone with an analytical and entrepreneurial spirit that is passionate about building innovative products, specifically in the digital asset trading space, and what cryptocurrencies and blockchain can do for the financial services industry as a whole.

Responsibilities:
· Conduct research and analysis: Perform in-depth research and analysis of market structure, digital asset data, order flow, and other relevant factors to identify patterns, trends, and insights that can aid in product definition.
· Develop quantitative models: Design and implement sophisticated quantitative models and algorithms to evaluate and predict market behavior, liquidity dynamics, price impact, risk management dynamics and other key variables in the digital asset markets.
· Product development: support the Product Management organization in developing complex product specs and creating buy-in for the product vision both internally (including c-level executives) and with key external partners.
· Product management: similar to all members of the Product Management team, be involved in defining & monitoring product success metrics, creation of Sales team enablement artifacts and other Bullish product explainers (i.e. turning complex into consumable).
· Read and comprehend academic papers: Stay abreast of the latest academic research and industry publications in the field of digital assets and related areas. Analyze and understand complex mathematical models and concepts presented in these papers.
· Explain research findings to a non-mathematical audience: Translate complex academic research and quantitative models into easily understandable explanations for non-mathematically trained stakeholders and clients. Effectively communicate the implications and practical applications of the research findings.
· Data analysis and visualization: Utilize advanced statistical techniques and data visualization tools to analyze large datasets and communicate complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.
· Stay updated with industry trends: Monitor and keep up-to-date with the latest advancements in the digital asset / blockchain ecosystem. Identify emerging opportunities and refine existing strategies.
· Documentation and reporting: Document research methodologies, findings, and results accurately and concisely, and present them to internal stakeholders and clients in a clear and coherent manner.
· Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
· Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or related disciplines. A Ph.D. is highly desirable.
· Proven experience in quantitative research and analysis working alongside a Product Management team, preferably in the field of digital assets and/or financial services.
· Experience working with an Engineering team building innovative financial products.
· Strong knowledge of financial markets, derivatives, and risk management.
· Proficiency in statistical modeling and data analysis techniques, including time series analysis, regression analysis, machine learning, and optimization methods.
· Comfortable working in a dynamic organization where priorities can change frequently.
· Experience working in a distributed organization.
· Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively present complex concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Extra Points:
· You bring a problem solving mindset to the table at all times! No problem is too big.
· In depth knowledge of blockchain technology, cryptocurrencies, automated market makers (AMMs) and digital asset exchanges (CEX and DEX).
· Experience in portfolio risk modeling and/or structured product pricing.
· Passion for the digital asset industry, a proactive approach to learning, and a keen interest in staying up-to-date with the latest trends and developments.

title: TikTok LIVE Product Manager - Traffic & Ecosystem - Content Strategy
company_info: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

About the team
TikTok LIVE is committed to creating real-time interactive scenes, As a new form of content, livestream creates value for all parties in the ecology. Livestream provides users with a unique consumption experience and further generalizes content. It is also a new way of employment to provide more direct fan interaction and deepen relationships with authors; It provides healthy and objective revenue to the platform and promotes content exclusivity. It also serves as a "new infrastructure" for the expansion of ecological boundaries.

Responsibilities:
1. Develop strategies to control negative content, with a focus on identifying and defining negative content. Utilize data analysis and user feedback to configure strategies that ensure content quality and user experience on the platform.
2. Conduct in-depth research on the definition and expectations for governing negative content. Understand user aversion and dissatisfaction towards negative content. Utilize various signals to identify the root causes of negative content and propose solutions.
3. Lead related product design and collaborate across teams, working closely with operations, R&D, design, and other roles to drive project implementation and achieve business objectives. Understand content publishing, content moderation, and traffic distribution processes comprehensively, identify key issues, set phase-wise traffic adjustment goals, implement effective strategies, and continuously enhance the user experience.
4. Optimize content recommendations from the perspective of negative content, making the trending recommended content more relevant to general users, reducing the display of low-quality or negative content, and increasing user satisfaction.
5. Responsible for building the infrastructure related to content quality and recommendation optimization, including traffic issue detection systems, user understanding tools, content comprehension platforms, and ensuring the efficient operation of these infrastructures.

Job Requirements:
- Bachelor's degree or above, preferably in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, with 3 years or more experience in user-side product management, including experience in platform and strategic product backgrounds, with a preference for experience in traffic strategy and creator strategy.
- Possess excellent product design and business understanding skills. Capable of identifying and driving solutions to problems through data or processes.
- Familiar with content governance strategies and content recommendation, with a deep understanding of controlling negative content.
- Demonstrated sense of responsibility for content quality control and recommendation optimization. Able to think from a user's perspective and provide solutions.
- Demonstrated project management and ability to handle pressure. Capable of understanding various stakeholders' needs and integrating resources to achieve cross-department cooperation.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

From opening our second flagship showroom in Leng Kee to launching the CUPRA brand in Singapore, we are constantly challenging and evolving our business, products, services and customer experience to meet the needs and demands of the modern market. Our range of SEAT cars had received much recognition and accolades from both media and public alike and had consistently been awarded the prestigious car of the year titles by media in Singapore . We are not just a brand but a mobility style full of possibilities. SEAT is a commitment to get closer to the mobility of the future, a mobility for everyone. This includes the New Leon redesigned, the New Ateca and our electrifying range of electric and hybrid vehicles. About CUPRA Cupra Racing, formerly known as SEAT Sport, is the high-performance motorsport subsidiary of the Spanish automobile manufacturer SEAT, founded in 1985,succeeding the "SEAT Special Vehicles department" which had been formed in 1971 with the mission to enforce the brand's participation in rally championships, followed by 11 titles between 1979 and 1983.It has competed in rallying and touring car racing, and also develops high performance versions of road cars.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.
Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 3. Work closely with cross-functional team including partnership teams and engineers to introduce data and service, and scale capability across international businesses.

title: Product Executive
company: TECH DATA ADVANCED SOLUTIONS (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: Tech Data connects the world with the power of technology. Our end-to-end portfolio of products, services and solutions, highly specialized skills, and expertise in next-generation technologies enable channel partners to bring to market the products and solutions the world needs to connect, grow and advance. Tech Data is ranked No. 83 on the Fortune 500® and has been named one of Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies for 10 straight years.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose:

The Product Executive has overall responsibility to support the Product Manager for achieving the sales and profit targets for the related product groups and creating the highest return for both Tech Data and the vendor. While responsible for revenue outcomes, this is a sales enablement position. This will be achieved through marketing programs, sales training, sales support, technical pre-sales support, vendor contract and vendor relationship. These activities, especially sales and marketing are targeted at both the Tech Data extended sales team and the partner community.

Responsibilities:
Implementation of sales enablement programs for Tech Data and partners.
Implementation of marketing programs to support product group objectives.
Execution of joint initiatives with our vendor and business partners.
Responsible for inventory turns, inventory fulfillment and inventory obsolescence minimization.
Implementation of business plans that achieve agreed vendor revenue targets and generate the planned profit outcomes.
Achievement of revenue plans by brand and by market segment.
Coordinate the various functions within Tech Data in order to deliver the outcomes agreed in each product plan.
Maintenance and development of operational level vendor relationships.
In order to execute product leadership it will be necessary to maintain knowledge of sales processes, proposals, pipeline management, partner engagement so that remedial actions can be recommended where necessary.
Ensuring highest and continuously improving levels of vendor and partner satisfaction.
Maintain a high level of safety awareness within your team to promote a safe working environment for all team members.
Maintenance of an accurate pipeline by product group.
Measurement and maintenance of critical product group performance data in order to ensure that Tech Data meets its vendor commitments and fully leverages all commercial opportunities for rebates and other vendor investment initiatives.
Supporting Product Manager in business forecasting and business planning for product groups with vendors.
Provision of various reports for the purposes of commercial decision making.
Deal effectively and efficiently with unsatisfactory performance and/or behaviour within your team.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
Minimum 1-3 years experiences within IT distribution
Minimum education level required is a Bachelor’s Degree
Appropriate vendor product sales certifications will be an advantages
Self-starter
Results focused
Sound business acumen
Ability to work with little direction
Influence business outcomes without having direct control

title: Production Engineer

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Evaluation of 2D drawings on welding requirements, suitable weld symbols, weld specification and standards, and feasibility of welding corresponds to the weld symbols.
Manage and lead a team of Welder/Fitters including Team Leaders to manufacture, assemble and build Land Systems specialist welded components and assemblies, using engineering drawings and associated design data to meet the business and customer expectations.
Supervise and give guidance to operators and ensure build, configuration and quality standards are maintained.
Ensure welding and production processes and procedures are maintained as per the drawings and work Instructions.
Take a lead in continuous improvements to include lean and 5s procedures, ensuring a clean and compliant work area is maintained at all times.
Ensure equipment and tooling required is available and maintained.
Lead production meetings in support of planning & production Managers.
Support the Manager, ensuring that all projects are delivered on time, within budget and to the highest quality standard.
Train and conduct Weld test for welders based on standards and maintain records.
Determine the skill level of the welders based on the weld test and train them for additional skills.
Train and develop new talents on specific weld skills.
Welding inspection and review of products based on drawing specifications.
Test and determine parameters for various welding such as spot welding & Robot welding, stud welding, etc.
Define and develop the welding program on Robot welding.
Define weld sequence and study distortion, assist on the production floor.
Prepare welding work Instruction based on the 2D drawings for production use.
Review the capabilities of current welding equipment and recommendations for new welding technologies and equipment.
Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least Diploma or Degree in Engineering (Mechanical).
Familiar in reading 2D drawings with weld symbols both AWS and ISO standard.
Able to understand weld specification and requirements from drawings.
Relevant experience in Sheet Metal industry preferred.
Proven ability to lead and motivate a team to deliver the highest standards of quality and performance
IT skills, including Microsoft Word and Excel along with a knowledge and interest in emerging technologies.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact with people from all levels.
Dynamic and proactive attitude.
Certified AWS Welding Inspector (CWI) preferred.
Knowledge in preparing welding PQR & WPS.
Familiar in Robotic laser welding and processes preferred.
Independent worker who is able to work well with minimal supervision.

title: Product Specialist
company_info: Infck Technology Pte. Ltd is a Singapore-based provider of IoT digital smart solutions with over 8 years of industry experience. Our team comprises highly skilled professionals and cutting-edge technologies, enabling us to deliver end-to-end solutions for the iFM and Smart building sectors. Our Infodeck solution encompasses IoT platform and data insights, CMMS (work order system), EAM (Asset management), QR code-based Feedback and Survey system, Smart Workflow Engine for automation, EdgeGO (Edge computing with machine learning), and a mobile app for work order assignment. From design and development to integration, we strive to create efficient, secure, and productive environments for our clients. We demonstrate our commitment to quality through ISO 27001 and SOC2 certifications, ensuring the highest level of security for our services. As active members of industry-related organizations like SGBC and Smart Nation, we stay at the forefront of advancements. Leveraging our expertise in data analytics, machine learning, and AI, we develop innovative solutions like predictive maintenance and smart O&M, enabling our clients to enhance their operations. At Infodeck, we are passionate about utilizing technology to make our clients' operations more efficient, future-proof, and sustainable, ultimately delivering exceptional value to our clients.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Product/Solution Specialist - Infodeck Technology

We are seeking a specialist in product management to report to the Solutions Manager at Infodeck Technology. The incumbent shall be responsible for product design, requirements gathering, and collaborating with programmers for managing milestones and product revisions.

Requirements:
To be a successful Product Specialist at Infodeck Technology, you will need excellent communication and organizational skills. You must also have an aptitude for understanding customer needs and a passion for product development. In addition, you should possess the following qualifications:

- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent experience
- At least 1 year of professional experience in a product or software engineering role
- Knowledge of agile methodology and software development processes
- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
- Excellent problem-solving abilities
- Having experience with a Building Management System is advantageous
- Having experience with the Internet of Things (IoT) can be an advantage
- Having prior experience in LPWAN and a mind for integration is an advantageous attribute for this position
- Experience with Software as a Service (SaaS)
- Strong attention to detail and data accuracy
- Experience in developing user/customer-facing web applications is preferred
- Excellent presentation skills are crucial for pre-sales and customer training engagements
- Proficient in both English and Mandarin (optional)

Interview process:
Infodeck Technology's interview process is fairly straightforward.

After your resume has been reviewed and you have been invited for an interview, it typically consists of two stages.

The first stage is a phone screen with one of our recruiters. This call will be used to get more familiar with your experience and to answer any questions you may have about our company.

The second stage is an in-person interview with at least two team members, but potentially more depending on the role and the hiring manager's preferences. These interviews are likely to focus on your specific skills, as well as gaining more insight into who you are and what drives you professionally.

Throughout the process, we will ensure that you know exactly what to expect from us. We will keep in communication with you so that we can provide timely feedback and answer any questions you might have about the role or the company itself.

To learn more about Infodeck Technology and our company culture, please visit our website at https://www.infodeck.io.

title: Senior Product Designer
company_info: We live in a fast-paced, highly interconnected world. Technology has transformed the way we live, work, bank and pay. We want to revolutionise banking as we know it today, by leveraging the extensive ecosystems, technology expertise and fintech experiences of our parent companies, Grab and Singtel, to serve everyday consumers and small businesses better. Join us today to empower Southeast Asia's everyday consumers and entrepreneurs.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Life at GXS
We’re living in exciting times. We want to use technology & design to re-think how financial services are offered. Grab and Singapore Telecommunications have secured a digital full banking license in Singapore as a consortium (Grab 60%, Singtel 40%). As Grab and SingTel come together, we have big dreams to unlock the potential of financial inclusion in the region we live in. We want to build a digital bank on the right foundation - using data, tech and trust to solve problems and serve customers. We would love to speak with you if you believe you have what it takes to be at the forefront of innovation to build this new Digibank with us.
We are seeking a new member to join the Design team for our new Digibank initiative in Singapore. This role will be based in Singapore, reporting into a Senior Product Designer for Digibank. This individual will also work closely with the engineering, business, and other stakeholders across Grab and Singtel.

Get to know the Team
We’re a brand new team formed to build up our digital bank.
As part of the Design Team, you will work on some of our highest impact, strategic projects. As we are going from 0 to 1, you will have the opportunity to learn, create and help define the product experience. You will be hands-on with the end-to-end product design process from ideation to delivering the product that the users will use. You’ll also be working collaboratively with other designers, product managers, business teams and other stakeholders throughout the process.
We like creative hustlers, people who can think outside the box, motivate and get stuff done even if it seems impossible. We work fast, push the boundaries, try new things and sometimes they don’t work, so we embrace failure and lifelong learning.

Get to know the Role:
As one of the early members of the GXS design team, you will be owning and shaping the GXS product and design experience for financial products, based on informed design decisions. You will be working closely with product managers, and with guidance from other designers and researchers. You will be responsible for exploring designs that can be used for testing, creating the design artifacts and delivering it to the engineering team for implementation based on the design process established in the team. You will design with user’s in mind, and be able to look further than just crafting in-app experience, but also include experience like how we communicate and support customers when it’s needed.
The day-to-day activities
Work on delivering the banking experience on the GXS mobile app, web platform, and other tools
Work collaboratively with Product Designers, Product Managers, Business Team, Customer Experience Team, and external vendors to deliver the best possible experience, while retaining our brand voice
Design what’s next to be implemented, but also explore ideas on how the product can be in the future.
Planning and participating in ongoing usability testing and assessment.
Conduct desk check of user interface during engineering development phase.
Researching and analyzing industry UX/UI trends and competitor sites and strategies.
Regular review of usage data to analyze user behavior and pain points.
Participating in key internal meetings including weekly status updates and planning sessions
The Must-Haves
2 - 6 years of working experience in UI/UX Design. You have designed mobile apps, websites and wanted to bring your experience & expertise to get a bigger impact & influence. You're passionate on what you're doing
Ability to turn ideas and user journeys into final design that is simple and intuitive, based on research findings and design best practices.
Understanding of user experience design for the web, mobile, or touch devices.
Good eye for visual design and hands-on experience in user interface design.
Experience with current and relevant design tools like Figma, Adobe, ProtoPie among others.
Design with users in mind, based on user researches and insights
You can work independently without too many guidance
You pay attention to details but also can zoom out and think holistically.
You have confidence in your ideas and the ability to communicate them clearly
You put great deal attention in your craft without losing the big picture. You will design the journey and experiences that simple and connected
You're team player and can work with more senior or junior designers
You follow through—when built, your designs actually look and work like they should. You monitor products after launch and are ready to suggest improvements
The Good-to-haves:
Experience in creating and delivering motion design
Experience in financial or tech startup environment
You actively contribute to the design community

title: SENIOR PRODUCT SPECIALIST
company_info: PEOPLESEARCH PTE. LTD. Elevating Careers and Empowering Businesses PeopleSearch is a leading executive search, recruitment and outplacement services firm with a robust presence in 6 Asian cities: Singapore, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Taipei, Tokyo and Kuala Lumpur. We have been elevating careers and empowering businesses for over 20 years. We are committed to helping both candidates and companies achieve their goals in concert with one another, hence our dedication to connecting businesses with high-performing executives who make a transformative impact on the bottom line while realising their own career aspirations. Driving Business Strategies in a Wide Range of Industries Our human capital solutions are predicated on vast experience, the latest market insights, and a repository of sectoral and geographical knowledge. Our extensive network also gives us access to a large pool of candidates, both active and passive, enabling us to acquire the best professionals in a variety of functional roles to drive your business strategies. Our clients comprise multinational corporations, small and medium enterprises and start-ups in a wide range of industries including, but not limited to Technology, Healthcare and Life Sciences, Logistics and Supply Chain Management and Financial Services. An Anticipatory and Bespoke Approach We are with you every step of the way. As advisers and partners, our specialist consultants take an anticipatory approach, designing precise human capital solutions to help you realise your vision and achieve enduring success. Our bespoke solutions ensure you're future-ready and at the forefront of your field in any business environment.

title: Longview Product Owner
company_info: Singapore Standard Chartered Bank in Singapore is part of an international banking group, with more than 150 years of history in some of the world’s most dynamic markets. Our purpose is to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, and our heritage and values are expressed in our brand promise, Here for good. The Bank has a history of over 160 years in Singapore, where we opened our first branch in 1859. In October 1999, we were among the first international banks to receive a Qualifying Full Bank (QFB) licence, an endorsement of the Group’s longstanding commitment to our business in the country. Singapore is home to the majority of our global business leadership, our technology operations, as well as SC Ventures, our innovation hub. In 2013, the Bank transferred our Singapore Retail and SME businesses to a locally incorporated subsidiary, Standard Chartered Bank (Singapore) Limited (“SCBSL”). And in May 2019, we fully consolidated our business operations in Singapore through the transfer of our Commercial Banking, Corporate & Institutional Banking and Private Banking businesses to SCBSL. SCBSL is one of the highest-rated banks globally: A1/Stable by Moody’s Investor Services, A/Stable by Standard & Poor’s and A+/Stable by Fitch Ratings. In August 2020, we were the first and only bank to be awarded the “Significantly Rooted Foreign Bank” (SRFB) status by the Monetary Authority of Singapore. In December 2020, we were granted enhanced SRFB privileges, in recognition of the significantly higher degree of rootedness exceeding the SRFB baseline criteria.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Role Responsibilities
A Bank with a Soul
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.
People & Talent
· Champion and act as a role model of the Group’s values and culture. Lead by example and set the tone and expectations for the team to work collaboratively across all stakeholders / partners.
· Lead and support a change mindset, building a culture of client centricity, agility and accountability through engagement, transparency, openness to new ideas, measurement and metrics.
· Set effective metrics and standards, transparently communicating them to team members, providing feedback and rewarding employees accordingly.
· Ensure team Longview support structure / capacity is reviewed to enable delivery of client outcomes and engage and retain high-quality people in key roles supporting Longview.
· Ensure the design and provision of on-going training & development to the relevant process, change and country teams to ensure they can operate and interact with Longview effectively.
Regulatory & Business Conduct
· Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct.
· Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across the Longview estate. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
· Lead the team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles. Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment.
· Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key stakeholders
· Tax Leadership Team
· Regional / Country CFO
· Regional / Country Tax Leads
· Country Tax Teams
· Tax Process & Change Teams
· Group Tax Reporting Team
· New Financial Reporting Project Steering Committee
· The Finance Forum
· Product Management Team and TTO Leadership
· Group Process Owners
· Functional Partners including Risk, CFCC, HR, Finance, Legal, GIA
Qualifications and certification
· Academic or Professional Education/Qualifications: As per Bank’s requirements and HR policy
· Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or a related field
· Professional Memberships: Association or Discipline Association Membership well regarded.
· Language: Business Communication
Licences and Certifications/accreditations:
· Product Owner certification from Scrum Alliance, Scrum.org or other associations are must
· Practitioner certification of Scaled Agile framework like LeSS, SAFe, Scrum@Scale, Spotify, Nexus and Human Centred Design or Design Thinking are plus.
Our Ideal Candidate
· 8+Years in Finance/ tax & product management.
Role Specific Technical Competencies
· Product / service ownership subject matter expertise
· Product delivery lifecycle experience using Agile Ways of Working (Scrum, Kanban, Lean, etc.)
· Tax reporting and performance management
· Understanding customer / user needs& data driven decision making / product analytics
· Stakeholder management, influence / negotiation, and business communication.
About Standard Chartered
We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.
Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:
· Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
· Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
· Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
· Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations
· Time-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum
· Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns
· Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
· A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning
· Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.
Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

title: Product Engineer (Mechanical)
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the company:
Founded in 1984, AFL is an international manufacturer providing end-to-end solutions to the energy, service provider, enterprise and industrial markets as well as several emerging markets. Our products are in use in over 130 countries and include fiber optic cable and hardware, transmission and substation accessories, outside plant equipment, connectivity, test and inspection equipment, fusion splicers and training. AFL also offers a wide variety of services supporting data center, enterprise, wireless and outside plant applications.

Headquartered in Spartanburg, SC, AFL has operations in the U.S., Mexico, Canada, Europe, Asia and Australia, and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Fujikura Ltd. of Japan.

At AFL, we recognize that our employees are our greatest asset. We hire and train each individual, investing in them to ensure success in their careers. With a commitment to professional development and growth, let us connect you to your next career opportunity.

Job Summary:
As a Product Engineer (Mechanical), you will be responsible for mechanical engineering work for our AFL line of Fiber-Optic telecommunication products (e.g. cable harness and assemblies, connectors, panels, cabinets and accessories). The work-scope product design, check & optimization, integration, industrialization, life-cycle management/sustaining engineering etc.

Key Responsibilities:
Mechanical design and development of product functions and modules to meet user and business requirements, compliance, quality and cost.
Collaborate with various stakeholders such as Quality, Product Management, Solution Engineering, Manufacturing, Supply Chain functions as well as End-user/Customers etc.
Translate “up-stream” user/system requirements as well as applicable industry standards (e.g. IEC, EN, GR) into measurable “down-stream” technical design requirements
Support Commercial/Sales team through generation of concept designs and presentations for pitch to customers
Create product intellectual property and patent submissions
Create test & verification plans for the developed/designed elements and parts
Interface with manufacturing team and/or external suppliers for product industrialization
Support Quality incidents and lead effort in failure analysis/troubleshooting
Develop solution in support of manufacturing & quality improvement
Generate documentation, including engineering reports, BOM, technical drawings, design specifications, installation guides for users etc.

Main Requirements:
At least 3 years of work experience in product engineering design/development and transfer to manufacturing
Bachelor’s in Engineering (Diploma in engineering with at least 5 years’ experience in product engineering design may be considered)
Conversant in both English & Mandarin (spoken and written)
Proficient in CAD Software for 2D drawing and 3D Model application (Solidworks preferred)
Familiar with Product & CAD Lifecycle Management workflow processes and tools (e.g. Solidworks PDM, PTC Windchill etc..)
Conversant with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T) standards (e.g. ASME Y14.5)
Knowledge and competence in stack tolerancing, mechanical design analysis and validation based on theoretical calculation (e.g. stress and deformation)
Knowledge of common industrial plastics, as well as experience in designing parts for plastic injection molding
Knowledge of common industrial metals, as well as experience in designing parts for using standard metal fabrication & forming processes (e.g. CNC machining, sheet metal deep-drawing & stamping)
Knowledge in Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DFM/DFA)
Experience in the following areas will be added advantage: (1) Data-center, or Fiber-Optic telecommunication Cable industry, (2) Design of connectors, cable harness and assemblies, (3) Failure Mode Effect Analysis (FMEA), (4) Knowledge of statistical methods and Six-Sigma techniques (e.g. DOE, GR&R, SPC, Cpk analysis), (5) Finite Element simulation tools (e.g. Solidworks Simulation, ANSYS Mechanical)

Other Important Notes:
This role is based in Singapore AFL office
Candidate is expected to be an independent and pro-active self-starter (e.g. taking initiatives to drive new or improve current way-of-working/processes)
Candidate will be working with a global team (i.e. North and South America, Europe, UK, APAC)
As this role requires frequent interactions with international customer and counterparts, candidate must be able to accommodate work calls and meetings outside normal office hours (due to time-zone differences)
International travel may be required (up to 15% of the time)

Roles & Responsibilities
At Massimo Duttu, our business model is centered in our customers, constantly adapting to their needs. We love what we do. Teamwork, passion, curiosity, diversity, sustainability, creativity, humility, and willing to contribute differently are our daily motivation. Does it sound like you?

Carries out and supervises the proper execution of checkout operations.
Makes sure the team is trained on technological devices and how to use them for all the processes of the customers’ shopping experience.
Is familiar with and uses the RFID operating system, making sure the team is trained.
You should have:
A minimum of two years of experience in a similar position.
Management of sales reports
Customer-focused and desire to be Results-driven

company_info: StarHub is Singapore's fully-integrated info-communications company, offering a full range of information, communications and entertainment services for both consumer and corporate markets. StarHub operates a mobile network that provides 4G, 3G and 2G services. It also manages an islandwide HFC network that delivers multi-channel pay TV services (including HDTV, Internet TV and on-demand services) as well as ultra-high speed residential broadband services. StarHub operates an extensive fixed business network that provides a wide range of data, voice and wholesale services. Over Singapore’s fibre-based Next Generation Nationwide Broadband Network, StarHub offers a broad range of home and business broadband plans along with a host of advanced media-rich value-added services, such as IPTV for commercial entities. Launched in 2000, StarHub has become one of Singapore's most innovative info-communications providers, and the pioneer in 'hubbing' - the ability to deliver unique integrated and converged services to all its customers. StarHub, listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange since October 2004, is a component stock of the Straits Times Index and the MSCI Singapore Free Index.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position: Strategic Partner Manager (Payments Partnerships)
Client: Fortune 100 Social Media Company
Duration: 12 months ( extendable)
Location: Singapore


Our Client is s seeking a Partnerships Manager for the Payments Partnerships team who is passionate about online payments, technology, social and business strategy. Payments & Commerce Partnerships team at Facebook is responsible for developing and managing the relationships with companies that allow us to enable monetization of our products. We work cross-functionally with product, engineering, legal, marketing and operations teams to develop new capabilities, improve user experience, and reduce barriers that prevent people from buying what they want.

This is a position based in our Singapore office.

Minimum Qualifications:

1. Sales or Business Development experience, comfortable with prospecting for new leads, performing product demos for customers and teaching them how to use the company's products or services. Ability to overcome objections and negotiate with leads.
2. Proven track record, with 6+ years related experience in Payment, eCommerce partnerships. Capable of leading multiple time-sensitive, cross-functional projects
3. Strategic thinker capable of driving internal stakeholders to a consensus on important issues
4. Experience of working and negotiating with external business partners and vendors
5. Strong quantitative abilities, analytical skills
6. Ability to project manage and problem solve
7. Ability to communicate and the gravitas to engage at the C-level of partner organisation
8. Experience working in or with APAC financial services required deep relationships across financial services preferred
9. BA required, MBA or MS Degree or equivalent experience desired

The team is responsible for developing and managing the relationships with companies that allow us to enable monetization of our products.

- Working closely with the partners in Fintech, BSP, sell this product and get advertisers onboard
- Cold-call the advertisers, and figure out the solutions that these advertisers can make the best use for their needs.
- Prospecting new leads via the current partners to onboard merchants onto the platform
- Work with compliance, business engineers, legal, policy, product teams – communicate on the gaps, current pipeline, meeting the deadlines


Preferred Qualifications
· 1. Product management experience

title: Trainee, 12 months' contract - Credit Management
company_info: Société Générale Societe Generale is one of the largest European financial services groups. Based on a diversified and integrated banking model, the Group combines financial solidity with a strategy of sustainable growth, and aims to be the reference for relationship banking, recognised on its markets, close to clients, chosen for the quality and commitment of its teams. Societe Generale has been playing a vital role in the economy for 150 years. With more than 145,000 employees, based in 66 countries, we serve on a daily basis 31 million clients throughout the world. Societe Generale’s teams offer advice and services to individual, corporate and institutional customers in three core businesses: Retail banking in France with the Societe Generale branch network, Credit du Nord and Boursorama, offering a comprehensive range of multi-channel financial services at the leading edge of digital innovation; International retail banking, insurance and financial services to corporates with a presence in developing economies and leading specialised businesses; Corporate and investment banking, private banking, asset management and securities services, with recognised expertise, top international rankings and integrated solutions. Societe Generale in Asia Pacific Societe Generale’s first presence in Asia dates back from the 19th century. Today, we have offices in 12 locations across Asia Pacific. With our regional headquarters in Hong Kong – a core hub of the worldwide Societe Generale Group – we employ close to 9,000 employees in the region. Our expertise here ranges from corporate and investment banking to asset management, securities services, specialised financial services, trade finance and cash management services. For more information, follow us on Twitter @SocGen_APAC, LinkedIn @Société Générale or visit our website www.societegenerale.asia. As at Feb 2018
