description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Department Description
The Credit Management Group's main responsibility is to conduct credit risk assessment of corporates in South-East Asia.

Responsibilities
Support senior analysts and manager of the team
Review and understand the financial statements of corporates and convert them to the bank’s standard model
Conduct credit risk assessment of corporates and peer comparisons
Manage all matters related to the submission of credit requests, including follow-ups with product managers, relationship managers and credit risk officers, to ensure requests are approved in a timely manner
Track corporate and industry news and provide early identification of emerging risks
Participate in projects relating to topics such as automatic financial spreading, E&S and early warning signals
Support administrative tasks which include MIS updates, liaising with IT support teams, prepare presentation deck on powerpoint, meeting minutes writing etc.
Profile Required

ACADEMIC BACKGROUND AND CERTIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCE
Recent graduates from either Business, Finance or Accounting discipline
Knowledge of accounting and IFRS
Strong analytical and writing skills
Has interest in research and well-versed in data collection from public news sources
Adept in reading rating reports from S&P and Moody’s
Banking product knowledge is a plus
Strong computer application skills including Powerpoint and Excel macros
Team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
Shows initiative and pays attention to details
BEHAVIORAL SKILLS
Client - Risk: I strive to satisfy clients while taking into account risks for the company
Team Spirit - Synergies: I make cooperation with colleagues in and outside my team a priority
Innovation - Thinking out of the box/Creativity: I propose new ideas and solutions
Responsibility - Performance: I strive for high performance
Responsibility - Accountability: I make decisions in my scope of responsibilities
Commitment - Sustainability: I strive to develop my skills and knowledge
This is a fixed term 12 month Trainee contract with Societe Generale. You will form part of the team on a full time basis. In order to apply for the Trainee position please ensure you have completed your qualification and will be available to work full time for the duration of the Trainee contract.

title: Category Manager APAC & MEA
company_info: Electrolux is a global leader in household appliances and appliances for professional use, selling more than 50 million products to customers in more than 150 markets every year. The company focuses on innovations that are thoughtfully designed, based on extensive consumer insight, to meet the real needs of consumers and professionals. The company focuses on innovative solutions that are thoughtfully designed, based on extensive consumer insight, to meet the real needs of consumers and professionals. Electrolux products include refrigerators, dishwashers, washing machines, cookers, air-conditioners and small appliances such as vacuum cleaners sold under esteemed brands like Electrolux, AEG, Eureka and Frigidaire.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reports To –Operationally to: Product Line Category Director APAC-MEA

About us
Electrolux shapes living for the better by reinventing taste, care, and well-being experiences, making life more enjoyable and sustainable for millions of people.

As a leading global appliance company, we place the consumer at the heart of everything we do. Through our brands, including Electrolux, AEG, Anova, Frigidaire, Westinghouse, and Zanussi, we sell around sixty million household products in more than 150 markets every year.
Our Business Area APAC MEA Headquartered in Singapore encompasses rich and diverse emerging markets such as Australia, Africa, Middle East, China, Thailand, etc. The sector comprises of over 100 countries and 1000+ spoken languages.
Our Business Area is a unique blend of cultures, festivities, ethnicities, and cuisines. The way people cook, care for their clothes and homes is different and unique as well. Which makes the job of our Product Line teams extremely exciting and challenging. A regular day at work would be to develop and innovate product offerings that create better experiences for our Multicultural consumers.
APAC&MEA Business Area sell around 10M products sourced and produced in 7 plants across South Africa, Egypt, Thailand, China, and Australia thanks to our seven thousand employees.
Our goal remains unchanged: being a company that differentiates ourselves by offering simply outstanding consumer experiences around Taste, Care and Wellbeing. We will continue to deliver consumer experiences that exceed expectations, are effortless, delightful, and inspiring at the right moments.

Your Role
Leading the category business unit in profitable growth together with the Category director by creating Simply Outstanding Consumer Experiences in the category.
The Job Holder contributes to building the Category strategy and is responsible for its execution by identifying consumers negative experience and needs, leading the development of Category Generation Plan, prioritizing the projects and driving the entire NPD process with the category.
The Category Manager is the first point of call for Sales Areas’s(SA) teams for all matters relating to the category. And drivers for business performance improvement in the category.

A Typical Day
· Define a competitive advantage for the Sub Category in line with the Product Line strategy and the Category’s plan.
· Identify opportunities based on the market sizing for the category across each cluster & market
· Identify and deliver of consumer insights for the category working with Marketing & Clusters
· Develop the 10X MBBs for the category
· Build a model catalogue for the sub-category
· Lead the sub category CPs along with project managers
· Manage sourcing ranges across SAs with GSO to identify & develop better strategic suppliers (when required)
· Lead the delivery of commercial results for the (sub) category
· Ensure the readiness of the commercial launch in collaboration with Design, R&D, Marketing and SAs PL team.
· Define VPM (Volume, Price, Mix) strategy and look for business insights to improve further.
· Monthly Cluster business review and driving commercial agenda executions down to cluster level

Who You Are
For you to succeed in this role, you should be:
· A leader – You understand how to build culture within an organization - you are an amplifier – formally and informally delivering through others, managing demand, and building capability
· Creative - You’re open minded about where ideas come from and how they can be applied to enable innovation.
· Agile You can quickly understand and assess a situation and react confidently, making decisions even where there is ambiguity.
· Engaging – A natural storyteller, you utilise a variety of techniques and media to bring the teams creativity to life.
· Strategic - You can join the dots to take us from where we are to where we want to be, mapping the clear routes and strategies essential to achieving our goals
· Collaborative – You see the value in different experience and perspectives, and actively facilitate collaboration between PL/R&D/Marketing/Design – both formally through planned initiatives, and informally day to day.

Key Measurement of success:
· This is the P&L owner for the category.
· Success will be measured in terms of NS , CTF margin, EBIT & Consumer Ratings.

Collaboration triangle:
· Innovation, Commercial and Quality

EXPERIENCE
· 7-10 Years of progressive Experience in building a business and developing commercial results.
· Proven ability to operate in a large, complex organization and maximize the value of strong brands.
· Sound commercial experience as business development/sales/channels and/or key account management or/and Marketing/Product Management closely supporting Sales force.
As the role requires both a strategic vision and an ability to achieve concrete, market objectives and P&L targets, the key functional competencies are
· Understanding of P&L management
· Portfolio and Range Management
· Understanding of Emerging market’s Consumer insight
· Commercializing consumer relevant Innovation
· Effective story telling
Core competencies:
· Demonstrates tenacity and focus by continuously striving to reach goals and overcoming obstacles (Energy)
· Ability to lead and influence others (senior management, peers, team and multiple cross functional stakeholders) (Energy)
· Ability to understand complex situations and find a collaborative way to navigate through; to recovers quickly from setbacks and remained composed and focused in challenging situations. (Agility)
· Can manage complex and large amount of information and keep a big picture in mind (Agility)
· Cross-functional collaboration is key. Ability to listen and networks well as well as to synthesize multiple, diverse viewpoints into practical, scalable solutions is necessary to succeed. (Openness)
· Consumer centric mind-set (Openness)
· Curious about new ways of doing things and challenges own thinking beyond current practice. Proposes new and original ideas, approaches and solutions to problems. (Growth)
Keeping you Healthy and Safe

We want you to return home in even better shape than when you started, so we need you to help us do this by making sure you follow a few simple steps. We need you to:
· Make sure you take reasonable care for your own health and safety, and
· Take reasonable care that what you do (or what you don’t do when you should have) doesn’t affect the health and safety of others, and
· Follow reasonable instructions that we might give from time-to-time, such as reporting incidents and hazards, and
· Follow policies or procedures, so long as it’s reasonable and we’ve told you about it, and
· Attend training that helps you to work safely

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Responsibilities:

Enforce health and safety precautions consistently to uphold a safe working environment
Implement and manage manufacturing metrics and key performance indicator (KPI) systems to track essential measures and encourage appropriate response behaviours
Regularly present plans, actual results, and KPI progress, and take decisive action to enhance financial performance in areas such as direct and indirect labour, manufacturing overhead cost, and inventory levels
Collaborate with internal resources and various departments, including sales, marketing, design engineering, finance, supply chain, and human resources, to coordinate manufacturing functions
Allocate resources effectively across all operational areas to achieve customer-driven priorities
Play an active and significant role in the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process
Continually benchmark industry best practices and implement them as suitable
Report to upper management on production activities, issues, and progress, ensuring transparency and effective communication

Deep knowledge of production management, quality standards, health & safety regulations, and performance evaluation and budgeting concepts
Proficiency in lean culture development and lean tool implementation, along with a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification or equivalent experience with similar continuous improvement methodologies
Demonstrated expertise in supply chain and inventory management
Proven ability to effectively allocate resources to key priorities, demonstrating both manufacturing and technical acumen
Experience in reporting on key production metrics and driving a results-oriented approach
Exceptional communication, organizational, and leadership skills with attention to detail and strong decision-making abilities
Manufacturing experience with hollow fibre membrane technology and its production process is a plus
Other Information:
Salary: $6,000 to $8,000
Type: Full-time, permanent

title: Technical Product Manager
company_info: Nahimic Singapore Pte Ltd. - A SteelSeries Brand. Nahimic is the leading 3D gaming audio software developer with more than 150 man-years of research and development in gaming industry. Our team gathers the rare combination of world class audio algorithms PHD, DSP engineers and software geniuses based across France, Singapore and Taiwan, enabling to bring the last decade all innovations that lead the industry. We are the worldwide leader in PC audio gaming software that embedded in millions of gaming devices, from gaming headsets to the most powerful gaming PCs by brands such as MSI, Dell, Gigabyte. Our technology offers the most precise and immersive sound for gamers that allows them to be more efficient in any game and have more immersive feeling. Nahimic has joined the SteelSeries family to bolster reputation of industry-leading gaming audio performance across both hardware and software. SteelSeries is a leader in gaming peripherals focused on quality, innovation and functionality, and the fastest growing major gaming headset brand globally. Founded in 2001, SteelSeries improves performance through first-to-market innovations and technologies that enable gamers to play harder, train longer, and rise to the challenge. SteelSeries is a pioneer supporter of competitive gaming tournaments and eSports and connects gamers to each other, fostering a sense of community and purpose. SteelSeries’ team of professional and gaming enthusiasts help design and craft every single accessory and are the driving force behind the company.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Gaming? Check. Esports? Check. Hardware? Check. Software? Check. We could go on and on. The point is we've been helping gamers get better since 2001. In fact, Esports pros have won more money using SteelSeries products than any other brand and we're just getting started. Esports and Gaming are multi-billion-dollar industries, and we're going to continue supporting them through innovative gear and software gamers need and love. We believe in being true to the gaming community, which means being true to ourselves. We create products that help the best of the best be better, and products that help the not-so-good feel not-so-bad. Most of us are gamers, but you don't have to be, we promise! Just don't be surprised if you become one within a few weeks of starting!

Want to see what we're up to? Find us on social media, where we're highlighting our community, amazing partners, and products!

ABOUT YOU:
We are looking for people that believe in collective product ownership, that the product we defined always try to solve a problem for gamers, and someone who are open to mentoring and being mentored. We have multiple product teams and software services in development with interesting tech problems to solve. If the opportunity to stretch yourself and learn new skills, to have collaborative, constructive conversations with other engineers, designers, and product managers about how to better our products, and the belief that we are always trying to create better product for gamers, this might be the place for you.

This role is in our Software and Services group working on building amazing software products and services for gamers. Check out our new platform that you will help build: https://steelseries.com/gg/

As a technical product manager, you will work to develop amazing gaming software from the design concept, to the execution of products on our SteelSeries GG platform. You will responsible for planning, organizing, and directing the completion of our specific projects for our SteelSeries GG platform (Team Engine) while ensuring these projects are on time, on budget, and within scope.

NECESSARY SKILLS:
· 5 to 8 years’ experience in the field of hardware/software technical product management, preferable in consumer electronics software and/or gaming
· Bachelor's Degree in appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience, preferably able to demonstrate experience bringing products to market.
· Understand Software/Firmware integration, experience in firmware specification review and able to create software specification.
· Experience in product roadmapping and product planning.
· Strong communication skill and experience in manage stakeholder globally.
· Discipline, highly motivated and goal/schedule/delivery oriented that can work independently.
· Experience working in agile software delivery & know project management tool like JIRA.
· Fluent in English/Mandarin languages
· Experience in requirement management (change management) & schedule management (dependency management)
· Understand HW users testing process and able to feedback and propose improvement.
· Resource planning & software budget management.
· Strong interest/passion for gaming and consumer electronics.

WITHIN 1 MONTH YOU WILL:
· Iterate on product features and release software to millions of gamers
· Collaborate closely with software engineers, product designers, other product managers, and stakeholders globally.
· Understand the business and how our software contributes to SteelSeries success.
· Understand all the feedback channels that inform product direction.

WITHIN 3 MONTHS YOU WILL:
· Develop product experiments, draw insight from user research, iterate on UI wireframes, build prototypes, be very familiar with app analytics.
· Empathize with our gamers through engaging in user interviews and other research methods.
· Perform market research
· Prioritize user problems/opportunities and business outcomes
· Create product roadmaps to deliver on user and business goals

WITHIN 9 MONTHS YOU WILL:
· Shape the direction of the product management practice at SteelSeries
· Define the vision of software products
· Mentor product managers in your craft
· Run more product experiments that you have ever done

FUN STUFF:
We offer competitive pay, great benefits, and an awesome workplace with people who love gaming and technology.

title: Product Owner / Manager
company_info: At Sedha Consulting, we harness the power of technology to drive business growth and transformation. Sedha Consulting is a professional services company operating across Asia Pacific with leading capabilities in digital, cloud, and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills, we offer Advisory, Consulting, Project Delivery, Managed Services, Training and Resourcing. With a strong focus on driving digital transformation, we leverage cutting-edge technologies to help businesses across industries achieve their goals and thrive in today's rapidly evolving digital landscape.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Product Owner/Manager
Responsibilities
· Ensure overall success of a project, or a platform, by ensuring that prioritized user stories are delivered on time, within budget, meet business requirements and comply with governance framework, including security and resiliency.
· Manage and monitor product backlog and MVP, risk and change management to ensure delivery of MVP on schedule, within scope and budget.
· Plan and manage product backlog and MVP, its objectives and desired outcomes, and ensure alignment of the business outcomes of the Authority.
· Plan and lead the development of the business case/concept paper and funding.
· Plan and lead the overall procurement activities, in particular tender specifications compilation, tendering, tender evaluation, recommendation and award.
· Lead the development of the overall product backlog and MVP schedule and activities based on the appropriate methodology including identifying dependency, critical path, milestones and deliverables.
· Build comprehensive product roadmap and ensure all team members are on-board with delegated tasks and activities.
· Conduct regular work group meetings and provide progress and status reports to stakeholders.
· Perform stakeholder management, including keeping the relevant stakeholders informed of the status the product development on a timely and regular basis.
· Manage processes and procedures covering issue and risk management.
· Conduct Agile ceremonies such as but not limited to sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and sprint retrospective etc.

What we are looking for
· CSM (Certified Scrum Master) or CSPO (Certified Scrum Product Owner) or AIPMM (Agile Certified Product Manager and Product Owner).
· Hands-on experience in Agile product management.
· ICT product management and people management skills.
· Knowledge of the Singapore Government’s and/or Authority’s procurement and governance processes will be an added advantage.
· Knowledge of design thinking and workshop facilitation will be an added advantage.
· Results and customer oriented.
· Proven ICT project/product management experience, preferably in medium to large scale ICT projects in government sector.
· Hands-on, delivery focused and pragmatic.
· Possess a proven and successful track record in delivering complex IT projects/programs.
· Hands-on IT professional with full SLDC lifecycle experience.
· Strong understanding and experience of Singapore Government security standards and compliance.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Title: Regional Product Manager, Medical Devices/Pharma
Location: Singapore

About the Role:
Our client is an international healthcare company seeking for a Regional Product Manager to plan, develop and implement integrated sales & marketing campaigns that are of strategic importance to the organization as well as support day-to-day sales & marketing activities so that they meet the organization’s short and long-term business objectives in compliance with regulations and standards.

Responsibilities:
As the Regional Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in developing comprehensive marketing strategies and plans specifically tailored for APAC. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the implementation of a strong product positioning and successful activation plans.
Leveraging your expertise, you will provide insightful consumer analysis to help conceptualize and craft compelling marketing concepts to enhance the overall product experience.
You will also build and maintain strong relationships with country teams in order to achieve alignment on strategic marketing plans while keeping a keen eye on market conditions and competitor information.
Effectively plan and manage the brand's budget to optimize resources and fully support the development of regional campaigns and initiatives.

Requirements:
Ideally, you have a Bachelor's degree, along with at least 5 years of experience in Marketing or Product management, preferably with regional exposure.
Previous experience in related industries such as Healthcare, Aesthetic, Pharmaceutical, or Medical Device will be highly valuable.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, analytical and project management skills. You demonstrate a strong creative outlook with confident and dynamic personality.

Interested? Here’s what to do next:
Please apply to the role with a recent copy of your CV. We will be in touch once we review your profile for suitability.
If you have any questions on this role, or are looking to explore job opportunities generally, please reach out to Felicia for a confidential discussion at felicia.lim@wilsonhcg.com.

*

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Reimagine a Play-and-Earn Metaverse, where the virtual and real world converge!
We are a well-funded start-up Singapore-based company with a global reach. We use blockchain-powered technology to develop mobile games with integrated geolocation and augmented reality capability. We are pioneering the gaming model with a sustainable play-and-earn economy where rewards earned in the virtual world can also be utilized in the real world.

We are seeking an experienced Games/Product Marketing Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for gaming and a strong marketing and product management background, with specific experience in game publishing in the Asian markets.

Responsibilities
Develop and execute go-to-market distribution strategies for game releases in targeted markets with a focus in Asia
Be a product expert and advocate, inserting yourself into conversations and establishing yourself as a pillar of knowledge for our product and target audiences
Utilize consumer insights, research and other data sources to craft customer profiles and champion the creation of the product position and messaging that caters to those audiences
Manage cross-functional efforts to execute marketing programs for content releases, brand collaborations, and game launches
Create open lines of communication as a true facilitator, opening communication channels and taking charge to coordinate cross functionally
Adopt a test and learn approach on GTM plan, looking for new ways to open up the funnel and find and capture new audiences
Take ownership in game localization, working closely with translators and other stakeholders to ensure that all aspects of the game, from the user interface to the dialogue, are properly localized.
Develop go-to-market and live phase product campaigns to build content and engage players
Work closely with the product and strategic marketing team to position and promote products and maximize ROI
Skills and Requirements
5+ years of marketing or live ops experience at a technology company or a history of success building and scaling a product, with specific experience in game publishing in the Asian markets
Experience in championing cross-functional leadership with Product, Art and creative, marketing and community teams
Experience working with and executing marketing strategy
A great communicator and strategic thinker
Shipped at least 1-2 Mobile App and passionate for games
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, including superb ability to dissect data and measure ROI
Ability to effectively present ideas; both verbally and visually
In-depth knowledge of up-to-date worldwide games industry trends, with specific expertise in the Asian market
Experience with blockchain and web3 technology is a plus
Fluent in English and at least one Asian language (e.g. Chinese, Korean, Japanese)

Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for an experienced Digital Product Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering successful digital products, experience with agile scrum delivery, and be well-versed in working with innovation teams.

This team is created to facilitate healthcare innovation growth, enablement and introduce new ways of working, so that healthcare challenges can addressed rapidly in this fast paced era.

The selected candidate will work with innovators, UX designers, strategists, design researchers.
This team is designed to be the first port of call for focused on using a design thinking, co-creation and rapid prototyping approach for IHIS to innovate and deliver practical and experience centric solutions for issues and challenges faced in the public healthcare system.


Responsibilities:
· Leads project planning, execution, monitoring,and controlling for digital product development
· Collaborates with cross-functional teams todevelop and manage project scope, timelines, and budgets
· Identifies and manages project risks and issues
· Manages and motivates project teams to deliverquality work on time and within budget
· Acts as the main point of contact for allstakeholders and communicates project status, progress, and issues effectively
· Identifies opportunities for product improvementand aligns the product with company strategy and goals
· Ensures digital product meets quality standardsand is delivered on time and within budget
· Coaches the team in Agile Scrum values andprinciples
· Facilitates backlog grooming, daily stand-ups,iteration and sprint planning, sprint reviews, retrospectives & releaseplanning
· Manages & actively resolves impediments in atimely manner, including impediments outside of the Scrum team
· Identifies team dependencies and actively plansto ensure they don’t negatively impact the performance of the Scrum team
· Builds a trusting and safe environment whereproblems can be raised with an emphasis on problem solving
· Tracks and ruthlessly manages Scrum metrics topro-actively course correct, capacity plan and ensure highest value items aredelivered first
· Ensures scaled Agile alignment by participatingin Scrum of Scrum ceremonies
· Manages conflicts, challenges and dynamicbusiness requirements to keep development, velocity & value delivered perSprint at high levels
· Conducts post-mortem and root cause analysis tohelp teams continuously improve their practices to ensure maximum productivity
· Supports the education of Scrum practices acrossthe organization and into other teams that can benefit from Scrum
· Understands and embeds DevOps practices
· Facilitates getting the work done withoutcoercion, assigning or dictating work.

Requirements
· Bachelor's degree in computerscience, engineering, business administration, or a related field
· 5+ years of experience as aproject manager, with a focus on digital product development
· Proven experience in deliveringsuccessful digital products using agile scrum delivery methodologies
· Strong leadership, communication,and interpersonal skills
· Experience working withcross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and testers
· Ability to manage multipleprojects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively
· Experience working withinnovation teams and developing innovative solutions to complex problems
· Strong problem-solving skillsand ability to make sound decisions in a fast-paced environment
Familiarity with project management software,such as Jira, Asana, or Trello

title: Product Developer
company_info: Secretlab was established in 2014 with the mission of creating the ultimate seating experience. We design and produce chairs for comfort over long hours of use in front of the computer. Our award-winning products have consistently achieved near perfect scores from both media and users. Secretlab products are sold directly to the customer, and are currently available in Singapore(where we are headquartered), US, UK, Malaysia, Australia, Canada, and most European & South-east Asia countries. Secretlab was the winner of OCBC’s Emerging Enterprise Award 2017. At Secretlab we are a team of highly motivated individuals that take great pride in our work. We are looking for driven, versatile, and result-oriented individuals who share our vision. You will be heavily involved in a fast-growing enterprise and be a part of the team that pioneers its rapid expansion. We offer great flexibility and plenty of opportunities for fast track careers to our staff.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Secretlab is an international gaming chair brand seating over a million users worldwide, with our key markets in the United States, Europe and Singapore, where we are headquartered.
You will be a valued member in our award-winning Product team, responsible for creating products for consumers across over 60 countries. In this unique position, you will develop accessories for fans of the brand which complement our award-winning chairs. You should be an innovator with a proven track record of bringing products to market from the conceptualisation stages.
Our Product team is involved with all Secretlab’s industry-leading designs, including collaborative efforts with world-renowned brands such as Game of Thrones, Batman, Cloud9, Team Secret, as well as international esports organisers such as Riot Games for their League of Legends global tournaments.

Responsibilities
Work closely with Industrial Designers, Mechanical Engineers, Sourcing, Quality and Reliability Engineers to develop our ideas from concepts through to production.
Collaborate with suppliers in the development and production of our products
Manage development schedules from prototyping, testing, reiterations, pre-production, etc.
Drive new and/ or existing projects through the product development stages, liaising with internal and external stakeholders for matters including manufacturing, logistics, purchasing, etc.
Troubleshoot new product issues and implement solutions
Work with key business leaders to develop innovative and functional product features for current and future iterations of the product
Collaborate with internal teams to design/ optimize customer experiences for Secretlab products
Be a key liaison across the organization for owned projects’ go-to-market and develop SOPs between relevant teams
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or the equivalent
Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in product development
Demonstrated expertise liaising and collaborating with factories
Excellent experience and understanding of materials and manufacturing processes
Hands on attitude for prototyping and testing
High attention to detail
Proficiency in English and Mandarin (for liaising with Mandarin speaking suppliers)
Availability to travel as necessary
You should be:
Creative - We want interesting “out of the box” solutions
Hands on - If you don’t like getting your hands dirty, this might not be for you.
Team player - We value everyone's opinion and so should you.
Motivated - Our environment is highly motivated as we all strive to build the best products
Bonuses
High interest and familiarity with the esports and gaming industry
Proficiency with CAD (Solidworks)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
CHAMP Cargosystems provides the most comprehensive range of integrated IT solutions and distribution services for the air cargo transport chain. The portfolio spans core management systems, messaging services, and eCargo solutions. These include applications to meet customs and security requirements, quality optimization as well as e-freight and mobility needs. The products and services are well known under the Cargospot and Traxon brands.
The company serves over 200 airlines and GSAs, and links these with some 3,000 forwarders and GHAs worldwide. CHAMP’s solutions help its customers and their clients adapt to critical and continuous changes in air transport logistics to meet global trade demands.
Headquartered in Luxembourg, we have over 400 employees located in offices in London, Zurich, Manila and Frankfurt, as well as Atlanta and Singapore.
We are currently looking for a Product Consultant to join our team.
The role will be reporting to a Product Manager.
Location: Singapore
Responsibilities
· To specify software development requirements to meet the strategic, financial and operational needs of CHAMP Cargosystems clients and to provide support to the development team during development.
· Provide most efficient solutions to requirements keeping in mind the product and technical debt.
· Able to own the end-to-end business domain module and work with all stakeholders to agree a documented and efficient solution consisting of various functional and integration specifications.
· Able to lead a project from product delivery side from inception to go-live and leading various analysts and development team.
· Support and mentor other business analysts and development team in the development process.
· Apply technical and product knowledge to analyze requirements and define the most suitable solution for enhancement of the application.
· Fully document functional and technical solutions, obtain customer /stakeholder approval prior to technical development, ensuring updated system support documentation is produced during the implementation phase.
· Define the test cases and provide BA acceptance for developments and fixes done by development team.
· Create business process workflows, user interface designs and mock-ups that will mimic the actual user interaction with the digital site.
· Provide business and functional support to the technical team during development, and test programs after completion to ensure compliance with the specification.
· Investigate operational problems/incidents/defects, identify causes and support the testing and implementation of corrections.
· Build and maintain test libraries to support manual and automated regression testing.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
· Experience of working on Air Cargo management systems and expert level knowledge in the domain the Air Cargo workflow (sales or operations)
· Knowledge of industry inter-system message formats, rules and applications
· Excellent written and oral communications skills in English
· Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases and reporting applications
· Knowledge of all common PC software
· Knowledge of external interfacing systems
· Systematic approach to handling problems under pressure as part of a small team.
· Knowledge in user experience (UX)
· Knowledge of RESTful APIs.
· Knowledge of integration testing of APIs using tools like Swagger, Postman.
· Knowledge of creation of API documentation using YAML specifications.
· Creatively analytical, out of the box thinkers who can backup ideas their ideas with research
· Team players who are comfortable collaborating with graphic designers, web architects and the clients themselves
· Knowledge in prototyping use of any wire framing tool. Experience in using any wire framing tools such as Invision, Marvel, Proto.io, Framer, Axure.
· Knowledge and experience in Agile software development, Scrum methodology and user story creation.
Education and Experience:
· Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Business Management
· Has sound experience in functional analysis and support of systems
· 5 to 7 years of experience working in the Air Cargo domain.

title: Production / R&D Manager
company_info: Sunward Pharmaceutical Pte Ltd is a manufacturer and marketer of healthcare products. We have two production factories; the first was established in Singapore (1968) and the other was established in Malaysia – Johor Bahru (1992). Sunward’s clientele base covers Doctors, Hospitals, Medical Centres, Pharmacies, and Wholesalers. We are also established in promoting our own generic products and represent products from our Principals in other Asia countries. Join Sunward to make an improvement in millions of people’s life. Developing, manufacturing & promoting pharmaceutical products is team effort combining the talent of many idividuals. Sunward has a long history with many years of excellence and we consistently strive to deliver the best healthcare products at affordable prices with our core values to drive us to achieve success. Our Core Values Honesty and Integrity High Ethical Standards Teamwork and Strong Leadership
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Duties and Responsibilities
Establish R&D procedures and work processes.
Development of new and/or improved product formulation to meet pharmacopeia requirements.
Development of suitable manufacturing process for the product formulation.
Produces sample batch in lab scale and pilot scale.
Responsible for effective technology transfer and upscaling to commercial scale batches.
Participates in process validation for the R&D batches.
Provides training to production personnel on improved formulation and manufacturing processes.
Ensures suitable test method is developed and validated for the new/improved products.
Trouble-shooting in the areas of formulation and process for routine production.
Participation in the investigation of product complaints (if applicable).
Monitors the progress of stability study for R&D samples.
Establishment of technical information e.g. specifications of raw material, packaging materials, finished products.
Provides documentation to support registration of products with regulatory authority.
To ensure the quality of product is in accordance with the specification.
To review and feedback if there is any improvement needed for the process of manufacturing.
To ensure that products are produced, stored according to the appropriate documentation and monitor storage conditions for materials and product in order to obtain or maintain the required quality.
To inspect, investigate and take samples in order to monitor factors which may affect product quality.
To ensure all products, in process materials, production facilities and process are in accordance to codes of Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) requirement through proper monitoring procedures, effective training program and up to date documentations.
To monitor drugs manufacturing activities and ensure company is always in compliance with the latest PICS & GMP guideline.
To ensure that company is always updated with the latest guideline required.
Review and make recommendation for improvement in area of manufacturing processes, safety, environment, sanitation and hygiene.
To approve the instruction relating to production operations and to ensure their strict implementation.
To ensure the qualification and maintenance of his department, premises and equipment.
To ensure that the appropriate validations are conducted timely and accordingly.
To ensure all GMP quality related record are kept properly
Requirement
Bachelor Degree/Master in Pharmacy/Pharmaceutical Sciences
Minimum 2 - 5 years’ experience in pharmaceutical industry
Minimum 2 years’ experience in drug development and formulation as well as manufacturing process/technologies

Provide quality trend analysis

title: Marketing Manager
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us:
Canvass Technology is a dynamic and innovative technology company that specializes in data technology . We are passionate about driving innovation and empowering businesses with cutting-edge technology solutions. As we continue to expand our reach and offerings, we are looking for a talented Tech Marketing Manager to join our team and play a pivotal role in our growth.

Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Tech Marketing Manager to lead our marketing efforts in the technology sector. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the tech industry, be well-versed in marketing strategies and tactics, and possess excellent communication and leadership skills. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and executing marketing campaigns, building brand awareness, and driving customer engagement within the tech sector.

Key Responsibilities:
Strategic Planning: Develop and implement comprehensive marketing strategies tailored to the technology sector to drive brand recognition and customer acquisition.
Content Creation: Create and oversee the production of high-quality marketing content, including blog posts, whitepapers, case studies, videos, and social media content, that showcases our expertise in the tech industry.
Product Positioning: Collaborate with product management teams to understand our products' unique value propositions and develop messaging that resonates with the tech audience.
Campaign Management: Plan and execute multi-channel marketing campaigns, including email marketing, social media marketing, SEO/SEM, and advertising, to reach and engage tech professionals and decision-makers.
Market Research: Stay up-to-date with industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to identify opportunities and threats and adjust marketing strategies accordingly.
Lead Generation: Work closely with the sales team to generate qualified leads and support the conversion of leads into customers through targeted marketing efforts.
Analytics and Reporting: Monitor and analyze key performance metrics to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives and make data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement.
Budget Management: Manage the marketing budget for the tech sector, ensuring cost-effective allocation of resources to achieve marketing goals.
Team Leadership: Build and lead a high-performing marketing team, providing mentorship, guidance, and performance feedback.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.
Proven experience (5+ years) in marketing, with a focus on the technology sector.
Strong knowledge of technology trends, products, and industry-specific terminology.
Demonstrated success in developing and executing marketing strategies that drive results.
Proficiency in digital marketing tools, analytics, and marketing automation platforms.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong leadership and team management capabilities.
Creative thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

title: Cluster Academic Manager, Young Learners
company_info: BRITISH COUNCIL (SINGAPORE) LIMITED The British Council is the UK’s international organisation for cultural relations and educational opportunities. We create friendly knowledge and understanding between the people of the UK and other countries. We do this by making a positive contribution to the UK and the countries we work with – changing lives by creating opportunities, building connections and engendering trust. We work with over 100 countries across the world in the fields of arts and culture, English language, education and civil society. Each year we reach over 20 million people face-to-face and more than 500 million people online, via broadcasts and publications. Founded in 1934, we are a UK charity governed by Royal Charter and a UK public body.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role Purpose:
To drive the continuous improvement of products and services for the cluster, and innovation in meeting customer needs. To ensure consistency of standards in the delivery of new/existing products and services. To support centres to achieve product performance targets.
To play an important role contributing to and delivering elements of the Teaching Excellence project to help meet its aims, with particular focus on the delivery of adult and young learner courses, which will lead to enhanced teaching performance and the highest standards of teaching and or learning.

Main accountabilities but not limited to the following:
Product Management
Oversees and, as necessary, advises on the implementation of approved products to ensure these are efficiently and effectively delivered to all centres in the cluster.
Ensures standardization of approach across the cluster in product delivery for new/existing products and services as well as enhancements, through project management methodology and tools.
Manages the testing and roll out of new products/pilots for the cluster and develops a feedback cycle to ensure a continuous improvement process for all products and services
Provides input to product proposals into the Product Development Stage Gate process, and manages projects through that process if necessary.
Ensures agreed KPIs are embedded in the continuous improvement and country reporting processes.
Supports the development and presentation of specific product, project or programme proposals, including the subject or sector specialism-related component of wider programmes, to ensure these are soundly based and gain approval.
Sector/subject expertise
Working with colleagues across the Academic strand; both Product and Teaching Excellence:
Guides and oversee teaching staff to ensure that latest thinking, innovation and best practices in pedagogy and assessment are incorporated in products and enhancements.
Ensures consistency, quality and integrity of services across markets.
Works with academic staff to ensure effective roll out of Teaching Excellence initiatives including:The new teaching standards and observation systems
the roll out and utilisation of Teaching Excellence (Academic) Quality Plans (TEAP) for teaching operations
The utilisation of the new Teaching Performance Review Project system (TCPR) and the utilisation of feedback and data gathering systems to understand teaching performance
the organisation and delivery of specific training and Learning & Development initiatives (L&D) for teachers and other academic staff
helps identify academic/teaching talent, and work with teams to develop this talent and to share best practice.
supports EDI and SEND initiatives relevant to teaching
upports relevant Thought leadership activity which may promote our teaching activity
Relationship & stakeholder management
Proactively identifies and cultivates potential/actual partners for product or programme development and delivery, and secures the successful achievement of BC income and impact objectives.
Develops strong working relationship with other Country and Cluster leads in the region, marketing and customer service and Regional Product teams to enable effective product/service development.
Commercial and financial management
Using agreed corporate systems and processes, plans and manages the budget for a range of small/medium-sized projects and programmes, and conducts monthly and year-end reporting on income and expenditure, profitability and risk and other product KPIs.
Leadership & management
Plans and prioritises own work activities, and those of a wider project team/teams (many of which exist outside the direct management line), to ensure effective delivery of diverse responsibilities and programme deliverables over a monthly to quarterly time horizon.
Shares intelligence and ideas to support senior managers in identifying/developing ways in which the subject/sector specialism could make the most effective impact on the British Council’s cultural relations and commercial strategies.
Role specific knowledge and experience:
Essential
Experience of successful product management.
Demonstrated experience working in an English Language learning management or assessment development role.
Experience of working collaboratively with stakeholders across multiple sites / countries to achieve objectives.
Proven experience and demonstrable success in coordinating/supervising/influencing others in an educational context.
Desirable
Experience of product development for use across multiple sites.
End-to-end product management experience.
Certification and Professional Qualifications
Essential
TEFL-Q or British Council recognized equivalent.
Desirable
Project Management qualification
Benefits & Entitlement
As per Country Plus Contract benefits.
Further Information:
Pay Band: Middle Manager
Contract Type: Country Plus Contract, 2 years
Location: Napier Road, Singapore
Requirements:
Candidates must have the right to live and work in the country in which the role is based. Those candidate from outside Singapore will be also considered.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent by experience.
Closing Date: Sunday, 24 September 2023- 23:59 Singapore Time (GMT +8)

Main job responsibilities

APP Product Operation

;

title: Trainee Product Manager
company_info: DFI Retail Group (“Group”) is a leading pan-Asian retailer. At 30th June 2021, the Group and its associates and joint ventures operated over 10,000 outlets and employed some 230,000 team members. The Group had total annual sales in 2020 exceeding US$28 billion. The Group provides quality and value to Asian consumers by offering leading brands, a compelling retail experience and great service; all delivered through a strong store network supported by efficient supply chains. The Group (including associates and joint ventures) operates under a number of well-known brands across food, health and beauty, home furnishings, restaurants and other retailing, in particular Cold Storage, Giant, Guardian, 7-Eleven, Jasons and MarketPlace in Singapore. The Group’s parent company, Dairy Farm International Holdings Limited, is incorporated in Bermuda and has a standard listing on the London Stock Exchange, with secondary listings in Bermuda and Singapore. The Group's businesses are managed from Hong Kong by Dairy Farm Management Services Limited through its regional offices. DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group. In Singapore, The Group served as the largest and fast growing, retailer with more than 30 years’ experience. Since the first store opened in 1983, we are the emerging market leaders in "Best Practice" retail initiatives and technology with a team of over 6,500 employees in over 850 stores island-wide working together to deliver outstanding customers success in retail markets.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
DFI Retail Group (“Group”) is a leading pan-Asian retailer. At 30th June 2021, the Group and its associates and joint ventures operated over 10,000 outlets and employed some 230,000 team members. The Group had total annual sales in 2020 exceeding US$28 billion. The Group provides quality and value to Asian consumers by offering leading brands, a compelling retail experience and great service; all delivered through a strong store network supported by efficient supply chains. The Group (including associates and joint ventures) operates under a number of well-known brands across food, health and beauty, home furnishings, restaurants and other retailing.

DFI Retail Group is a member of the Jardine Matheson Group.

The Role
The successful candidate will be responsible to develop and implement strategic plans for assigned sub-categories within the framework of a disciplined sub-category management business process so as to achieve company’s financial goals and objectives, improve market share, customer satisfaction and productivity performance measures for the company. The candidate will be managing the administrative of the category management process, co-ordiante and assist in implementing and executing all action plans to achieve sub-category sales, profit and income goal and objects. The key responsibilities are as below:

Category Management
Achieve sub-category sales, profit and income goals and objectives through developing and implementing business plans for the assigned sub-categories
Develop, implement, and manage an optimum product mix that focuses on customers’ needs.
Develop and implement promotional trade plans that bring excitement and incremental sales and profitability to the stores
Maintain strong supplier partner relationships in the pursuit of the growth of the business
Manage sourcing of the right products internationally, which fits the demands of local customers
Perform periodic range reviews to maximize the sales and profitability performance
Develop and implement a competitive pricing strategy that delivers value to our customers
Establish collaborative retailer/supplier relationships to maximize income/terms/discounts to improve sales and profitability of assigned sub-category
Ensure compliance with the Company’s policies including but not limited to; the product inventory management process
Achieve reduction in shrink budget objectives through disciplined buying and inventory management processes
Work with Product Manager to extract and prepare weekly analysis report for submission to Senior Management
Participate, communicate and support a culture of learning, teamwork and sharing internally and externally with the stores, DFI business units in Singapore
Administrative
Manage all aspects of administration processes for new supplier partners and new product developments for assigned sub-categories
Ensure cost and price changes is reflected timely
Ensure new article creation is created timely
Support in the management of consignment related duties
Assist in the timely and accurate maintenance of promotions download, obtain sign off for press advertisment
Manage weekly promotion commitment and collations with Operations Team and supplier partners for assigned sub-categories
Coordination with respective suppliers on administrative updates
Ensure timely and accurate submission of documents for System maintenance
Support internal stakeholders and communicate any potential issues that may impact on business operations
Any ad-hoc duties as assigned

About You
Degree in Business, Retail Management or relevant discipline
Prior experience in providing administrative support for categories
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (e.g. Pivot Table, Vlookup)
Knowledge in SAP is beneficial
Good organizational and communication skills
Excellent stakeholders management

Benefits
Team Member Discount
Subsidized Medical and Dental Benefits
Training Opportunities
Career Advancement

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the Opportunity
We are seeking a Product Manager with a strong background in blockchain security. In this role, you will be responsible for guiding the development of security products and services, ensuring they meet the evolving needs of the blockchain and cryptocurrency market. You will be responsible for disclosing security research on web3 space vulnerabilities with the OKX WEB3 security team and external stakeholders.

What You’ll Be Doing:
Define and prioritize product requirements, working closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute product roadmaps.
Analyze market trends and competitive landscape to identify opportunities for new products and enhancements to existing products.
Collaborate with engineering, design, and marketing teams to ensure seamless product development and launch processes.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with customers and strategic partners, gathering feedback to inform product improvements and future development.
Track and report on product performance, using data-driven insights to optimize product strategy and drive growth.
Ensure that products adhere to the highest standards of security, regulatory compliance, and industry best practices.
Stay current on developments in blockchain security, including new threats, vulnerabilities, and mitigation techniques.
Min. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
3+ years of experience in product management, preferably within the blockchain, cryptocurrency, or cybersecurity industries.
Strong understanding of blockchain technology, security principles, and the evolving threat landscape.
Demonstrated success in launching and managing security products or services in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Nice to Haves:
Basic understanding of Solidity, Rust Python programming language
Figma, or other related design tool
Proficiency in SQL
EA Personnel: Celine Tan Si Ling

EA Licence No: 99C4599

Lead supplier development & management inclusive of supplier sourcing, onboarding, score-carding and improvement plans, aligning sub-tier capabilities, ensuring continuity of supply, and exceeding internal and external customer expectations.

Job Duties & Key Responsibilities
Define and execute a Global Sourcing strategy and vision that delivers on established financial targets
Coordinate with all business segments globally to obtain the best outcomes across all The company locations taking into consideration their long-range procurement needs
Articulate and execute a Sourcing roadmap that builds capabilities and resiliency needed for long-term growth and sustainability
Design a Sourcing organization that has the structure, process, technology, talent, metrics, and reporting needed to deliver the plan and build for the future
Develop a high-performing and motivated strategic sourcing team responsible for interfacing with business and supplier partners
Ensure stakeholder alignment and coordination via clearly articulated governance processes including definition of roles and responsibilities, decision rights and communication and coordination mechanisms
Manage the supplier relationship, ensuring our suppliers are aligned with our approach and held accountable for their performance
Review opportunities across The company business segments to synergize and consolidates buys
Sets the vision and objectives for the global supplier management organization and implements policies and practices that yield measurable results in cost, quality, and delivery.
Monitor and manage key supplier performance metrics, including periodic audits and business reviews.
Improve The company's supplier management system and metrics to mitigate risk related to non-conformances, delivery delays, capacity constraints, and sub-tier business continuity.
Lead the supplier identification, qualification & development process through validation of supplier technical and operational capabilities inclusive of First Article and or second sourcing activities.
Ensures materials are expedited, manages escalations with suppliers, coordinates information with internal and external stakeholders (customers), and drives issues to closure.
Drafts, negotiates, and executes long-term agreements and/or full-service supplier contracts, where appropriate, for assigned commodities; gains feedback and buy-in from appropriate departments such as legal, engineering, marketing, operations, quality, and from senior leadership
Develop and uses strategic sourcing tools to proactively conduct spend analysis, maintains cost models and metrics by supplier and commodity, and communicates overall supplier performance, trends in technologies, and market conditions with respect to assigned commodities
Job Requirements
Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Business or Engineering. MBA or equivalent experience preferred.
Possess 15 years of relevant experience, with exposure across multiple operational disciplines in a contract manufacturing environment.
Proficiency in at least two of the following areas: Procurement, Planning, Production Management, Master Scheduling, Factory Engineering, Logistics, Quality, and Program Management.
Strong understanding of a contract manufacturing environment and Bill of Material management.
Demonstrated record of managing and driving continuous process improvement.
Exceptional analytical skills to identify root causes and drive resolution.
Experience working with tier one ERP & PLM systems such as Oracle, SAP, Agile.
Proficient in Word processing/typing, presentation tools (PowerPoint, Power BI), and data entry/spreadsheet software.
Skills, Knowledge and Expertise
Knows of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, statistics, and their applications.
Analyzes information and evaluates results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
Identifies the underlying principles, reasons, facts, or information by breaking down information or data into separate parts.
Effectively communicates information and responds to questions in person-to-person and small group situations with customers, clients, the general public, and other employees of the organization.
Maintains confidentiality and uses discretion with business information.
Reads and understands documents such as policy manuals, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Writes routine reports and correspondence.
Utilizes common-sense understanding in order to carry out written, oral, or diagrammed instructions.
Deals with problems involving several known variables in situations of routine nature.
Plans the time, method, manner, and/or performance sequence of own work; may also occasionally assist in planning work assignments performed by others within a limited area of operation.
Frequently makes decisions of both minor and major importance, which may affect the work operations of other employees and/or clientele to a moderate degree.
Completes some moderately repetitive tasks.
Uses complex and noncomplex machines and equipment.

title: Senior / Product Manager
company_info: Doctor Anywhere is the leading telehealth provider in the region. With our strong network of established healthcare providers in Singapore, Doctor Anywhere is set to change the way you see a doctor. You can now consult a Doctor anytime, anywhere, and get medication delivered right to your doorstep island-wide. Shop for your daily health and wellness needs on our specially curated in-app Marketplace, and get access to items ranging from OTC medication, health-screenings and vaccinations, to nutritional supplements and lifestyle and fitness products – all in one place.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Doctor Anywhere:
Doctor Anywhere (DA) is a regional tech-enabled, omnichannel healthcare provider delivering care to 2.5 million users across 6 countries in Southeast Asia. Founded in 2017 with a mission to make healthcare simple, accessible, and efficient for all, DA leverages technology to enable individuals towards preventive, long-term health via holistic offerings including our telehealth app, physical clinics and pharmacies, mental wellness, specialist consults, and also an online health & wellness marketplace for supplements, healthy snacks, home-based health screening and vaccinations.
DA’s goal is to build a regional digital healthcare ecosystem, advanced by the 3,000 GPs and specialists within our regional network, over 1,000 corporate organisations, and 25 regional insurers we work with. Grounded in our motto “Keep Going, Keep Growing”, our team strives towards excellence, with innovation and collaboration at our core, and values diversity in perspectives brought by every member. Join us in our mission to transform Southeast Asia’s healthcare future!

About Product team:
With Doctor Anywhere driving to become a product-led organization, our Product team is responsible for shaping our product strategy, and striving to bring the best products and services to both our users and the future of Doctor Anywhere. Our team consists of passionate and talented and ambitious Product Managers and Designers who continuously evolve our products to maximize business value and improve user experience

We are seeking a Senior/Product Manager to join our Product team to enhance our overall product capabilities serving the needs of the healthcare industry.

As a Senior/Product Manager, you will:
· Define product vision and scale DA's suite of healthcare solutions
· Act as the voice of the users - Leverage data, user research, market analysis, and competitive landscape to drive product insights
· Create a product strategy to maximize business value and user satisfaction, align the strategy with the rest of the company, drive the implementation of the strategy, and measure success
· Collaborate with business stakeholders, Engineering, and Designers to build a feature or product that solves users’ pain points
· Break down complex business requirements into actionable solutions and develop user stories, roadmaps, and release plans

Minimum Requirements
· Bachelor’s degree in a related field
· 5+ years of experience in product management
· Experience in bringing at least one product from conception to launch
· Experience in managing consumer-facing applications across digital platforms such as native mobile apps, responsive web, interactive platforms
· Clear understanding of data, analytics, metrics and statistics
· Experience in working with engineering team and in Agile/Scrum development process
· Self-starter with relentless curiosity and creativity in pursuit of growth

Preferred Requirements
· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, or an equivalent technical field
· A/B testing experience
· Experience in working in an ambiguous environment

title: Lead Product Manager
company_info: Founded in 2011, Coda Payments (“Coda”) is the leading provider of secure, cross-border monetisation solutions for digital products and services in more than 60 markets. Through our three services: Codashop, xShop, and Codapay, we help top digital content publishers worldwide such as Activision Blizzard (Call of Duty: Mobile, Diablo Immortal), Riot Games (VALORANT, League of Legends: Wild Rift), Moonton (Mobile Legends: Bang Bang), Garena (Free Fire), Tencent (PUBG Mobile), beIN, Bigo Live, Tinder, and Viu to monetise their content and unlock new revenue streams. Headquartered in Singapore, Coda has 11+ offices and 35+ remote locations worldwide. To date, we have over 500 employees of 42 nationalities working together towards the same mission: to offer our customers the best value, experience and entertainment every day, without fail. In 2022, we have also been named the 5th fastest growing fintech company in the APAC by the Financial Times, the 13th fastest growing company in Singapore by the Straits Times, and a Technology Pioneer by the World Economic Forum.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What We Do
At Coda, we break down barriers between publishers and their audiences by thinking outside of the app. Coda is trusted by 300+ top digital content publishers – including industry giants Activision Blizzard, Bigo, Electronic Arts, Riot Games, and Zynga – to grow revenue, profit margins, and customer engagement in 60+ markets with ease. For publishers, this means less lift, more players and more payers. For players, Coda’s solutions allow them to pay for play their way.

Our winning formula? A laser-focused, pragmatic attitude coupled with an unwavering commitment to excellence. We are customer-centric, creative, and solution-oriented, always delivering to our users the top-tier entertainment content they want at competitive prices.

If you’re ambitious, bold and ready to take your career to the next level, get in touch!

Product Management at Coda
Our Product Managers are individuals with a strong analytical focus and a data-driven approach. Their role involves taking charge of product development from start to finish, with emphasis on analysis and experimentation to deliver the best possible product for our users. This involves driving the product strategy and working closely with senior leadership across various departments to design, build, and deliver exceptional experiences to our customers.

You will need to have a hands-on mentality and a growth mindset, spend considerable time with your scrum teams, and be enthusiastic about developing engineered processes and technologies to build solutions which drive organizational improvements.

As the Lead Risk Strategy Product Manager, you will be responsible for developing our anti-fraud systems that detect and prevent fraudulent activities. In this impactful role, you will be in charge of supervising the creation of our internal anti-fraud platform and increase the robustness of our payment services. You will closely collaborate with colleagues across Coda Payments' wide array of Pay ins, Payouts, and ecommerce products.
Responsibilities
Your primary focus is to deeply understand system threats and leverage a wide array of technologies to enhance product security, capabilities, and performance. Using this expertise, you'll lead strategy, execution, for our Risk Management System. As a technical expert with strong business acumen, you'll create proactive detection and protective mechanisms to secure our systems.
Defining a risk systems roadmap to meet our business objectives, fostering strong collaboration across teams and managing your product’s lifecycle end-to-end.
Collaborating with engineering, design, business stakeholders such as finance, accounting, publisher partnership and channel partnership to define a product roadmap.
Maintain a prioritised product backlog based on user feedback and business value.
Define success metrics and measure the impact of features you build.
Leading the team to deliver the roadmap through agile sprint cycles, breaking down the product roadmap into executable stories and requirements.
Creating feedback loops to understand stakeholders pain points and representing them sufficiently to the team.
Responsibilities
+5 years experience in digital product management, working with dominant globally established product lines with audience, reach, and revenue in the millions.
2+ years of experience in working on databases, schema design, analytics, BI, or data-oriented services products
A track record of successfully shipping product features against clearly defined success metrics
Proficient in SQL language, able to find problems and solve problems through data from the data platform
Experience working with complex data flows and architectures, demonstrating an ability to influence engineering roadmaps to improve products
Outcome focused, constantly seeking and identifying the most impactful opportunities, with clear and consistent principles for prioritization that maximize ROI.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with superior ability to articulate complex requirements to both technical and business audiences both small and large.
Creative problem solver, ready to do whatever it takes to make your product and team successful
Passionate about continuous product improvements through rapid experimentation & iteration, and optimization cycles.
Experience in entrepreneurship or a passion for tackling new, ground-up products, embracing the exciting journey of crafting inventive solutions in a constantly changing market.
Management Consultants looking to transition into a product management role are welcomed to apply.
Working at Coda
Joining the Coda team means diving into a fast-paced, challenging, and exciting world. With Codans spread across over 30 countries around the world, our highly collaborative environment breaks down time zones and cultural barriers, empowering you to chase innovative ideas, contribute to Coda’s growth, and make a lasting impact.
If you have a passion for pushing boundaries, and thrive on continuous improvement through experimentation, we'd love to hear from you!

Our Perks*
WFH Support: Get a monthly allowance to cover your work-from-home expenses and keep you connected.
Wellness Boost: Stay healthy with resources for physical and mental well-being with our flexible benefits and Employee Assistance Program - because you matter!
Customized Benefits: Tailor your benefits with our flexible plan.
Growth Opportunities: Unlock your potential through clear progression paths.
Skill Development: Access training resources to fuel your personal and professional growth.
Volunteer Time Off: Enjoy paid time off to make a difference in the world through volunteering.
Family Care: Take advantage of paid Family Care Leave to bond with your family, while our selected Flexible Benefits also cater to your family's needs.
*Benefits are reviewed and updated on a yearly basis

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, embracing the unique qualities of every individual, regardless of gender, race, age, religion, disability, or other local protected classes. Our goal is to foster an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome and valued.
Due to the large number of exceptional applications we receive, we can only reach out to shortlisted candidates. If you don't hear from us, rest assured there may be another opportunity at Coda that aligns better with your unique abilities. Remember to check our Careers Page for more exciting job openings!

title: Product Technical Manager
company_info: For the past 50 years, Housing & Development Board (HDB) has planned and shaped Singapore's unique skyline - building homes and towns and creating a world-class living environment for all. Throughout the years, continuous innovation and upgrading programmes have ensured that the heartlands remain our cherished home. Today, HDB has built more than one million residential units, housing over 80% of Singapore's population. With plans drawn up to transform new, middle-aged and mature HDB estates into more vibrant homes for Singaporeans, HDB has a plethora of responsibilities and projects which are driven by our people. In HDB, we have made it our mission to inspire and enable our staff to give of their best, as we strive to be an outstanding organisation - not just for our customers, but also for our staff.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us!
The mission of Housing & Development Board (HDB) is to provide affordable, quality housing and a great living environment where communities thrive. To achieve its mission, HDB aims to be data-driven to the core and adopt evidence-based decision making in developing better housing policies service, improving service delivery and optimising operations

· Work closely with Product Owner, Product Manager and Development Team on project schedule, issues and escalation
· Plan for and justify project IT resource allocation, including securing approval; monitor and track project resource usage
· Work with Product Owner and Product Manager to craft and refine user stories by providing technical analysis; and building the Product Backlog with prioritization
· Review and participate in technical proposal or solution, system design and architecture to ensure they are of quality, while adhering to all standards, governance, and policies
· Propose feasible ideas and solutions, or engage subject matter expert to provide aid and improve the quality of the product

· Review and ensure that all documentations are complete and of quality

· Minimal 3 years business analyst experience in software development projects
· Minimal 2 years experience working in an Agile environment and Cloud platform

· Process good communication skills, ability to articulate technology concepts, participate in discussions on requirements with stakeholders
· Process strong collaboration skills, ability to partner and work effectively across teams and with business stakeholders in development as well as problem solving

· Experience with Confluence and JIRA will be an added advantage
· Experience with BPM modelling techniques and methods will be an added advantage

Good to Have:
- Great Attitude to bring the best out our team
- Team Player; we work together as a team
- Autonomous
- Take ownership
- Eagerness to learn and
- Impart new skills, exhibit structured and analytical thinking

Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract in the first instance. Conversion to perm is dependent on good performance.
