title: Sr Manager, Head of Product
company_info: AMAZON ASIA-PACIFIC HOLDINGS PRIVATE LIMITED Amazon is guided by four principles: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking. Amazon strives to be Earth’s most customer-centric company, Earth’s best employer, and Earth’s safest place to work. Customer reviews, 1-Click shopping, personalized recommendations, Prime, Fulfillment by Amazon, AWS, Kindle Direct Publishing, Kindle, Career Choice, Fire tablets, Fire TV, Amazon Echo, Alexa, Just Walk Out technology, Amazon Studios, and The Climate Pledge are some of the things pioneered by Amazon.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Amazon Fresh APAC team is looking for an exceptionally motivated and talented Senior Manager to oversee business growth strategy and end to end customer experience (CX) including delivery experience (DEX) for both Japan and Singapore market segment. The customer demands and shopping activities of grocery in Asia have become increasingly diverse (and COVID-19 accelerated this diversity. Lots of customers started using online grocery, at the same time we see more competition), hence we Amazon Fresh team is required to explore further innovation and establish the best fit business model for each marketplace through various different customer facing services, delivery speed, and fees.
This position leads and drives business strategy, tech roadmap management and regional specific initiatives/experiments working closely with partner teams across NA, EU and APAC to effectively connect the needs of customer that drives incremental growth for APAC grocery business. Our vision is to be the first grocery shopping destination for customers through the best in class service and technologies in terms of convenience, selection and delivery services.
As a Head of Product Management, you will manage 2-3 directs reports (Product Managers across Japan and Singapore), and be responsible for followings by leveraging your team resources (1) developing business strategy (10 yr projection = North Star, 3YF, OP1/OP2) working closely with APAC Country Leader and WW Fresh senior leaders, (2) driving critical initiatives and experiments (e.g. Fee, Different Speed of Delivery, Service Area Expansion, New Payment Method, New Service proposition for customers), (3) manages tech roadmap for APAC to sustainably accelerate the business growth working closely with WW stakeholders, and (4) contribute to the long term business strategy and path to profit. This role works with wide ranged stakeholders: multiple global organizations who own business strategy, technical roadmap and resource, Japan/Singapore local business leaders, Prime, Central Mktg, Operations, Finance, Legal, PR, HR, and Product compliance/Food Safety. Due to the breadth of scope and complexity of each area, and relatively early business phase, a successful candidate will be; highly motivated to build a new business model, eagerly learning from other regions/experiments, Big thinker, Analytical, Simplifier, Result Driven and Effective and thoughtful communicator with Openness for diversity.
Key job responsibilities
Develop vision and strategy for long, mid, and short term for Amazon Fresh APAC business growth
Plan, execute, and monitor key initiatives to drive business innovation and financial results in Customer Experience (Selection, Pricing, Marketing, Customer facing services), and Delivery Experience (package innovation, variety of delivery speed, unattended)
Work backward from customers’ needs, and translate them into product roadmap or initiative. Not just managing global tech roadmap, but also working for regional initiatives (e.g. local payment options, Points and other royalty program)
Work cross-functionally with global business and technology teams, local business and operations leaders, executives, and other business functions (e.g. Finance, Legal, PR, Food Safety) to deliver high-quality and scalable solutions
Define, prioritize, and plan resources across functions to deliver to the desired business outcome
Basic qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business, or Finance
10+ years proven experience in Consulting, Business development, Business leader with P&L responsibilities, or Product Management in diverse/international environment
Superior analytical and quantitative skills; experience using data and metrics to test theories, confirm assumptions, and measure success
Proven experience delivering results by partnering with and influencing others through global collaboration
Ability to effectively manage relationships at senior levels in both internal and external stakehodlers
Preferred qualifications
MBA or Master’s Degree in Business, or Finance
Ability to challenge preconceived norms, drive consensus and accelerate growth while improving efficiencies
High degree of organizational ability to manage multiple and competing priorities
Demonstrated ability to attract, develop, and keep high quality multi-disciplinary teams
Proven experience in running a business or product line with P&L accountability

title: VP of Product
company_info: Hubble is a leading technology company focusing on the construction and engineering industry. We are on a mission to build the world’s first autonomous construction sites by automating and trading the 4M (Man, Machine, Material, Money) resources. Our solutions help digitise all your work processes, and connect all key project stakeholders - developers, consultants, fabricators, contractors, and facility managers - onto an all-in-one platform - The Hubble Platform. Build faster and cheaper and with the highest quality and safety standards with Hubble’s impactful technologies. Let’s transform the way we build our cities for a better tomorrow. Today. Together. For generations to come. Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow
job_category: Building and Construction, General Management, Information Technology
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What you will be doing:

We are looking for a VP of Product who will play a part in developing solutions that will completely revolutionize the construction industry. You will get to work closely with the CEO and be in charge of projects as you play a crucial role in aligning stakeholders and executing our product roadmap. You are responsible for a business’s product planning and execution all through the lifecycle of the business.
Work with C-level management to develop customized and impactful software solutions for clients.
Define the organizational vision that Hubble needs to be successful in scaling our end to end product lines.
Foster and sponsor innovation in our suite of products and identify new opportunities that will accelerate our technical capabilities and reduce the time to market of our products.
Bridge communications between business and engineering in order to prioritise feature development to deliver best-in-class products with strong market fit.
Build a sustainable talent pipeline and grow healthy, creative, empowered and autonomous product teams.
Drive excellence and mentor younger product managers and designers on best practices in the field of Product Management and UIUX.
Interface with Product Engineering and IT Operations to ensure appropriate systems are in place to achieve goals.
What we need from you:
5+ years of leading product teams with a consistent record of developing talent.
8+ years preferred of product management experience overseeing the design, development and launch of successful services, with at least 3 years of multi-level management (manager of managers).
Experience working in both highly agile environments as well as large product development efforts.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to take the initiative to forward team goals.
Enjoy solving complex problems with technology.
Strong business acumen, team player, results-oriented.
Experience and exposure to the construction industry preferred.
Experience in B2B product development is a nice to have.
About Hubble:

Hubble is a leading construction management platform that seamlessly connects stakeholders across the entire value chain to build better, faster, safer, and more cost-effective projects. Our company was founded in 2016 with a mission to automate construction and build wealth for our clients.

Today, we are proud to have automated more than 300 construction sites worth over $50 billion worldwide. Our full suite of software solutions include document, workforce, safety, quality, material, payments, and building management, and are used daily by over 90,000 users from 3,700 companies.

Headquartered in Singapore, we operate from offices in Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, and the Philippines. Our team of passionate and diverse professionals is dedicated to transforming the built environment by building autonomous construction sites through innovative technology and collaborative partnerships.

What Hubble will give you:

Hubble is built by a team of talented, driven, and ambitious individuals. We do not subscribe to conventions. We do not let history and traditions dictate and limit our dreams to shape the world. We adopt the same mindset with our hiring. We are looking for the best and we want to bet on you. If your mindset is right, we promise you the ride of your life.

Who will you be working with:
Purpose driven
Hungry, ambitions, and self-motivated
Meritocratic, results/performance > age/bureaucracy
Resourceful, independent, chart our own destiny
Determined, perseverance, and hard working
Creative, innovative, out of the box
Yes, the above is everyone of us at Hubble.
Visit us at www.hubble.build to learn more for #bettercitiesoftomorrow

title: Chief Product Officer
company_info: Doctor Anywhere is the leading telehealth provider in the region. With our strong network of established healthcare providers in Singapore, Doctor Anywhere is set to change the way you see a doctor. You can now consult a Doctor anytime, anywhere, and get medication delivered right to your doorstep island-wide. Shop for your daily health and wellness needs on our specially curated in-app Marketplace, and get access to items ranging from OTC medication, health-screenings and vaccinations, to nutritional supplements and lifestyle and fitness products – all in one place.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Doctor Anywhere:
Doctor Anywhere (DA) is a regional tech-enabled, omnichannel healthcare provider delivering care to 2.5 million users across 6 countries in Southeast Asia. Founded in 2017 with a mission to make healthcare simple, accessible, and efficient for all, DA leverages technology to enable individuals towards preventive, long-term health via holistic offerings including our telehealth app, physical clinics and pharmacies, mental wellness, specialist consults, and also an online health & wellness marketplace for supplements, healthy snacks, home-based health screening and vaccinations.
DA’s goal is to build a regional digital healthcare ecosystem, advanced by the 3,000 GPs and specialists within our regional network, over 1,000 corporate organisations, and 25 regional insurers we work with. Grounded in our motto “Keep Going, Keep Growing”, our team strives towards excellence, with innovation and collaboration at our core, and values diversity in perspectives brought by every member. Join us in our mission to transform Southeast Asia’s healthcare future!

About Product Team
With Doctor Anywhere driving to become a product-led organization, our Product team is responsible for shaping our product strategy, and striving to bring the best products and services to both our users and the future of Doctor Anywhere. Our team consists of passionate, talented and ambitious Product Managers and Designers who continuously evolve our products to maximize business value and improve user experience.

About the Role
We are seeking a Head of Product to join and lead our Product team. This leadership role will direct the strategy, vision, and execution of our product portfolio. The successful candidate will possess a unique blend of business acumen, technical expertise, and analytical skills. They will not only drive the strategic direction of our product line but also foster a creative and collaborative environment within the team. This role will work closely with multiple stakeholders to deliver innovative and impactful healthcare solutions.

As our Head of Product, you will:
Provide leadership and strategic direction to the product management and product design teams.
Oversee the conception, design, development, and management of innovative healthcare products for our B2C and B2B segments.
Own the product roadmap and strategy, working closely with various stakeholders (internal teams, customers, partners) to understand market needs and trends.
Drive the implementation of product vision and strategy across all product lines, ensuring alignment with the company's goals and market demand.
Collaborate with the engineering, data, marketing, sales, operations, and customer success teams to ensure product development aligns with market trends, customer needs, and business objectives.
Develop and manage the end-to-end product lifecycle, including conceptualization, launch, performance tracking, and iterative improvement.
Drive user-centric design and decision making, backed by data analysis, user feedback, usability findings, and market trends.
Serve as an effective communicator and advocate for the product team, building strong relationships with other teams and stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant field. An MBA or equivalent is a plus.
Proven experience in product management, ideally within a healthcare tech company. Experience in a B2B and B2C environment is highly desirable.
Demonstrable experience in leading and managing a product team during a scale-up phase.
Strong understanding of the healthcare industry, telehealth services, and healthcare insurance is a plus.
Proven track record in delivering successful and innovative digital products to market.
Excellent leadership, communication, and decision-making skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
Knowledge of user-centered design principles and practices.
Ability to work cross-functionally and influence without authority.

title: APAC Expansion Lead - Asset Products
company_info: Who we are TransferWise was founded in 2011 with a clear mission: Money without borders - so people and businesses can send and receive any currency effortlessly, whenever, wherever. The heart of what we do is international money transfer. We’re committed to making it instant, convenient and fair for millions of people, all over the world. And we’re growing our other products and our teams at an exciting pace. And we’re looking for the very best to jump on board. What it’s really like to work here At TransferWise, we do things a bit differently. There’s no corporate nonsense, and no old-fashioned hierarchy. Instead, we work in dozens of self-sufficient, autonomous teams. Think of them like start-ups within a start-up that learn from each other. Each team picks the problems they want to solve. So there’s no micro-management. No hiding behind fancy job titles. And no one telling you what to do. You are your own boss. But you’ll get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues from all over TransferWise. We’re going to be upfront — the way we work doesn’t suit everyone. But if freedom, autonomy, and life-affirming, head-scratching professional challenges rock your world, we could be a match made in heaven.
address: PAYA LEBAR QUARTER, 1 PAYA LEBAR LINK 408533
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Wise was launched in 2011 with the vision of making international money transfers fast, cheap, fair, and simple. Today we’re about much more than just moving money. We’re building the world’s best international account experience.
In 2022, Wise launched Assets in Singapore, a new type of account. Assets allows customers to back the money they hold with Wise through different asset classes such as stocks or bonds while retaining the instant access and spend functionality of a checking account.
We’re looking for an Expansion Lead to join our Singapore office. You’ll be responsible for expanding the Assets product across APAC, one of Wise’s fastest growing markets, building strong commercial and regulatory relationships to enable the best product experience for our customers.
You’ll work closely with the Assets Product team, an autonomous team within Wise consisting of Product Managers, Designers, Engineers, Product Compliance and Operations. You’ll provide the team with local financial markets expertise, shaping the product vision and helping change the future of finance. This isn’t just a job, it’s a revolution!
Your Mission:
1 - Expand the Assets product across APAC
Lead and manage the end-to-end process of expanding the product to new markets across APAC, such as Australia, New Zealand, Malaysia and Japan, by collaborating with the wider APAC regional banking and expansion team
Analyse the optimal route to market for the Assets product in these markets, taking into account how customer needs differ by market, product functionality and regulatory requirements.
Build a good relationship with regulatory authorities to ensure a smooth licensing process and success once the licence is granted
Ensure that the operating model agreed with regulators is efficient and aligns with our product and customers needs.
Source and / or hire any personnel that may be required to obtain the licence such as a local compliance officer or financial controller
Liaise closely with teams across Wise such as Product, Engineering, Operations, Finance and Compliance to ensure that we have the necessary resources and processes in place to successfully sustain operations
2 - Build strong commercial relationships
Identify new commercial relationships with investment managers, banks and payments partners to optimise the product experience for customers in terms of price, coverage and available asset classes
Onboard new partners and negotiate contracts, taking into account commercial priorities as well as risks
Manage our existing commercial relationships to ensure that they are delivering the best outcomes for our customers in terms of price and coverage
3 - Identify new strategic opportunities
Shape the product vision and roadmap alongside the Product Manager, thinking about our customer needs, blockers and opportunities
Work closely with the Product Manager and the wider team to prioritise opportunities taking into consideration the product roadmap, resource and product build requirements
Identify and size new product ideas to test, build, and launch.
You may be a good fit if:
Led the end-to-end process for expanding financial services products to new markets, including scoping route to market and applying for new licences from local regulators
You are familiar with the financial services industry and understand different financial products and how they work, as well as their risks and target markets. Specific market knowledge and experience in Singapore and / or Australia would be beneficial.
You have negotiated commercial relationships with a clear product vision and understanding in mind. You are able to figure out the ideal operational and commercial process with new partners
You are familiar with how fund managers and financial institutions work. You are strong at managing those relationships and are constantly creating opportunities to improve them
You have fresh ideas - You don’t accept the status quo, but are interested in solving problems in novel ways. You are able to communicate the impact of those ideas, gather stakeholder buy-in, and formulate plans to implement them
You are passionate about our mission and transforming the financial industry for good
You have flexibility for some international travel (around 10-20% of time)
Requirements:
4-7 years work experience within financial services, financial technology, startup or technology companies
Detailed knowledge of financial systems including banking and investments infrastructure, payment rails, regulatory agencies and regulations
Ability to structure and independently lead commercial relationships (e.g., clients, service providers or other partners) and cross-functional projects, including demonstrated ability to align closely with Product, Engineering, Operations, and Compliance teams with a solid track record of execution
Excellent verbal and written communications including executive-level presentation, negotiation, and communication skills
Proficiency in financial and business analysis.
Qualifications:
Be willing to obtain the relevant qualifications to act as an Authorised Representative of the firm, registered with the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). This includes:
The following modules from the Singapore Capital Markets and Financial Advisory Services (CMFAS) qualification:
M1A Rules and Regulations for Dealing in Securities (for members of the Singapore Exchange Securities Trading Limited (“SGX-ST”)
M1B Rules and Regulations for Dealing in Securities (Non SGX-ST members)
M6 Securities Products and Analysis
M6A Securities and Futures Product Knowledge
Alternatively you can hold a recognised qualification or degree recognised by MAS as equivalent to the CMFAS - please see Annex 1 and Annex 1a of the MAS Guidance.
Candidates who existingly hold CMFA M1/M1B and M6/M6A is a plus

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a renowned food manufacturing company known for producing a diverse range of high-quality, delicious food products. From fresh bakery items like bread and pastries to a variety of frozen and packaged goods. Their production plant located in the West of Singapore is now looking for a Engineering Manager responsible in managing the whole maintenance team as well as to lead major plant improvement projects.

➤ Basic $6500 - $8000 + AWS + Variable Bonus
➤ 5 Days (Office Hours) - Clementi area


Responsibilities
Lead a team of engineering supervisors and shift engineers to diagnose mechanical and electrical breakdowns, assessing the best course of action and conducting a root cause investigation to eliminate the likelihood of re- occurrence.
Project lead for all installations, overhaul of equipment and plant, working with suppliers to ensure they deliver on time, on budget and with minimum disruption
Lead the implementation of a factory wide PM system using the current Process Control System, and ensuring PM activity is carried out during factory downtime at the correct frequency to an agreed standard.
Effective manage an Engineering team including performance management, training and development
Ensure that all projects are engineered to scope, budget and relevant standard and regulatory compliance.
Fulfilling a key role within part of the site management team, being fully accountable and reporting on assets and ancillary plant downtime across site.
Lead all on site preventative maintenance activities.
Budgetary management/control, responsibility for the day to day management of the site repair and maintenance budgets
Implement safe systems work and managing 3rd party site engineering works, liaising with the operations team to ensure that plant critical repairs minimize plant disruption or managed out of hours.
Upholding GMP engineering standards across site, 3rd party technical customer audits & statutory inspections are passed any non-conformances are closed out with root cause analysis to avoid repeat failure.
Continuous improvement of engineering ways of working to ensure improved equipment performance. A six sigma qualification would be desirable but not essential however knowledge of continuous tools and techniques is essential
Lead the implementation of autonomous maintenance deployment process across the site.
Responsible for maintaining and improvement of all engineering assets and developing an asset care strategy
Setup an effective Engineering planning function, leading the development of Job Libraries and codifying repair

Requirements
Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering
Minimum 7 year's management experience in engineering, project and maintenance management within food manufacturing industry.
Demonstrates understanding of project management and engineering from a technical and operational point of view
Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
Excellent planning, organizational skills and sense of urgency
Background of hands-on experiences from new line installation project and/or focus improvement project will be advantageous

company_info: MolyWorks Materials is a USA and Singapore-based deep-tech and circular economy company that disrupts the metal industry by providing eco-friendly and high-quality metal powder for the Additive Manufacturing (“AM”) industry. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Position and Description

Founded in 2015 as Molyworks, Continuum is a sustainable metal recycling company, with locations across the United States and in Singapore. Creator of The Greyhound, a patented compact foundry revolutionizing metal manufacturing. The Greyhound eliminates reliance on external supply chains, and enables customized, controlled and internal circularity, unique to each manufacturer’s needs. Continuum deploys Greyhound technology globally to produce a wide variety of metal powders locally.

We are looking for an experienced manufacturing operation manager/deputy manager to support the production of metal powder in Singapore.

Some of the key job responsibilities include:
· Lead and support the operation ramp-up plan to full production.
· Manage the sieve department and a team of technicians.
· Initiate and support technical and cost saving projects.
· Provide technical supports to the sales team.
· Lead the technical issue troubleshooting and root cause analysis.
· Lead and facilitate plant preventive and maintenance procedures.
· Ensure compliance to audits, Quality, Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) and other relevant industry standards.
· Support other operation matters.

Job requirement
· A Bachelor's degree in engineering or another related field.
· A minimum of 10 years of working experience, preferably in the manufacturing/operation.
· Familiarity with additive manufacturing or sieving is a plus.
· Excellent attention to detail.
· Ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of management, both internally and externally.
· Proven analytical thinking and decision-making.
· Self-motivated, proactive, hands-on, and able to work autonomously.
· Fluent in English and a second language of choice.
· Singapore Citizen/Singapore PR.

Roles & Responsibilities
About the company
With a history dating back over a century, my client is a global technology company that specializes in the automotive aftermarket industry covering both passenger, commercial and the industrial sector.
As part of their growth strategy, they are looking for a Category Manager to be based in Singapore to oversee regional strategy to be aligned with the company”s revenue growth targets and ensuring company product offerings meet the evolving needs of the market.

About the role
Reporting to the Head of Industrial Aftermarket
You will work closely with to develop and execute comprehensive category strategies such as market analysis, competitor landscape, product selection and pricing strategies in order to meet the targeted global P&L for product group and drive product line sales in the region
Maintain company”s competitiveness by consistently updating product portfolio such as IAM / OES / Service Channels within the category
Identifying opportunities to expand offerings and introduce new products based on market trends, consumer”s trend
This would require you to stay informed about the industry and using it to drive product innovation and competitiveness by working closely with internal teams such as marketing, sales, quality assurance to ensure products are constantly exceeding customer expectations
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of category management efforts and provide regular reports and make data-driven recommendations to senior management to make improvements to product/services
Skills and experience required
Min 8 years of relevant experience with regional/ international industry knowledge
Analytical mindset with the ability to make data-driven decisions
Experience in category management, product management, specifications and development process
If you are interested in the position, please click “apply” David Lerh (EA:94C3609/ R1769977)

title: Store Manager (Power Door)
company_info: WE ARE ALL ABOUT SNEAKERS! With more than 2500 stores across the world, Foot Locker is the leading global athletic footwear and apparel retailer. Our close partnerships with the ultimate top brands mean that we will constantly provide you with the best, most exclusive ranges of products there is. At Foot Locker, we live sneakers, we breathe sneakers, we dream sneakers… Sneakers are all we think about and nothing makes us more proud than being able to keep our followers up to date with the latest trends. For more than 30 years, our collections have been curated by sneaker heads for sneaker heads. Only the best, most relevant and exciting products ever make it onto our shelves and onto our online catalogues. “If it is at Foot locker, then it is approved!” This is the word on the street. Whether you are a long time dedicated sneaker lover or casually searching for a fresh new pair of shoes, Foot Locker has you covered, from the feet up. Don’t forget to peek into our fantastic range of apparel and accessories too! And keep in mind: most of our products you won’t be able to find anywhere else! On European soil only, Foot Locker means more than 620 stores in premium locations, across 20 countries and closing in on 30 years of history. Foot Locker Europe also means an elevated digital experience for our ever-increasing fan base, throughout a brand-new exciting website and vibrant interactive social media platforms. Last but not least, Foot Locker is an established intricate element of the European street culture, sneaker scene and athletic lifestyle. We thrive to always give back to the community and we are involved in countless events and happenings throughout the continent. Parties, sport competitions, social gatherings, sneaker shows… There is always a Foot Locker event going on, at any time. Stay tuned and keep your sneaker lifestyle alive and kicking with Foot Locker!
description:

The role also requires significant interaction with the respective District Manager and Head Office team on matters including employee relations, logistics, product management, and marketing / visual merchandising campaigns.

title: Software and Application Manager
company_info: About us Stellar Trading Systems is an independent software vendor (ISV) developing cutting-edge, multi-asset trading systems for professional traders. An established leader in the industry with clients ranging from major FCMs and financial institutions to hedge funds and proprietary trading groups, Stellar has built a reputation for performance, stability, and innovation. We are a global company operating at the forefront of technology. Our people utilise the latest low latency trading technologies to provide mission critical, real-time electronic trading applications. Along with a competitive salary and bonus eligibility, plus there is also opportunity for international travel
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the role: Software and Application Manager (on site)
As a Software and Application Manager you join an award-winning support team and will work directly with our clients to understand, troubleshoot, and resolve issues with complex trading strategies. Direct lines of communication with our software and infrastructure engineers to help you gain valuable experience and expertise.
You will work with the very latest in low latency trade execution technologies and will be responsible to supervise the planning and delivery of our trading solutions across our global distributed architecture.
This is a technical role based in our Singapore Downtown office. Supporting our global client base and working as part of a global team, communication is key – both with clients and with colleagues across multiple teams and time zones.
You will be required to:
● Review and provide technical support and expert advice throughout all technical stages of projects, change requests, including all testing cycles (system integration testing, User acceptance testing) to mitigate any security and risk factors and maintain best practices for our trading solutions
● Hands-on business analysis working with complex business processes and front to back flows
● Work with Technology infrastructure to ensure that Technology operations risks can be minimized
● Liaise with internal teams, customers, and partner exchanges to coordinate the development of new features and functionality with the Stellar software system, from initial requirements analysis through to proof of concept, implementation and then production deployment.
● Respond promptly to support requests and enquiries from clients.
● Monitor the performance and stability of the deployment solutions, and collate feedback from end users.
● Work directly with new customers to coordinate the deployment and configuration of the company’s products.
● Manage distribution and installation of software enhancements and upgrades
● Work directly with various exchanges and our software engineers to test and conform new software releases.
● Work with our infrastructure team to test and complete various server and network upgrade projects.

About you
● With a Computer Science, Information Technology, or related technical degree, you will have experience supporting Linux server applications or have a working knowledge of Linux based operating systems and be familiar with command line tools such as vi, grep, sed and awk.
● You will have strong analytical skills and be able to perform complex log file analysis, allowing you to identify the root cause of issues. You will take pride in identifying and implementing the best solution.
● Working directly with clients in an exciting front-office environment, you can thrive in high pressure or time critical situations and be willing to assume responsibility, making timely decisions including when to escalate issues.
● You will enjoy working with and exploring new technologies related to low-latency and algorithmic trading strategies. You will be able to effectively communicate your ideas, proposals, or solutions to a wide range of technical and non-technical audiences.
● You may have previous experience managing applications that connect to any of the major global derivatives exchanges such as CME, SGX or OSE and be familiar with various exchange protocols such as OmNet, ITCH/OUCH and FIX.

How to Apply
Please email your CV to careers@stellartradingsystems.com

title: Hiring For Product Owner / Manager
company_info: PATH INFOTECH PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
· Ensure overall success of a project, or a platform, by ensuring that prioritized user stories are delivered on time, within budget, meet business requirements and comply with governance framework, including security and resiliency.
· Manage and monitor product backlog and MVP, risk and change management to ensure delivery of MVP on schedule, within scope and budget.
· Plan and manage product backlog and MVP, its objectives and desired outcomes, and ensure alignment of the business outcomes of the Authority.
· Plan and lead the development of the business case/concept paper and funding.
· Plan and lead the overall procurement activities, in particular tender specifications compilation, tendering, tender evaluation, recommendation and award.
· Lead the development of the overall product backlog and MVP schedule and activities based on the appropriate methodology including identifying dependency, critical path, milestones and deliverables.
· Build comprehensive product roadmap and ensure all team members are on-board with delegated tasks and activities.
· Conduct regular work group meetings and provide progress and status reports to stakeholders.
· Perform stakeholder management, including keeping the relevant stakeholders informed of the status the product development on a timely and regular basis.
· Manage processes and procedures covering issue and risk management.
· Conduct Agile ceremonies such as but not limited to sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and sprint retrospective etc.
1. What we are looking for
· CSM (Certified Scrum Master) or CSPO (Certified Scrum Product Owner) or AIPMM (Agile Certified Product Manager and Product Owner).
· Hands-on experience in Agile product management.
· ICT product management and people management skills.
· Knowledge of the Singapore Government’s and/or Authority’s procurement and governance processes will be an added advantage.
· Knowledge of design thinking and workshop facilitation will be an added advantage.
· Results and customer oriented.
· Proven ICT project/product management experience, preferably in medium to large scale ICT projects in government sector.
· Hands-on, delivery focused and pragmatic.
· Possess a proven and successful track record in delivering complex IT projects/programs.
· Hands-on IT professional with full SLDC lifecycle experience.
· Strong understanding and experience of Singapore Government security standards and compliance.

title: Product Manager, Vietnam (Website Operations)
company_info: Our Products and Core Competence Digital Advertising We have long-term and in-depth cooperation with global Internet tycoons such as Apple, Baidu, Facebook, Google and Tiktok, helping leading enterprises in games, e-commerce, software, finance, entertainment, business services to expand their businesses in China, Singapore, Japan, South Korea, India, Canada and other countries. Our clients include Tanwan, Xijiade, Bingz, Xishanju, Jctrans, etc. Data & Artificial Intelligence The experience in the past decade has enabled us to form an Internet marketing intelligent model to provide low-cost traffic purchasing solutions for customers. The combination of artificial intelligence model and customer insight further improves the cost-effectiveness of customer service. On this basis, we also provide customers with big data analysis tools to track and analyze advertising effects and traffic. Digital Government The development trend of global digitization, networking, and intelligence has made big data, cloud computing, and digital government a significant component of national competitiveness. Based on our vision and mission, promoting the enterprise globalization cannot do without the efficiency and openness of the government, therefore we are committed to further improving the governance capabilities through digital government projects to boost enterprises’ global development.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job duties and responsibilities:
• Responsible for the operation of the company's product matrix, including browser products, sports products, film and television products, in the Vietnamese market, and accountable for the end-to-end user experience.
• Understand the market characteristics of browser products, sports products, film and television products, and other products with local features in Vietnam. Understand, analyze, and explore the local user demands specific to Vietnam, and be responsible for the product experience.
• Develop operational strategies that align with the local market in Vietnam, responsible for the operation and post-launch evaluation of products, and continuously drive product iteration and optimization.
• Collaborate with multiple departments, oversee production, ensure the complete implementation of operational activities, and be accountable for the effectiveness of the activities.

Job requirements:
• Proficient in both Vietnamese and English, with excellent communication and writing skills in both languages.
• In-depth understanding of the local internet industry in Vietnam, with a preference for those passionate about sports and film/television.
• Possess strong user perception and understanding, critical thinking, result orientation, logical thinking, data sensitivity, and innovative abilities.
• Enjoy learning and exploring, with knowledge of user experience and business model innovations in the industry.

title: TikTok Solutions Product Manager - Global Payment
company_info: Founded in 2019, Global Payment's mission is to be "Payment inclusion, Financial Inclusion, Enrich Life." Global Payments provides End-to-end payments and treasury management in a single solution to Bytedance Group, optimize conversion by offering seamless payments and authentication.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve.
Join us.

The TikTok Solution team is responsible for providing support to all business lines within the ByteDance Group with their global payment solutions. The team is dedicated to delivering global payment solutions that meet the business development requirements of each business line, and assists them in providing comprehensive payment solutions for rapid expansion with a focus on optimizing the user payment experience while ensuring the security of funds.
We are seeking a dynamic Payment & User Operations Manager to improve our payment and user operations in different Bytedance oversea business lines. This role involves overseeing payment processes, ensuring seamless transactions, optimizing user experiences, and increasing the payment user base. The ideal candidate possesses a strong background in both payment systems and user engagement.

Responsibilities:
Payment Operations:
- Optimize payment processing workflows and products to enhance payment success rate, minimize errors, and reduce costs.
- Monitor payment trends, data, and metrics to identify anomalies, trends, and opportunities for improvement.
- Collaborate with product, RD, finance, compliance, and customer support teams to ensure seamless payment operations and resolve any payment-related issues.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance the user experience throughout the payment journey.
- Develop and implement strategies to improve user engagement, retention, and satisfaction.
- Analyze user feedback and behavior to identify pain points and areas for improvement in the payment process.

Qualifications:
- Familiar with the payment industry, with more than 15+ years of experience in acquiring, disbursement or payment channel products;
- Familiar with European, American, Middle East or South East Asia payment markets;
- Familiar TikTok LIVE Stream, creator monetization markets.
- OTA payment experience in the global payment market. Experience working in tech companies is a plus;
- Content/activities Operation or experience in online forums is a plus;
- Data analysis ability, able to identify problems through data;
- Good communication skills and effectively collaborate with multiple teams to achieve goals;



ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

title: Product Marketing Manager
company_info: Wallex Technologies is B2B cross-border payment provider and a cash management solutions for businesses.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
Become an expert on our customers - who they are, how they buy and their key buying criteria. Understand customers' pain points and regularly initiate user research.
Aggressively research and analyze the competitive landscape, identify key consumer trends and opportunities.
Create ideas to solve customer challenges, put them into action with product feature builds and close the loop with go-to-market execution that optimizes ROI
Come up with compelling positions, marketing messages that positively influence clients' and users' experience.
Own the assigned product/s , it’s marketing deliveries and promoting them to the market.
You will develop product assets to support sales enablement including presentations, fact sheets, ROI calculators, blogs, white papers, webinars, videos
Liaise with internal stakeholders (UI / UX Designers, content creators, lead gen, engineers, data scientists, quants & business development teammates), as well as external stakeholders (vendors & key partners) throughout the product life cycle, from requirements to rollout.
Work closely with the Product team to influence the product roadmap and strategies. Be the advocate for the brand in product design and delivery discussions.
Working with our product and customer success team, you’ll organise and host discussions and user forums to gather feedback and establish credibility
Use data extensively to identify key factors to acquire and retain customers, increase users' return rate, spending, and repurchase rate.
What we are looking for :
At least 2-3 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA).
Having prior experience in other b2b saas tech / fintech company for at least 1-2 years is advantageous.
Successful track record focused in the area of product marketing.
You have a start-up mentality and a willingness to help out wherever needed
You are detail oriented with sharp business acumen , anticipating gaps or roadblocks before they arise.
You are able to use data to drive decision making, with a strong track record of setting and delivering against measurable goals.
Strong communication skills with the ability to multitask.
Knowledge and experience with sales and marketing tools such as Hubspot, Marketo, AEM and Google Analytics.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Promote awareness of proactive product stewardship
Offer product safety and regulatory guidance to product development and new markets
Lead sustainability assessments on polyurethane strategic business units portfolio on regulatory risk and engage stakeholders for substance substitution plans review.

Address customer and supplier inquiries related to product safety and green procurement.

Support Responsible Care audits and eco-label certifications.

Contribute to product stewardship strategy development.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
1. JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Title
Assistant Production Engineer

Job Description & Requirements

Overview

As an Production Engineer (Senior / Assistant), you will assist the Production Manager in managing the Overall Operation of Precast Cconstruction Plant. You are to adhere to Quality, Environmental, Safety Management System in accordance with Company’s standards and customers’ requirements.

Responsibilities

1) Identifies operational problems by observing and studying system functioning and performance results; investigating complaints and suggestions; interviewing process supervisors and operators; completing troubleshooting procedures.

2) Identifies operational priorities by assessing operational objectives; determining project objectives, such as, efficiency, cost savings, energy conservation, operator convenience, safety, environmental quality; estimating relevance, time, and costs.

3) Develops operational solutions by defining, studying, estimating, and screening alternative solutions; calculating economics; determining impact on total system.

4) Anticipates operational problems by studying operating targets, modes of operation, limitations & performance.

5) Improves operational quality results by studying, evaluating, and recommending process re-design; implementing changes; contributing information and opinion to improve productivity performance.

6) Provides operational management information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing operating and engineering data and trends.

7) Maintains safe and healthy work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures; complying with legal regulations.

8) Participate in reviewing Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health Risk Assessment to ensure its effectiveness.

9) Participate in investigation of EHS incident and recommend preventive measure.

10) Authorize to stop production relating to Safety, Environmental or Efficiency issue not complying to Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health Management System or Procedure.

11) Verify that solutions agreed for problems relating to non-conformities relating to product process and Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Healthsystem are implemented.

12) Review and recommend the disposition of the rejected in-coming raw material, work-in-process and finished goods.

13) Review and endorse Company Quality, Environmental, Safety and Health System Procedure.

14) Manage, coach and train the team members which include carrying out performance review and disciplinary action, if required.

15) Perform any other duties as assigned by the Management and the designated manager.

Requirements

1) Minimum ITE
a) Preferably in Fabrication / Civil Engineering
b) 5 years’ experience working as Engineer or 8 years’ as Technician in a manufacturing environment

2) Diploma in Engineering
a) Preferably in Fabrication / Civil Engineering
b) 2 years’ experience working as Engineer in a manufacturing environment

3) Preferably with knowledge of manufacturing and assembling of Precasting.

4) Knowledge of ISO 9001, 14001 & 45001 standards and AutoCAD will be advantages.

5) Knowledge in Safety Management is a must.

6) IT savvy with proficient in Microsoft Office application.

7) Possess leadership and supervisory skills with manpower planning experiences.

8) Possess problem-solving, analyzing and reporting skills.

9) Possess good interpersonal skills and excellent team spirit.

10) Independent with high level of initiative and fast learner.

11) Meticulous and positive attitude in learning.

title: IT Engineering Manager (People Manager)
company_info: PALO IT is a global innovation consultancy specialised in human-centered design, Agile software development and in the AI-driven transformation of large, forward-thinking companies. As a community of innovators, designers and technologists, we are committed to helping businesses embrace tech as a force for good. We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices across five continents, we are proud to be a B-Corp certified company in Singapore (the first tech company to do so!) and Hong Kong, and working towards certification across all other locations. To further our vision of bringing positive change to better our world, we are looking for a new team member to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, your happiness is our success. People are the heart of our organisation and the centre of everything we do. We constantly strive to provide the best employee experience, as well as cultivate a diverse, inclusive and multicultural work environment, with many opportunities where you grow professionally and personally.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity and open collaboration while having fun doing it.

Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Sydney, Hong Kong, Bangkok and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore.

At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more!
Our Vision and Values
We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organizations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good.
We care about our World
We act with Courage
We Share, it’s in our DNA
We choose Positivity
We Deliver Awesomeness
Your Profile & Role on the Project
YOU:
Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed?
Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now?
Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised?
Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats?
YOU AGAIN:
You will use your talents in software development, application architecture, design thinking and problem solving to help create rapid prototypes and enable the rapid acceleration of ideas. You will have outstanding interpersonal skills and the ability to manage client projects and build a high performing engineering team that consistently exceeds expectations. You will also work closely with project teams and business stakeholders and provide technical expertise that enables innovation.
Provide full-stack expertise to the engineering team and establish best practices on code quality and performance.
Lead and mentor engineers to deliver high-quality codes and projects.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and designers to build great applications.
Build confidence in our project delivery through automated testing, continuous integration, monitoring, and analytics.
Provide architecture-level and code-level feedback for the engineering team.
Shepherd technical decision-making process and provide technical roadmap and thought-leadership.
STILL YOU:
You are a creative individual with deep technological expertise, business acumen, and software development background. You must be able to communicate well with both internal and external parties with a good sense of idealism and pragmatism.
You are endlessly curious, a self-starter and able to quickly grasp and understand a wide variety of software environments and solutions.
You have done recruitment and have led/mentored an engineering team.
You are interested in designing scalable, reliable and secure software using a combination of different languages, frameworks, libraries and technical environments.
You have at least 2 years of hands-on experience in ReactJS and 10 years of experience in Frontend Javascript/CSS/ HTML (ES6, Angular, React, Vue, Redux) and Backend development using NodeJS, GoLang, .NET, Java, Spring, SpringBoot with 3 years of experience in client management. Experience in mobile development (Swift for IOS, Android, native or hybrid) is a bonus.
You have strong experience with dB design and application - both relational and NoSQL
You have in-depth experience in API development, using REST, GraphQL or SOAP.
You have deep experience with the developer toolchain, in particular, npm, SCSS/SASS, Webpack, Web Assembly, Bash, Ant, and the Command line.
You like to work in all phases of a rapid product development lifecycle: You are familiar with Agile Methodologies, Scrum, Kanban, and interested in learning more about Design Thinking, Lean Start-up, TDD, BDD, or XP.
Your role at PALO IT
You will be part of a project team working at various client sites, building or enhancing complex applications in the digital domain and serving as a touchstone for clients around agile development, best practices and emerging technologies. You will use your skills and experience to teach others and take advantage of opportunities to learn and improve your own skill sets.
You will also be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company. In addition, you will contribute to the social, environmental and purpose driven objectives and initiatives of PALO IT in order to positively impact our environment, customers, communities and ourselves as an organization and individual.

If you like what you just read, we’d love to have a chat with you!
We might not be able to get back to every applicant but we promise your application will be reviewed by one of our recruitment experts.
Protecting your privacy and the security of your data are longstanding top priorities for Palo-IT.

Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Palo-IT’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes.

Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.palo-it.com/en/privacy-policy) to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
Here you can find how you can request for access, correction and/or withdrawal of your Personal Data

title: Lead Product Manager
company_info: Grab is Southeast Asia’s leading superapp. We provide everyday services such as deliveries, mobility, financial services, enterprise services and others to millions of users across the region. Powered by technology and driven by heart, our mission is to drive Southeast Asia forward by creating economic empowerment for everyone. If this mission speaks to you, join our team today. Please proceed to Grab career page for submission of job application at http://grab.careers/
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.

Get to know the Team
As part of the Product Team, you will lead some of our highest impact, strategic projects. You will be responsible for raising the bar, delivering projects that require complex stakeholder management and coordination across multiple cross-functional teams. You will have the opportunity to help define the overall payments product strategy as we progress from application to launch and beyond. We like creative hustlers, people who can think outside the box, motivate and get stuff done even if it seems impossible. We work fast, push the boundaries, try new things and sometimes they don’t work, so we embrace failure and lifelong learning.

The Day-to-Day Activities
Gather requirements, conduct user research, and prioritize the product backlog to ensure the team is focused on delivering high-impact projects
Establish strong relationships with internal stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and challenges.
Oversee product launches, product marketing, and other go-to-market activities
Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring that the team's work is well-understood and well-supported.
The Must-Haves
7+ years of experience in product management, preferably with a focus on consumer-facing digital products or services.
Proven track record of successfully launching and scaling products.
Strong understanding of the Southeast Asian market, particularly in the context of the dine-in experience (preferably)
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to partner effectively with cross-functional teams.
Analytical mindset and experience using data-driven insights to inform product decisions.
Demonstrated ability to develop and execute go-to-market strategies.
Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Our Commitment
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

title: Product Manager - TikTok Digital Wallet
company_info: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

About the Team
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Digital Wallet Product Manager to join our team. As the Digital Wallet Product Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the development, strategy, and success of our digital wallet product. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, and customer support, to drive the roadmap, enhance user experience, and achieve business objectives for the digital wallet.

Responsibilities:
- Develop and execute the product strategy and roadmap for our digital wallet, align with the company's vision and goals and define key performance indicators (KPIs) and success metrics for the digital wallet, regularly monitoring and analyzing these metrics to measure product performance and identify areas for improvement.
- Conduct market research, competitive analysis, and gather customer feedback to identify user needs, market trends, and opportunities for innovation in the digital wallet space to drive innovation and competitive advantage.
- Create detailed product requirements, user stories, and specifications, ensuring clear communication to the engineering team. Work closely with the engineering team to ensure the successful implementation of features and deliver high-quality digital wallet solutions.
- Collaborate with the design team to create intuitive and user-friendly interfaces and experiences for the digital wallet, focusing on usability, accessibility, and visual aesthetics.
- Conduct user testing, usability studies, and A/B testing to validate product decisions and optimize the digital wallet experience.

Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., business, computer science, finance) is required. A master's degree is a plus.
- Proven experience as a Product Manager, specifically in managing digital wallet products or fintech products.
- Strong understanding of digital payment technologies, mobile wallets, and the fintech ecosystem.
- Experience in defining and executing product strategies and roadmaps, with a track record of successful product launches and enhancements.
- Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies and experience working in cross-functional teams.
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data and insights into actionable product improvements.
- Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively work with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
- Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage timelines, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
- Up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, emerging technologies, and design innovations in the digital wallet and fintech space.
- Experience with payment processing protocols, security standards, and regulatory compliance in the payments industry is a plus.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
